Name: Business Application Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOverviewThe Opportunity: Fisher Investments’ Business Intelligence Team is seeking a Business Application Analyst to help design and troubleshoot applications and facilitate efficient workflow processes. The ideal candidate is able to prioritize, keep track of details, learn new systems, juggle deadlines where needed, and solve problems on the fly. As a Business Application Analyst you’ll be responsible for the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of business applications using Microsoft Access. The Day to Day:Analyze and streamline business processes and organize information effectivelyProvide quick, innovative, yet sustainable solutions to meet evolving business needsRevise legacy processes and applications to address new challengesSupport our internal customers with outstanding serviceRecommend solutions when a business group or process has outgrown its existing solution and is ready for something moreYour Qualifications:A Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college / university or equivalent experienceIntermediate experience building forms and designing processes and workflow in Microsoft AccessExperience programming with Visual Basic for Applications and using SQL to query and manage informationA basic understanding of the principles and practices of project managementStrong analytical aptitude and ability to communicate what you know clearly and effectivelyWhy Fisher Investments: Fisher Investments is a different kind of investment firm. We don’t come from Wall Street, nor do we believe we fit in with most of the finance industry, and we’re proud of that. We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to innovative perspectives on investing, it’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. After all, it’s our people that enable us to offer the level of service that we do. And we invest in them accordingly, offering exceptional benefits like: 100% coverage of premiums for health, vision and dental insuranceA 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidaysAnd much, much more We also provide a cumulative, continuous learning and development framework customized for every employee. This emphasis on personal and professional growth has yielded an award-winning work environment; we’re Great Place to Work Certified, and The Oregonian named us as a 2017 and 2018 Top Workplace.  But in the end, it’s not the perks that keep people here. They stay because they believe in our mission of service—our employees want to make a difference in an industry that can do better.  * California employees accrue up to 17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time per year.  FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Job ID: 38136***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies*** Product Analyst Our client is seeking a Product Analyst to join their dynamic team in Hillsboro, OR. As a Product Analyst you will work towards enabling strategic enterprise capabilities across our client’s distribution center network to activate Consumer direct offense. You will support initiatives that enable our client to increase productivity, realize efficiencies and build profitable customer experiences. This candidate will be joining our client’s technology organization. They bring together technology and process expertise into one streamlined, consumer and customer-oriented team. This organization enables our client’s businesses and brands worldwide. Interest and experience in the latest methodologies goes a long way here and we're looking for people who are passionate about the world of value-driven solution delivery and support. In addition, you'll get to work within and alongside truly talented and cross-functional business and technology teams across the global and help them enhance their performance by promoting collaboration and innovation. You will be a member of an 8-10-person Agile Delivery Team that will utilize Agile principles.Product Analyst Responsibilities:  Participate in Program Increment (PI) planning sessions with the team’s Product Owner, Scrum Master, and other Product Analysts to understand the business vision and create plans and objectives for the upcoming PI. Work with the team during the PI on the backlog of work for each iteration delivering value in 2-week Agile Sprints. Have the technical capability, or are willing to learn, within each Sprint to: Deploy Manhattan WMOS to new and existing DCs. Utilize the Manhattan WMOS capabilities and customizations to deliver solutions for Business needs. Perform configuration within Manhattan WMOS 2017 package. Work with Manhattan associates to lead the design and development of new capabilities. Work with enterprise and solution architecture to deliver solutions that are compliant to next generation architecture. Serve as an escalation point and a subject matter expert to resolve business critical issues when needed. Perform functional testing of the WMS. Coordinate with other Agile Delivery teams to produce the successful implementation of end-to-end solutions via an Agile Release Train. Create technical documentation and system diagrams to document any enhancements to the product. Demo to the business team all work delivered within each Sprint. Participate in a retrospective at the end of the PI to determine ways to continuously improve. Ensure standards, processes, and policies are followed. Apply global process standards to regional technology solutions. Product Analyst Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science or a related field.  At least 6 years' experience in IT, business or a related field.  Work status to work in USA without the need for sponsorship. Ability to reside or commute to the beautiful Greater Portland area in Oregon. We are located in Beaverton/Hillsboro, OR. Exhibit the qualities of situational leadership as well as someone who can work with a team and pull the team forward to deliver business value. A Self-starter, who can learn on the job. A growth mindset and passion for lean and agile processes. Ability to adapt communication style across cultures. Must have experience with Distribution Centers and Warehouse Management Systems, experience with Manhattan WMoS is preferred. Experience in Slotting and Labor Management system is desired. Possess basic skills of database query and data analysis Basic knowledge of system integration concepts. Excellent analytical skills and the ability to translate business functionality and opportunities into clear, precise and easy-to-read functional specifications. Strong business acumen to quickly learn new business processes and understand how technology can support the business in achieving revenue and profit goals. Proven ability to pull a diverse group of individuals with different goals together and facilitate productive discussions. Flexible, ability to deal with ambiguity, and a demonstrated desire for continuous personal growth. Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical IT teams. Benefits Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k.About VanderHouwen  VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career. VanderHouwen is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. VanderHouwen does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal civil rights laws.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Review PERS Internal Audit IT Change Management 2014 Report containing recommendations and determining scope of work to resolve findings.Assess PERS IT Organization to identify existing processes and procedures, and re-categorized them into ITIL/ITSM terms.Understand the ITSM landscape of the Customer and understand in-scope ITIL processes to-be designed.Provide ITIL best practice service management consulting at a strategic, design, and operational level for PERS IT organization.Understand the specific process requirements and gather the required inputs on people, practices and processes, organization structure, ITIL tools in-use, as-is process, details on current vendors.Prepare the process definition plan, identify the reviewers and process sign-off mechanism.Author the process documents and obtain signed-off from the stakeholders (include the required process flows, diagrams) via PERS QCP.Collaborate with the staff in ISD as required to customize the ITSM tools in-scope.Identify KPIs/metrics to be used to measure the effectiveness of the process and the calculation mechanism of each of the KPIs/metrics.Provide the ITIL / ITSM training and mentoring to all staff resources as identified.Provide professional guidance over the IT Process Owners and overall IT strategic initiatives.8 - 12 YEARS experience in ITSM practice in managing various ITIL process roles, viz., Incident Manager, Problem Manager, Change Manager, Asset and/or Configuration ManagerExperience in Process designing and supervising execution in at least 2 ITSM engagementsITIL 2011 Expert / ITIL 2011 Intermediate CertifiedKnowledge of ITSM ToolsCapability to deliver ITIL Training and WorkshopsExcellent team management skills and inter-personal skillsExcellent presentation skills, verbal and written communication skills and facilitation skillsGood documentation and process flow diagramming skills

Name: Cloud Billing Analyst
Description: Cloud Billing Analyst - Vancouver Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.  Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation.” We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.  Centrally located in the heart of Gastown, the Vancouver office overlooks the City’s iconic Steam Clock and boasts amazing ocean and mountain views. Our open concept heritage office is outfitted with bean bags, foosball, darts, pool table, big screen TVs, and a well-stocked kitchen. See what it’s like to work in one of the world’s most livable cities!  A day in our Vancouver office!  We are looking for a talented Cloud Billing Analyst in our Vancouver office! The Cloud Billing Analyst will own the customer experience for enterprises that undertake our Billing Products from end-to-end. He/She will gather customer billing requirements, onboard the Billing Product in a smooth and seamless manner and deliver the service by assisting with customer service reviews, generating analytical reports and ensuring customers are knowledgeable of key concepts of public cloud billing and best practice in financial optimizations. How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?Own the delivery of customer billing workshops, explaining key concepts of public cloud billing and gathering of information required to facilitate a seamless onboarding to Cloudreach Billing ProductsTo own the onboarding process of customers undertaking Cloudreach Billing Products, working with Service Introduction Analysts and Cloud Engagement Managers where customers contract to receive multiple Cloudreach servicesTo assist with the administration of the Cloudreach Billing Service, ensuring the CRM system (Salesforce) contains all the necessary information to facilitate customer invoicingTo work with the wider Operations team, specifically Core Ops Analysts, to facilitate and deliver new Account Provisionings for Cloud Service Providers (CSP), ensuring these are complete under SLA and to customer requirementsBecome a subject-matter expert in Public Cloud Billing, developing an in-depth knowledge of the billing process for Cloud Service Providers (AWS and Azure), alongside the resale processTo own all escalations from customers of Cloudreach Billing Products, working with the Finance Team to investigate issues with invoices, ensuring that any changes are implemented and actionedTo produce analytical usage reports for external customers using tools such as the Cloud Billing System and/or CloudHealth, assisting with service reviews and providing support as necessary on these platformsTo develop an understanding of financial optimisations for the delivery of Cloudreach Billing ProductsTo act as an administrator for the Cloudreach Billing System (CBS), coordinating the continuous improvement and resolution of issues with the Product Development TeamWhere third party tools are used, such as CloudHealth, to facilitate and oversee the initial provisioning of these tools.Provide ongoing support and training on third party tools utilised for Cloudreach Billing Products, such as the CBS and CloudHealth, both internally and externallyAct as a focal point for facilitating CloudHealth accredited training for colleaguesOwn the completion of documentation on all things billing and related, building up a comprehensive source to share and disseminate information to the broader teamThis includes, for example, the on and off-boarding process, documenting common incidents and service requests and unique characteristics of Cloud Service Providers and their billing setupsDeveloping additional training material that explains key concepts of public cloud billing, the Cloudreach billing and invoicing process and an initial overview to financial optimizationTo identify improvements to processes and sharing feedback from customers on Cloudreach Billing Products with the designated OwnersHow to stand out?Analytical skills and aptitude with large datasets, spreadsheets and SQLAn understanding of cloud technologies and particularly commercial pricing models and billing structures from providers such as AWS, Microsoft and GoogleAn understanding and passion for exceptional customer serviceStrong written and oral communication skills, with the ability to adapt your style and language depending on the audienceConfident with undertaking customer meetings, reviews and delivering presentations as a subject-matter expertAn ability to explain key billing and cloud concepts to multiple stakeholdersAn ability to listen and gather customer requirementsAn ability to maintain relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, building relationships with both customers and partners alikeTo be firm but fair in the way that you manage the customer to not over or under deliver the serviceOrganizational skills and an ability to manage time requirements and prioritise requests from key customersA desire to develop or enhance your skills and knowledge of both cloud and tooling partnersWhat are our cloudy perks?MacBook Pro, big screen monitors, a super cool smartphone and health benefitsUncapped holidays..... Seriously! You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake!Spot bonus based on your and the company’s performanceCloudreach University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunitiesUnique ‘cloudy’ culture where we work hard and play hardFully stocked in-office kitchen and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday. There are also cool office amenities like beanbags, games like pool and foosball, and big screen TVsWorking with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere elseQuarterly meetings around North America and an annual kick off event in a cool secret destination BackYou Might Also Be Interested In… #VancouverCloud Billing AnalystCloud Operations#Vancouver Cloud Operations AnalystCloud Operations#EdinburghCloud Operations AnalystCloud Operations

Name: Technical Analyst, Healthcare Software Group - 2019 Start Date
Description: Position Summary:  We are looking for individuals with strong analytical skills and a passion for problem solving with technology. Our Analysts join us from a wide range of backgrounds and have immediate access to the training and coaching they need to drive impact and develop into the innovators and leaders of tomorrow. Technical Analysts spend majority of their time working in a fast-pace environment digging deep into the details of our software databases, business intelligence visualizations, configurations, and tools, gaining exposure to both functional client facing and technical aspects of Huron’s software solutions.  You can expect to work on a dynamic team focused not only on the needs of the client, but also on offering you opportunities that align with your interests and long-term career goals. Through your day-to-day responsibilities, you will enhance your analytical, communication, project management, and leadership skills, while directly impacting overall client and team goals with our collaborative technical solutions.  We pride ourselves on our inclusive company culture and the quality of character of our employees. The variety of backgrounds on our teams are what make our solutions successful and pushes our employees to be creative and innovative in their approach. We hold ourselves to the highest standards of professionalism in order to meet the high expectations of both our clients and ourselves. At Huron you can expect to make a positive difference and achieve your potential.  Qualifications:  - Passion for technology, with a genuine curiosity to learn and apply new concepts Strong analytical and technical skills; programming language experience is preferred, but not requiredStrong written and verbal communication skillsRequirements:Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, science, liberal arts, computer science, information systems, or other technology-related majorsStrong performance in your degree with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0Must be based in or willing to relocate to the Portland metro areaAbility to work independently and to work flexible hours as needed to support high-priority on-call support and scheduled maintenanceMust be authorized to permanently work in the United States without visa sponsorship now or in the future  About Huron:  At Huron, we’re redefining what a consulting organization can be. We go beyond advice to deliver results that last. We inherit our client’s challenges as if they were our own. We help them transform for the future. We advocate. We make a difference. And we intelligently, passionately, relentlessly do great work…together.  Are you the kind of person who stands ready to jump in, roll up your sleeves and transform ideas into action? Then come discover Huron.  Whether you have years of experience or come right out of college, we invite you to explore our many opportunities. Find out how you can use your talents and develop your skills to make an impact immediately. Learn about how our culture and values provide you with the kind of environment that invites new ideas and innovation. Come see how we collaborate with each other in a culture of learning, coaching, diversity and inclusion. And hear about our unwavering commitment to make a difference in partnership with our clients, shareholders, communities and colleagues.  Huron Consulting Group offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage to employees and dependents; a 401(k) plan with a generous employer match; an employee stock purchase plan; a generous Paid Time Off policy; and paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Our Wellness Program supports employee total well-being by providing free annual health screenings and coaching, bank at work, and on-site workshops, as well as ongoing programs recognizing major events in the lives of our employees throughout the year. All benefits and programs are subject to applicable eligibility requirements.  Huron is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity to job applicants and employees in recruitment, hiring, employment, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, training, and all other terms and conditions of employment. Huron will not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, religion, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, creed, citizenship or any other status protected by laws or regulations in the locations where we do business. We endeavor to maintain a drug-free workplace.LI:

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Salary: $65K-$75K DOE Industry: Hospitality What Matters Most:3 years of experience in budgeting, analytics, and/or strategic planningProficiency in MS Excel requiredBachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance-related program required; Master’s degree preferredCFA a plusYour New Role:We’re on the hunt for a savvy Financial Analyst to contribute their unique ideas and industry expertise to a leading development group headquartered in Southwest Portland. You’ll participate in all developmental areas, effectively streamlining the business and helping the company build on 23 years of success. Go-getters and hard workers need apply! Your primary responsibilities will revolve around strategic planning and process improvement, as you’ll work to identify opportunities and drive enhancements. Instead of learning process, you’ll be creating it!  To succeed here, you’ll need plenty of experience with budgets and financial statements and solid communication techniques that allow you to clearly articulate complex information in presentations, reports, narratives, and outlines. You’ll oversee all aspects of cash flow, fixed assets, procurement, and capital expenditures and translate all findings into curated deliverables. This meaty role will also require you to analyze variances between expenditures and budget , forecast for revenue and overhead projects, and make presentations to the C-Suite, board, and external shareholders. If you’re resourceful, organized, and possess a strong orientation towards great customer service, you’re exactly the candidate our client needs!Your New Organization:This company has led the pack for over two decades and now is your time to get in as they continue to grow and expand. Theirs is a culture of trust and respect – think start-up but with a ton of backing and support. They’re looking to add someone to their team who has the type of entrepreneurial mind that syncs up with their innovative style. Teamwork, camaraderie, and fun are all part of the package! If you’re hired, look forward to amazing benefits that include benefits will include medical and dental coverage, a 401(k) plus match, and life and disability insurance. If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your email to financial@bolywelch.com. Already a Boly:Welch candidate? Please connect directly with your recruiter to discuss this opportunity. Category: Financial Services

Name: Business Analyst 3
Description: Company/Position OverviewSalient CRGT is a leading provider of health, data analytics, cloud, agile software development, mobility, cyber security, and infrastructure solutions. We support these core capabilities with full lifecycle IT services and training—to help our customers meet critical goals for pivotal missions. We are purpose-built for IT transformation supporting federal civilian, defense, homeland, and intelligence agencies, as well as Fortune 1000 companies.  This contract Business Analyst 3 position is located in Bonneville Power Administration’s (BPA’s) Transmission Technology Application Services (TTS) organization and will provide support for projects under the Transmission Technology Application Services Program. The position will guide business stakeholders and facilitate gathering and analyzing information using standard tools and approaches to: help clarify business operations, functions, perform gap analysis, document/map the current and future states, identify solution alternatives, evaluate the alternatives, and define processes. In addition, this position concentrates on collecting and analyzing data, analyzing workflow, and developing process analysis and decision support information and documents. This position will also assist the Application Services Manager and Supervisors in overall Transmission Technology organizational analysis, strategy, and development.  Real Time Control Systems is responsible for the planning, procurement, engineering and development, integration, modification, or operation and maintenance of systems used to provide safe and reliable real-time control, dispatch, analysis, management, and protection of the transmission system. These systems, typically located within the system operations control centers, are used for 24 x 7 support of the power system. To ensure continued reliability, the Real Time Control Systems organization also provides planning and management of control center projects and the support services required to ensure consistent and compliant deliverables. Name: Senior Business Analyst, Digital Analytics
Description: As the Enterprise Digital Analytics team, we empower First Tech business leaders to drive differentiating member experiences and business value by leveraging information and insights. We are the center of excellence responsible to help First Tech to become a fully data-driven organization. Key responsibilities of our team include data governance, business intelligence, enterprise data warehouse, advanced analytics, and business enablement of data analytics.  Here's what you can expect from the job and what you need to be successful: Job dutiesEngage with business units and stakeholders to define scope of effort, work deliverables, and project plans and help resolve/escalate issues as needed to successfully deliver project(s)Provide statistical and analytical support to key stakeholders, managers, and executives by creating institutional and ad-hoc reportsProvide expert advice in the usage and interpretation of data for assigned business area(s)Define metrics to drive the business forward and turn data into valuable insights by leveraging creative solutions; communicate insights to key stakeholdersAssist in verifying correctness and completeness of the data model, data relationships, mappings and definitions for the functional business area.Recommend improvements to existing business analysis and interpretation of data by business usersConsult and enable power users to build reports, dashboards and visualizations and other times, build complex solutions for cross-functional initiativesAssist with the design and build of a business data layer, semantic layer to support the business community in working with EDW dataEssential skillsMinimum 7 years of experience as BI/Data Analyst required, preferably in a financial organizationAdvanced SQL skills requiredExperience with common business intelligence and data visualization tools, such as Tableau, OBIEE, BOBJ, etc.Experience with data preparation tools such as Alteryx and Datawatch with some experience working with star schemas– facts and dimensionsStrong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing prioritiesExperience partnering with a geographically diverse team composed of full-time staff and consultantsExcellent communication skills, including an ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical staff and executivesProven ability to build consensus across multiple stakeholder groups through partnershipHigh degree of proficiency utilizing all Microsoft Office productsBachelor's Degree in an accredited program for Business, Mathematics and/or statisticsLocation: Hillsboro, OR 97124 First Tech is not currently offering Visa sponsorship or transfers I acknowledge that if hired by the company, employment is on an at-will basis. This means the company is free to terminate my employment at any time, with or without cause or advance notice. Similarly, I am free to terminate my employment with the company at any time for any reason. I agree to conform to the rules and regulations of the company, and I understand that the company has complete discretion to modify such rules and regulations at any time, except that it will not modify its policy of employment at-will.

Name: eComm Web Analyst
Description: The  Web Analyst will work with internal and external clients to provide  recommendations and drive eCommerce optimizations and insights. This position  requires the analyst to have knowledge in web analytics, with a consulting and  business savvy focus. The analyst will leverage their analytical skills to  develop dashboards, reporting products and ultimately insights that solve business  problems. This position will report work collaboratively with various cross  functional teams including operations, marketing, merchandising, planning, and  relevant stakeholders to drive eCommerce excellence and efficiency.Responsibilities:Maintain daily and weekly dashboards.  Participate in weekly business reviews meetings. Identify traffic trends,  abandonment issues and opportunities for improving site conversion rates.  Provide strategic insights and recommendations to increase site conversion and  drive site improvements.Provide monthly/quarterly deep dive  analysis of the Ecommerce business. Provide a holistic summary of performance  and takeaways that take into consideration all device types, marketing  programs, merchandising strategies, and promotions. Summarize and present  findings to various management levels.Collaborate with members of the Ecommerce  team including Site Managers, Marketing, Merchandising, and Planning to provide  analytic support to measure performance of efforts. Guide end-users in  identifying key performance indicators for their areas and then build  appropriate reporting that provides insight into the performance of initiatives  and approaches within each area.Coordination and analysis of product  recommendations and specific site personalization testsOversee all web analytics tools to ensure  accurate implementation and appropriate level of exposure, adoption, and  utilizationOwn the maintenance of ongoing metrics,  reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisionsStay informed about, communicate, and  apply current or new trends and best practices in web analyticsDevelop processes and methodologies to  automate reporting, where possiblePrioritize all ad hoc reporting requests  based on potential business valueRequirements:Bachelor’s  degree in business or quantitative field preferably in Business, Marketing,  Finance, Statistics, or quantitative field.5+  years web analytics experience using Adobe Analytics/Omniture, Coremetrics,  Web Trends, Tealeaf, and Google Analytics or like web  analytic tools is required.Experience  with A/B, multivariate and other forms of web usability testing. Use of  Adobe Test & Target a plusDemonstrate  analytical and quantitative skills and ability to use hard data and  metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases.Strong  critical thinking skills.Strong  business acumen and ability to understand business/technical requirements  for analysis purposesStrong  ability to interpret data and make actionable business recommendationsA  curious nature with a desire to understand and master new ecommerce  techniques and strategiesConduct testing of developed website, tagging and mobile sites  during the development phase.Conduct Quality Assurance testing before implementation (for the  above development types)Provide consultative direction, and enforce best practices and  standards. Analyze web analytics data to answer ad-hoc business questionsExperience implementing Adobe analytics suite of products (on both  websites and mobile apps)Experience with Tag Management Systems (Preferably Adobe DTM or  Launch)Expert knowledge of JS/Jquery is a MUST (8+ years)Ability  to manage time, priorities and multiple deadlines in a fast-paced  environment This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.  EEO/AA Employer/Vets/Disabled/Race/Ethnicity/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Age  OTS-COL

Name: Oracle Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Description Please note that sponsorship is not available for this role at this time and my client is not set up to handle work visas.  Senior Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) Business Analyst.  This is a full-time role working in Portland, Oregon with very limited travel (0-2 weeks per year). Name: Business Analyst 3
Description: Company/Position OverviewSalient CRGT is a leading provider of health, data analytics, cloud, agile software development, mobility, cyber security, and infrastructure solutions. We support these core capabilities with full lifecycle IT services and training—to help our customers meet critical goals for pivotal missions. We are purpose-built for IT transformation supporting federal civilian, defense, homeland, and intelligence agencies, as well as Fortune 1000 companies.  This contract Business Analyst 3 position is located in Bonneville Power Administration’s (BPA’s) Transmission Technology Application Services (TTS) organization and will provide support for projects under the Transmission Technology Application Services Program. The position will guide business stakeholders and facilitate gathering and analyzing information using standard tools and approaches to: help clarify business operations, functions, perform gap analysis, document/map the current and future states, identify solution alternatives, evaluate the alternatives, and define processes. In addition, this position concentrates on collecting and analyzing data, analyzing workflow, and developing process analysis and decision support information and documents. This position will also assist the Application Services Manager and Supervisors in overall Transmission Technology organizational analysis, strategy, and development.  Real Time Control Systems is responsible for the planning, procurement, engineering and development, integration, modification, or operation and maintenance of systems used to provide safe and reliable real-time control, dispatch, analysis, management, and protection of the transmission system. These systems, typically located within the system operations control centers, are used for 24 x 7 support of the power system. To ensure continued reliability, the Real Time Control Systems organization also provides planning and management of control center projects and the support services required to ensure consistent and compliant deliverables. Additional responsibilities include ensuring that these critical systems conform to appropriate industry and regulatory requirements and participating in and supporting the development of applicable Name: Technical Analyst, Healthcare Software Group - 2019 Start Date
Description: Position Summary:  We are looking for individuals with strong analytical skills and a passion for problem solving with technology. Our Analysts join us from a wide range of backgrounds and have immediate access to the training and coaching they need to drive impact and develop into the innovators and leaders of tomorrow. Technical Analysts spend majority of their time working in a fast-pace environment digging deep into the details of our software databases, business intelligence visualizations, configurations, and tools, gaining exposure to both functional client facing and technical aspects of Huron’s software solutions.  You can expect to work on a dynamic team focused not only on the needs of the client, but also on offering you opportunities that align with your interests and long-term career goals. Through your day-to-day responsibilities, you will enhance your analytical, communication, project management, and leadership skills, while directly impacting overall client and team goals with our collaborative technical solutions.  We pride ourselves on our inclusive company culture and the quality of character of our employees. The variety of backgrounds on our teams are what make our solutions successful and pushes our employees to be creative and innovative in their approach. We hold ourselves to the highest standards of professionalism in order to meet the high expectations of both our clients and ourselves. At Huron you can expect to make a positive difference and achieve your potential.  Qualifications:  - Passion for technology, with a genuine curiosity to learn and apply new concepts Strong analytical and technical skills; programming language experience is preferred, but not requiredStrong written and verbal communication skillsRequirements:Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, science, liberal arts, computer science, information systems, or other technology-related majorsStrong performance in your degree with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0Must be based in or willing to relocate to the Portland metro areaAbility to work independently and to work flexible hours as needed to support high-priority on-call support and scheduled maintenanceMust be authorized to permanently work in the United States without visa sponsorship now or in the future  About Huron:  At Huron, we’re redefining what a consulting organization can be. We go beyond advice to deliver results that last. We inherit our client’s challenges as if they were our own. We help them transform for the future. We advocate. We make a difference. And we intelligently, passionately, relentlessly do great work…together.  Are you the kind of person who stands ready to jump in, roll up your sleeves and transform ideas into action? Then come discover Huron.  Whether you have years of experience or come right out of college, we invite you to explore our many opportunities. Find out how you can use your talents and develop your skills to make an impact immediately. Learn about how our culture and values provide you with the kind of environment that invites new ideas and innovation. Come see how we collaborate with each other in a culture of learning, coaching, diversity and inclusion. And hear about our unwavering commitment to make a difference in partnership with our clients, shareholders, communities and colleagues.  Huron Consulting Group offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage to employees and dependents; a 401(k) plan with a generous employer match; an employee stock purchase plan; a generous Paid Time Off policy; and paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Our Wellness Program supports employee total well-being by providing free annual health screenings and coaching, bank at work, and on-site workshops, as well as ongoing programs recognizing major events in the lives of our employees throughout the year. All benefits and programs are subject to applicable eligibility requirements.  Huron is fully committed to providing equal employment opportunity to job applicants and employees in recruitment, hiring, employment, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, training, and all other terms and conditions of employment. Huron will not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, religion, veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, creed, citizenship or any other status protected by laws or regulations in the locations where we do business. We endeavor to maintain a drug-free workplace.LI:

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Salary: $65K-$75K DOE Industry: Hospitality What Matters Most:3 years of experience in budgeting, analytics, and/or strategic planningProficiency in MS Excel requiredBachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance-related program required; Master’s degree preferredCFA a plusYour New Role:We’re on the hunt for a savvy Financial Analyst to contribute their unique ideas and industry expertise to a leading development group headquartered in Southwest Portland. You’ll participate in all developmental areas, effectively streamlining the business and helping the company build on 23 years of success. Go-getters and hard workers need apply! Your primary responsibilities will revolve around strategic planning and process improvement, as you’ll work to identify opportunities and drive enhancements. Instead of learning process, you’ll be creating it!  To succeed here, you’ll need plenty of experience with budgets and financial statements and solid communication techniques that allow you to clearly articulate complex information in presentations, reports, narratives, and outlines. You’ll oversee all aspects of cash flow, fixed assets, procurement, and capital expenditures and translate all findings into curated deliverables. This meaty role will also require you to analyze variances between expenditures and budget , forecast for revenue and overhead projects, and make presentations to the C-Suite, board, and external shareholders. If you’re resourceful, organized, and possess a strong orientation towards great customer service, you’re exactly the candidate our client needs!Your New Organization:This company has led the pack for over two decades and now is your time to get in as they continue to grow and expand. Theirs is a culture of trust and respect – think start-up but with a ton of backing and support. They’re looking to add someone to their team who has the type of entrepreneurial mind that syncs up with their innovative style. Teamwork, camaraderie, and fun are all part of the package! If you’re hired, look forward to amazing benefits that include benefits will include medical and dental coverage, a 401(k) plus match, and life and disability insurance. If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your email to financial@bolywelch.com. Already a Boly:Welch candidate? Please connect directly with your recruiter to discuss this opportunity. Category: Financial Services

Name: Business Systems Analyst II, Master Data (Supply Chain)
Description: Business Systems Analyst II, Master Data (Supply Chain)Hillsboro  Oregon,  United States of AmericaJob ID: 201807-115285Download PDF Apply For This JobReturn to Search Results  The PositionSummary: Position is responsible for the development, maintenance and advancement of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system master data used by Hillsboro Technical Operations. Successful candidates will represent the department as a subject matter expert and liaison between a variety of key internal and external stakeholders to maintain the integration between SAP other business and paper based systems. The successful candidate will be adept at leading cross-functional teams in problem identification and resolution and driving quantifiable business results. They will represent the department in interactions with the global business process management community and will proactively identify areas for improvement. They will be relied upon to work collaboratively and independently to solve emerging challenges inherent to project and system implementations. To this end, the successful candidate must also demonstrate competency and interest in broader aspects of Drug Substance and Drug Product, including; manufacturing, materials management, master production scheduling, capacity management, detailed scheduling, and quality. Job ResponsibilitiesScope of Work - The Business Analyst will be responsible for leading and implementing the Master Data business process, and collaborate with multiple functions to manage the entire lifecycle of data (Define, deploy, mature, update and retire data). They will lead the data management process to enable planning and execution, utilizing their extensive business and technical knowledge to drive resolution to data issues. Responsibilities of this position include:Be an expert on the Master Data business process. Lead and support the business process as required, including training others and supporting continuous improvementDevelop SAP Master data for load into system and evaluate impacts to other business systemsSupport site readiness to plan and be ready for executionProvide technical solutions to a variety of problems of varying scope and complexityCoordinate and lead Data Strategy meetings with site and network representativesAdhere to change management processes to ensure data is deployed and maintained in a controlled mannerProvide analysis and reporting of data to manage key performance indicatorsTranslate business requirements to technical specifications and collaborate with key stakeholders to complete requestsDevelop solutions that are imaginative, thorough, practical, and consistent with organization’s objectivesProvide training on usage, enhancements and changes to business systemsParticipates in developing courses of action that may impact multiple functions in the organizationNetworks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. implementation of improvement initiatives.Key team member on Business Systems Integration (BSI) TeamWork is performed under limited direction and guidance, with general instructions on new assignments.Job Requirements:B.A. or B.S. degree with 5 to 7 years work experience in the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical or related industry, or a Master’s Degree with 3-5 years relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Experience with ERP systems Recipe Development, Master Data and Detailed SchedulingFull use and application of basic Supply Chain/Business Process/cGMP theories, principles, and techniquesPossess strong analytical skills and understanding of systems and technical designsKnowledge of cGMPs and equivalent regulationsDemonstrated ability to effectively interpret Quality standards for implementationDemonstrated ability to manage small projects from initiation to delivery to achieve measurable resultsDemonstrated ability to independently evaluate situations and propose potential solutionsDemonstrated ability to communicate clearly and professionally both in writing and verballyDemonstrated ability to quickly learn a broad range of skillsFlexibility in problem solving and work hours to meet business objectives and dynamic production requirements Preferences: Experience in GMP Biopharmaceutical production facility.Demonstrated project management skillsExperience with SAPExperience with MES or other SAP interfacing Business SystemsAPICS CPIM certificationWork Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious  illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees  are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.  The next step is yours. Name: Business Planning Analyst
Description: At HP, talent is our criteria. Join us in reinventing the standard for diversity and inclusion. Bring your awesomeness, and just be you!  HP is a proven leader in personal systems and printing, delivering innovations that empower people to create, interact, and inspire like never before. We leverage our strong financial position to extend our leadership in traditional markets and invest in exciting new technologies.  HP has an impressive portfolio and strong innovation pipeline across areas such as: blended reality technology - our unique Sprout by HP will change the way people do things3D printingmulti-function printingInk in the officetablets, phablets, notebooksmobile workstations Our Supplies organization is a key partner and we are looking for talented professionals to join our team.  We are looking for a Business Planning Analyst to provide analytics and forecasting expertise to drive the long term ink supplies forecast system and models using market sizing knowledge, market share understanding, business and investment strategies, region engagement, channel strategies, and product portfolio plans.  The Business planning manager is a global role and involves managing the business data and models to help shape and optimize the business strategy. Responsibilities:Develop, refine and implement ongoing improvement of the forecast models and systems that increase forecast accuracy and maintain forecast accuracy excellence.Accountable for the global engagement from factory to country teamsIdentification and development of metrics/benchmarks and provide insights behind the information in the future projections.Analyze metrics such as Route to Market, sell through, business seasonality, inventory, and sell through and forecast accuracy, to drive action planning.Act as business advisor on insights and potential strategic and tactical actions from analysis and projections.Engage with regions, product marketing, finance, and supply chain teams.Education and Experience Required: Typically 4-6 years experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area. First level university degree. Knowledge and Skills:Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage complex data requests.Excellent analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques to develop creative approaches to business analysis.Extensive knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.Strong business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.Very strong verbal and written communication skills.Strong project management skills.Developed relationship management skills.Ability to lead cross-functional teams.Ability to identify and summarize relevant trends from market and industry data. #LI-POSTSDL2017

Name: Cloud Operations Analyst
Description: Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.  Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation.” We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.  Centrally located in the heart of Gastown, the Vancouver office overlooks the City’s iconic Steam Clock and boasts amazing ocean and mountain views. Our open concept heritage office is outfitted with bean bags, foosball, darts, pool table, big screen TVs, and a well-stocked kitchen. See what it’s like to work in one of the world’s most livable cities! Check out A Day in our Vancouver Office! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H2sBKfFWP5Q&t=13s What does the Cloud Operations team do ? Cloud Operations is our team of super-human Engineers and Analysts who support our customer’s cloud infrastructure as a managed service.  We have an awesome Bi-Modal service that offers our customers peace of mind with enterprise level, ITIL driven support, as well as offer all the agile, funky advantages that DevOps and Automation provides. They get their hands dirty across a wide range of technologies including AWS, Azure, Linux, MS SQL, Chef, Splunk, Lambda and many more. How will you spend your days? The Operations Analyst’s main role is to delight our customers by helping resolve issues in a timely manner, always engaging in a cloudy way. You will act as the first point of contact for our customers, triaging calls and delegating tasks to the various teams within Cloud Operations. You will also get the opportunity to action a large portion of these calls to empower you to build your technical knowledge base, quickly up skill and work with our talented team of engineers. You'll be responsible for:Creating a fantastic experience for our Ops customers, ensuring they are receiving the top-tier service that they are paying forActing as the first point of contact for all our customer support needs and queriesTriaging customer calls efficiently and delegating tasks to the Core Operations team when necessaryCompiling service reviews for our customers and ensuring all services provided are in-line with the terms of Service ContractsTaking ownership of your personal development by working closely with the Core Ops engineers in focused sprintsDocumenting procedures in the Cloudreach wiki to enhance knowledge sharingAssisting with the creation and application of training plans for new Analysts, Graduates, Interns, and Engineers, especially in relation to internal processWhat do we look for?Be an optimistic, pragmatic and proactive individual who really enjoys providing customer serviceDedicated to ITIL best practicesCompetency with Windows and Linux systemsExperience working in an Operational/Support Team role is a big plusAbility to interact confidently with customers via, phone, email, and in face-to-face meetingsHave a genuine interest in cloud technology and how it can enhance our business, customers’ businesses, and the IT industryBe a skillful communicator (spoken and written English, other International languages are a plus)Most of all, be great cloudy fit! Someone who gets along great with the team and is easy to work withWhat are our cloudy perks?MacBook Pro, big screen monitors, a super cool smartphone and health benefitsUncapped holidays..... Seriously! You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake!Spot bonus based on your and the company’s performanceCloudreach University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunitiesUnique ‘cloudy’ culture where we work hard and play hardFully stocked in-office kitchen and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday. There are also cool office amenities like beanbags, games like pool and foosball, and big screen TVsWorking with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere elseQuarterly meetings around North America and an annual kick off event in a cool secret destination BackYou Might Also Be Interested In… #VancouverCloud Billing AnalystCloud Operations#Vancouver Cloud Operations AnalystCloud Operations#EdinburghCloud Operations AnalystCloud Operations

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job ID: 38066***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies***  Data Analyst Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their dynamic team in Beaverton, OR. The Data Analyst supports our client’s Distribution Center of Excellence with data analysis, process analysis, performance analysis, and business insights to drive continuous improvement efforts and build a supply chain that is reliable, efficient, fast, and flexible. Data Analyst Responsibilities: Be the connection between analytics and the Performance Management 2.0 initiative.  Build, maintain, and elevate tools that enable performance management.  Engineer data (source it, bring meaning to it, and improve its quality).  Develop metrics / KPIs for performance management and visualization.  Collaborate closely with the development team to build enterprise solutions. Data Analyst Qualifications: BA or higher in a numerical, scientific, or computationally based qualification.  Minimum of 2-3 years’ relevant experience in a commercial environment.  Experience in supply chain/logistics, especially warehouse management systems.  Technically proficient in relevant solutions and tools including COGNOS, Tableau, SQL, Alteryx, Python, Snowflake, Excel, etc.  Proven aptitude to sift through data, identify critical information, analyze, develop a hypothesis and make recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences.  Strong problem-solving capability to tackle complicated issues.  Effective communication and strong interpersonal skills, with the capacity to interact with all levels in the organization.  Bias for action, drive for results while demonstrating positive attitude and enthusiasm.  Curious and ambitious.  A passion for retail, the consumer, data, and driving actions through insights. Preferred Qualifications: Experience working within agile methodology.  Experience in big data environments and data architecture.  Experience designing metrics/KPIs.  Project management experience.  Experience in a Data and Reporting Organization.  Strong visual communication skills, especially dashboards and presentations. Benefits Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k. About VanderHouwen VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.

Name: Applications Business Analyst
Description: The Applications Business Analyst role reports to the Applications Business Partner in IT. They are responsible for ensuring the daily issues are resolved by Wipro, suggesting new/improved ways to use the applications, eliciting and documenting data and system requirements, incorporating upstream and downstream impacts into system changes, creating technical documentation to clearly communicate system changes to Wipro, and providing guidance and support to the business for testing and documentation of changes. Major activities: -Own and develop a strong working relationship with business counterparts (people reporting to the business lead) -Manage business expectations to help them focus on the needed requirements -Help the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support that future -Advocate for the business using systems to help automate business processes -Educate business on best use of standard functionality to address business needs -Elicit, organize and document clear requirements from the business team -Identify, explore, document, and report all options to address a business need, including pros/cons of each option that will assist in the decision process -Validate requirements are successfully met with system configuration and or enhancements -Guide the business to create and execute test scenarios that effectively confirm a configuration or enhancement really meets the needs -Understand upstream and downstream impacts of changes in their defined area -Drive discussions with other affected groups to address upstream and downstream impacts for the ultimate purpose of defining an acceptable solution for all groups -Lead the business to effectively document changes into their overall business process -Translate requirements from business language to system language (liaison between business and Wipro functional lead) -Understand the data usage in their business groups -Help IT Applications Business Partner capture and document data elements and definitions -Document new and changed reporting requirements and share them with the functional lead and technical team -Test all functional changes (configuration, new solutions, reports) prior to business testing -Escalate issues that prevent decision making or execution of system or process changes -Assist Wipro functional support leads with issue resolution -Follow all SOX and IT policies for initiating and documenting system changes -Escalate any identified policy or system configuration risks to IT Applications Business Partner or Applications Technology Lead -Drive business decisions and changes in all areas of Leads to Order cycle -Develop specifications and assist in development and maintenance of interfaces between EBS and other internal and external systems including CRM, EDI, GTM Required Skills / Qualifications:Bachelor DegreeMinimum of 5 years experience working with Order Management module of Oracle EBSMinimum of 5 years experience working with CRM technologiesMinimum of 5 years developing specifications and assisting in development and maintenance of interfaces between CRM, EBS and other external systemsPreferred Skills / Qualifications:Experience in the Semiconductor IndustryExperience with Oracle Sales Cloud and Oracle CPQ Cloud (formerly Big Machines) Familiarity with SQL, Tableau, OBIEEFamiliarity with EDI order and sales order acknowledgement transactionsExperience working in an Integrated systems environmentDemonstrable leadership and facilitation skillsBusiness case development, including cost/benefit analysisGood expectation settingStrong written and verbal communication skillsGood understanding of the end to end business process and their area’s impact on that processExpertise working with outsourced/offshore partnersExperience working with global teams across geographies  Go Beyond. www.superiorjobs.com.EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Disabled / Veterans / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity.

Name: MANAGEMENT ANALYST (TITLE 32)
Description: Videos Duties Help  Help  Duties  Summary This National Guard position is for a MANAGEMENT ANALYST (TITLE 32), Position Description Number D2377000 and is part of the Oregon National Guard 142nd Fighter Wing, National Guard. This position is a Title 32 Excepted Service - Military position. Oregon Air National Guard military service is a condition of employment.Learn more about this agencyResponsibilities As a MANAGEMENT ANALYST (TITLE 32), GS-0343-9, this position is located in the Maintenance Group of an Air National Guard (ANG) flying Wing. The primary purpose of this position is to evaluate and manage the Wing's Aviation Petroleum, Oil & Lubrication (AVPOL) program; serves as the Wing Refueling Document Control Officer (WRDCO); manages all aspects of the Unit's Flying Hour Program funds; and provides support to the supply functions within the Group. Formulates and consolidates budget inputs, trend analysis, and execution evaluations of all Maintenance Group funding requirements. Serves as the primary point of contact for unit Aviation Petroleum, Oil, and Lubricants (AVPOL) program. Monitors AVPOL consumption to determine the rate of usage against command standards. Ensures the accuracy of billing conducted within the scope of the AVPOL program IAW AFI 11-253, Managing Off-Station Purchases of Aviation Fuel and Ground Services. Reconciles Defense Energy Support Center (DESC) interfund-billing/AIR Card® transactions with the AVPOL Data Management System.Identifies and validates requisitions from base organizations for the non-stock listed, sole source or technical order (T.O.) directed flying hour goods or services. Routinely coordinates with the Base Contracting Office, National Guard Bureau (NGB), DOD Logistics Centers and commercial sources to identify the source of supply being most advantageous to the Government. Coordinates the movement of assets to and from Wing maintenance organizations.Consolidates annual maintenance operating budgets for incorporation into the overall Wing's annual financial plan. Performs in-depth analysis of financial plan for all Maintenance Group production squadrons, flights, and sections. Evaluates trends and operating costs which are used in projecting future obligations. Performs analysis of completeness, accuracy, and reasonableness of all Maintenance Group operating budgetary information. Develops/issues guidance and coordinates with Maintenance Production Squadron Chiefs in the development of quarterly and annual maintenance operating budget and budget estimates.Perform other duties as assigned.*The above description only mentions a limited amount of the position's official duties. For a full comprehensive document that covers all the duties of the position, please contact one of the Recruitment Specialist at the bottom of the announcement.* Travel RequiredOccasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position. Supervisory statusNo Promotion Potential9 Job family (Series)0343 Management And Program Analysis Similar jobs  Analysts, Management Command And Control Center Officers Command And Control Center Specialists Command And Control Officers Command Center Officers Financial Specialists, All Other Requirements Help  Help  Requirements  Conditions of Employment National Guard Membership is required. This is an excepted service position that requires membership in a compatible military assignment in the National Guard. Selectee will be required to wear the military uniform.Males born after 31 December 1959 must be registered for Selective Service.Federal employment suitability as determined by a background investigation.May be required to successfully complete a probationary period.Must be able to obtain/maintain a Secret Security clearance.Participation in direct deposit is mandatory.Must have valid state drivers license.Military Grades: EnlistedCompatible Military Assignments: 2S0X1, 2R0X1, 2R1X1, 2W0X1, 8U000. Current possession of a compatible AFSC is not a requirement to be considered for this position, but must be obtained within one year from the date of hire. QualificationsAREAS OF CONSIDERATION: Area 1 - Current permanent or conditional Title 32 Technicians of the Oregon ANG.  Area 2 - Current permanent or conditional Title 5 Employees of the Oregon ANG.  Area 3 - Current service members in the Oregon ANG.  Area 4 - Individuals in the Active Duty US Air Force, Air Force Reserve, or Air National Guard who hold or have held the AFSC.  Area 5 - US Citizens eligible to meet the military requirements for membership in the Oregon ANG. GENERAL and SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Your submitted documents will be reviewed for the competencies, knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to perform the job duty listed above. Within your resume you will need to detail your capabilities. You will need to demonstrate 24 months of experience which has shown work involved in developing, analyzing, evaluating, advising, or improving the effectiveness of work methods and procedures, organizations, manpower utilization, distribution of work assignments, management controls, and similar functions of management. Experience, education, or training in administrative, professional, investigative, technical or other responsible work which demonstrates analytical ability and a practical and theoretical knowledge of the functions, processes and principles of management. Experience using computer and automation systems along with the detailed specialized experience related to this position.  A review of your qualifications will be conducted to determine if you are qualified for this job. Qualified candidates will be assigned to a quality category. The quality categories are: Highly Qualified: Candidates in this category possess exceptional skills and experience to exceed well above the minimum requirements for this position.Well Qualified: Candidates in this category possess good skills and experience above the minimum requirements for this position.Qualified: Candidates in this category meet the minimum education and/or experience requirements for this position. Your rating will be based on both your entire application package as well as the responses to the assessment questionnaire. Please note that if, after reviewing your resume and or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and or experience, your category rating can and will be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities, or you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your eligibility.  In order to qualify for this position you must: Submit complete resume and other required supporting documentation as necessary. EducationThis job does not have an education qualification requirement.

Name: Senior Consultant – Business Analyst
Description: Percipio Consulting Group is a provider of operational improvement, risk management and business-technology integration consulting. Percipio helps clients to identify and assess business improvement opportunities, and manage change initiatives which effectively ‘operationalize’ business strategy through process and technology solutions. Founded in 2001, Percipio has delivered business-critical engagements for Fortune 500 and emerging companies alike, in industries ranging from Energy to Manufacturing to Footwear and Apparel. Percipio is headquartered in Portland, Oregon.JOB DESCRIPTIONPercipio is seeking talented and entrepreneurial individuals to join in our success. Senior Consultants will apply business consulting skills to help leading client organizations tackle complex business challenges. The Business Analyst will, as part of a team, participate in identifying client challenges, developing process and technical solutions and assisting in the implementation of change in order to create greater efficiency and success for the client’s expectations. The Business Analyst essentially acts as a bridge between the end user to the functional implementation of technical solutions.RequireMENTS Strong business acumen – Ability to understand business fundamentals and implications of changeProven experience in process evaluation and business analysis in more than one area, such as operations, finance, supply chain, technology integration, IT auditing, architecture or ERPProven ability to follow project plans and benchmarksKnowledge of Software Development Life CycleExperience interacting with business stakeholders and subject matter experts in order to understand their problems and needsExperience gathering, documenting and analyzing business needs and requirementsExperience facilitating process design sessions and documenting business process and organizational role definitionExperience with formal process engineering or process improvement methodologyExperience documenting use cases and test scriptsKnowledge of project tracking and reportingExperience identifying opportunities for improvement in business operations and processesInvolvement in the design or modification of business systems or IT systemsAssisting in designing technical solutionsDocumentation of functional and technical design of the system or solutionTesting of systems and creation of relevant documentation and user manualsInteraction with system architects and developers to ensure proper implementationStrong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work within and transcend client political environmentsWillingness to be involved with detailed project delivery work at all levelsStrong organizational skills and attention to detail Education & Experience Bachelor’s or Master’s degree – Preferably in Business, Finance, Accounting or EngineeringFive years of relevant business systems analysis or business consulting experienceEnergy, Retail and/or Distribution/Supply Chain experience preferredEnterprise software experience/exposureGlobal Firm consulting background preferred Percipio is an equal opportunity employer. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, a healthy work/life balance, and the ability to reside in one of the most desired locations in the US with little to no travel. We prefer the boutique model, where each individual has the opportunity to wear multiple hats and actively participate in their own career growth and expansion, as well as the evolution of Percipio.  Please submit the form below with ‘Business Analyst’ in the subject line for consideration.

Name: Business Objects & TSQL BI Developer
Description: Business Objects & TSQL BI Developer (Epic) Location: Portland, OR Duration- 6 Months Client- OHSU Job Description Epic Caboodle Claims ETL & Sup Leveraging SAP Business Objects Web Intelligence, Information Design Tool (Universe Development), and knowledge of SQL Server T-SQL, this position is responsible for working with Finance and ITG’s Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics Teams to transition reporting from our Epic Clarity instance on Oracle RDBMS to Epic Clarity and Caboodle on Microsoft SQL Server RDBMS. The ideal candidate will have prior healthcare or finance/accounting department data experience, preferably in a healthcare organization that utilizes Epic Systems Electronic Medical Record System. Experience with Epic Clarity and Caboodle Data Warehouse is strongly desired. Beyond technical skills, English communication skills sufficient to capture requirements from customers shared in verbal and written form and translate these into business intelligence solutions using Business Objects Universes and Web Intelligence is necessary for success in this role. Strong collaboration with hospital finance and ITG in order to capture requirements and execute these through iterative development approaches such as Agile are hallmarks of this position. The ideal candidate will also possess a good understanding of Epic Resolute billing processes, Epic Clarity Resolute HB and PB data structures, healthcare terminology, and the data model of Epic Caboodle Data Warehouse. Solution development will follow the software development methodology and adhere to data governance, data security, and report standards. This position will follow change management and problem management processes. This work ensures that the information assets of the enterprise are leveraged to enhance financial, clinical, and operational decisions. The Incumbent will observe due care, objectivity and respect for confidentiality. All employees and contractors must keep confidential what they hear and what they see when handling, reviewing, or observing: communications and records thereof (calls, email, pages, fax, etc.), data transmission, databases, or other forms of information. Confidentiality extends to the identities of the parties of the communications, and even to the fact that the communication took place. When sharing information, consider whether the recipient has a true “business need to know.” ITG employees are responsible for the security of technology. In exercising their duties, ITG employees must follow security directives, incorporating security measures in the delivery of their everyday tasks, and are required to report security concerns to the Integrity Office and/or ITG Security Engineering team. BI Systems Engineering/User Support: Develops Business Objects, T-SQL (SQL Server) and Epic BI solutions that provide robust end user layers for adhoc reporting use, visualizations, advanced dashboards, reports, and stories. Business Objects: Universe Design (information design tool), Web Intelligence and Crystal. Works closely with other IT staff to meet expectations for design reviews and coding standards. Provides issue resolution during Quality Assurance / User testing. Assists with the move to production/implementation process. Work through established processes to resolve any system or data problems and communicate updates and status to affected groups. Recommend changes to ETL processes and/or the data warehouse model to improve existing structures and code to increase reliability and efficiency. Provides technical expertise to support end users developing ad-hoc queries and departmental reports. Support could include consulting on techniques/best practices, troubleshooting of their solutions, working with clinicians and Epic developers to improve user interfaces and templates for improved reporting, and promotion of user developed solutions to Quality Assurance and Production. Respond to and track issues using HP Service Manager issue management tools. Gather additional information from the customers. Triage the issue and resolve or escalate by involving additional team members as required. System Analysis : Work with data warehouse architects, line of-business analysts and users to gather detailed requirements for and provide input into the design of Business Objects and Epic reports, visualizations, advanced dashboards, analyses, and adhoc end user layers. Work with BI Architects, Developers, Analysts and users to design, create and publish ETL processes and ETL metadata using SQL Server SSIS and other tools. Provide complete and consistent documentation of data warehouse content and ensure that users can determine what data is available in the warehouse, how this data is defined, how key metrics are defined and analysis is performed. Facilitate customer requests for new or changed solutions. Develops options with recommendations, creates functional specifications including performance requirements, and test plans to confirm delivered functionality. Project and Systems Management: Will fully understand and utilize the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process and procedures. Will manage projects by creating timelines, identifying risks and milestones, and providing status reporting to others as defined. Provide support to data warehouse developers, line-of-business analysts and users to validate data in the data warehouse. Investigate and report on problems and work to ensure the validity of the data warehouse. This could include scheduling reports and dashboard refreshes in Business Objects Scheduler, Tableau, Microsoft SSIS, ActiveBatch or other scheduling tools. Use an approved query tool (SQL Developer, etc.) to identify data quality and data relationships to assist with the design of efficient and effective reporting solutions. Provide support to fellow data warehouse developers, line-of-business analysts and users to validate data in the data warehouse. Investigate and report on problems and work to ensure the validity of the data warehouse. Data Modeling: Work with data warehouse developers, line-of-business analysts and users to develop data structures and data marts that support and enhance information access, analysis and reporting.
