Name: Marketing Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: In this role, you will be asked to: Manage, plan and implement the  Marketing analytics and business intelligence strategy to support the  achievement of Tektronix marketing goals, includingResponsible for the development,  deployment and administration of the Data Visualization Daily Management tool  for global Marketing and Sales teams.Develop and administer Marketing  KPI planning tools.Provide recommendations and  analysis to evolve Marketing KPIs to align with Marketing strategy.Partner with the Business  Intelligence IT team to deliver a stable and highly available reporting  platform.Provide direction and support to  the global Marketing organization for problem solving and daily management.Manage the design and development  of analytical projects designed to understand key business behaviors that  support customer acquisition, retention, and engagement, improve the customer  experience and make it easier to measure customer activity and preferences over  time.Manage and lead the thought  process in understanding the Customer Buying Journey. Identify tools and  capabilities to drive actionable insights. Collaborate with various leaders  across the organizations to identify both strategic and tactical areas of  opportunity and seek to use data insights to evolve and improve the business.Discover new opportunities to  optimize the business through analytics and statistical modeling. Deliver  Ad-hoc reporting, analysis and insights to the Global Marketing OrganizationMarketing Technology Tool  administration, configuration and training.The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:Minimum of 1  years previous experience configuring, deploying and maintaining global reports  in Data Visualization Tool (DOMO experience preferred)5 years  utilizing daily management, problem solving and Kaizen participation and management5 years in a  data analyst role for a large global organization5 years Project Management  experienceExperience working  with CRM or Marketing Automation dataGo get attitudeExcellent  verbal and written communicationsBachelor's degree in analytics/information systems/computer science or related fieldDue to US Department of Commerce export control regulations governing technical data of Tektronix products, Tektronix needs to know the citizenship of all its employees. Note that US Citizenship is not required for most positions. Hired candidates will be asked to bring proof of citizenship (passport, birth certificate, green card, visa or similar) on their first day of work.All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment drug screening, background/criminal check, and if applicable a motor vehicle record search and/or financial record check. Candidates with less education/experience may be considered for other opportunities

Name: Healthcare Process Improvement Analyst
Description: Title: Healthcare Process Improvement Analyst Location: Portland, OR Area  Type: Contract  Job: LA218577117 Position Description: Immediate opening for an experienced Process Improvement Analyst working for our Healthcare client who is passionate about working to deliver quality health care that is available, affordable and personally relevant to everyone. Join their Cause to positively change the way people experience health care!  Project Scope:  This Process Improvement Analyst position is specifically focused on process improvement for Care Guides. A Care Guide is a person and valued resource that consumers can reach out to for multi-channel and omni-channel personalized guidance and concierge support.  The position facilitates the fostering of a continuous improvement culture. Lead and facilitate technical and/or operational process improvement initiatives across the organization using process improvement methodologies, project management strategies, leadership, and change management skills to achieve outcome improvements.  Responsibilities: Provide concierge support in areas including, but not limited to, finding local resources, assisting with appointment scheduling, researching conditions, preparing for appointments, and figuring out financial assistance and options.Fully leverage multi-channel and/or omni-channel tools and technologies to communicate with consumers and fulfill their needs.Manage variable volumes of incoming work (e.g. through call queues, chats, emails, etc…) and prioritize follow-through to meet service level agreements and performance requirements.Exhibit a professional and polished, yet compassionate and caring, demeanor in all consumer interactions.Maintain a holistic, consumer-centric view of problems and interactions in order to function beyond simple transactions.Take ownership of consumer interactions and drive them toward resolution, where completion is total consumer satisfaction.Provide unbiased support navigating the complex health care system across the entire continuum of care.Meet dependability, availability, timeliness, accuracy, quantity, quality, and other standards as established by management.Maintain confidentiality and sensitivity in all aspects for internal and external customers.Effectively handle the most complex interactions with minimal assistance or guidance.Expected to have some non-production time to serve as internal subject matter expert and the first point of escalation for issues and questions from Care Guides and consumers.Provide support to the Care Guide for the coordination of day-to-day work including, but not limited to, monitoring incoming volume, assignments, and availability.Provide recommendations to the Care Guide for knowledgebase articles, process improvements, and training material updates.Collaborate with Human Service Delivery leadership to establish quality metrics; leads and conducts Quality Assurance for the team of Care Guides.Create knowledgebase articles and training materials, deliver training, and provide coaching and mentoring.Drive process improvements.Establish and monitor staffing and scheduling.Serve as external subject matter expert on program processes, procedures, and deliverables.May lead intra-departmental projects.Requirements:The Process Improvement Analyst would have 5 years’ experience in consumer-facing roles in a health care, retail, hospitality, executive support, service industry, or related field.Demonstrated knowledge of health care industry trends, terminology, continuum of care, and contractual arrangements.Strong oral, written, and interpersonal skills with the ability to translate complex concepts and ideas to speak in plain language and ensures their message is received and understood.Ability to assimilate detailed information, think critically, and make decisions within individual role and responsibility.Strong organization and time management skills with the ability to manage workload independently.Demonstrated ability to take initiative, assume ownership, remove barriers, and be successful working independently.Proven ability to quickly build and maintain positive, collaborative, and rewarding relationships with internal and external customers.Ability to effectively manage conflict and ambiguity.Demonstrated history of proactively anticipating customer, project, and product needs and developing solutions or pre-emptively raising concerns.Displays an enthusiastic, fully-committed, and self-directed approach to work.Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities, policies, and procedures.Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment that may include immediate team members, other internal teams, and third-party partners.Possesses a flexible mindset and ability to convey confidence and credibility in customer interactions.Excellent business English and grammar skills.Strong competence in Microsoft Office software.Technologically-savvy.Minimum typing speed of 65 wpm and 98% accuracy.Demonstrated ability to provide guidance and inquiry-specific support to junior team members.Experience providing coaching and mentoring to junior team members.Experience working in cross-functional teams.Demonstrated ability to define, collect, and analyze complex situations and processes to develop metrics, synthesize solutions and options, and drive towards results. At IGNW (InfoGroup Northwest), we use our deep technical insights, local market knowledge and rock-solid relationships and reputation to create exceptional business outcomes for people and companies every day. We are based in Portland, OR with global partnerships to deliver the industry's top technical solutions and talent to every one of our clients. Our clients, consultants, contractors, partners and employees choose IGNW because we tackle the tough problems, and we care deeply about people while we do it.  We are proud to foster a great team working environment, to offer highly competitive compensation and to offer full benefits packages including medical, FSA, dental and vision. If you would like to learn more, join our team or explore how IGNW can benefit your business, please reach out today!!  Please note: Our clients may require that candidates pass a drug and/or background check. To apply, please send your resume to: resumes@infogroupnw.com Oregon's Top 100 Best Companies to Work For - 3 years running  IGNW has earned the Best of Staffing Award for providing remarkable service to hiring managers and job seekers. Check it out!  https://www.bestofstaffing.com/agencies/ignw/  To view other IGNW opportunities please visit www.ignw.io  IN

Name: Assistant Analyst
Description: Job DetailsLevel EntryJob Location Portland, OR or West Chester, PA - ,Position Type Full TimeEducation Level 4 Year DegreeSalary Range UndisclosedTravel Percentage NegligibleJob Shift AnyJob Category MarketingDescriptionAt a glance: This is an entry level position on our Marketing Analytics team with a core responsibility of analyzing marketing data to provide actionable insights and optimization to improve upon our client’s business objectives. What does an Assistant Analystdo at R2C Group?Support media optimization initiatives for all platforms – TV, print, radio, website, paid search, digital media, email etc.Assist Media Planners to develop actionable insight beyond standard reporting to drive strategic marketing direction.Produce performance reports (e.g. scorecards, dashboards, ad-hoc reports) for clients, and ability to recognize and troubleshoot data anomalies.Assist with ad-hoc marketing campaign analyses, mining for deep insights that will drive business results and inform strategic planning and optimization.Ensure data integrity by leveraging media analytics reporting suites (Adobe/Omniture, Google Analytics, DoubleClick, Datorama and the breadth of proprietary analytic tools.Develop a strong partnerships and collaboration with internal team member and clients.Present project specific findings to internal and client team members and collect feedback to refine future analysis.Actively listen to needs of others to understand and provide accurate information or solutions.Support the Marketing Analytics team,Set up and maintain client campaign tracking, data collection, and client reporting.Prepare presentation slides, analytic reports and other visualizations of status meetings.Prioritize multiple projects and tasks simultaneously and adapt to changes quickly.What makes a great Assistant Analyst at R2C Group?Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics) or Business/Marketing.0-2 years’ experience.Knowledge of analytics and reporting.Experience in Excel and PowerPointStrong problem solving and decision making skillsAbility to present in small and large groupsStrong attention to detailAppreciation of R2C Group’s Core ValuesWhy work at R2C Group?We do a thing we call Transactional Brand Building. That is, we deliver on our clients’ brand and sales objectives at the same time, with the same work and the same media plan. We measure our clients’ sales results daily – per transaction, so you and your clients can see the tangible results of your work. It’s an exhilarating standard to live up to.There are about 220 of us, so we’re big enough to handle major projects, but small enough that we all know each other.We are collaborative. We care about, appreciate, and respect each other. No throwing under buses.Transparency. We all know how the company is doing and where we’re going, collectively and individually.We have a large and diverse roster of clients, and we get our revenue from a variety of sources, so we’re built for stability.You’ll get to work on a variety of accounts, with different team members, so you’ll never be bored.We are privately held, so we answer only to our clients and to each other.

Name: Business Analyst I, Technology
Description: Overview  The Business Analyst I, Technology will provide system and program analytical support to the Project Management Office (PMO) and ensures streamlined project completion and overall process improvement to support business analytics and lead digital transformation decisions in accordance with Holland Partner Group's core values.  The Business Analyst I, Technology represents and promotes Holland's Core Values of Great People, Great Business, Deliver Exceptional Customer Service and Have Fun! ResponsibilitiesSupport the development of solutions from inception through user acceptance and provide continuity as requirements move to solutions, and solutions move to projects.Assist with hand-off of business technology projects and objectives, supporting change management and Business Technology goals.Examine existing business system data flows, evaluate system specifications for business requirements, and make recommendations for improvements.Analyze systems and/or programs to design stages, phases and modules, define timelines, then identify and resolve issues.Interpret a project's requirements then design, test and implement the most efficient and cost-effective solutions.Collaborate with the PMO in portfolio road mapping and strategic planning.Develop and document business/functional requirements through requirement gathering sessions, business process mapping, process analysis, etc.Support ideation, troubleshooting and resolving business technology issues.Develop test cases and plans for system, unit, integration testing internally and externally.Provide creative solutions to business requirements, present options and make recommendations.Ensure consistent, streamlined communication between business unit stakeholders, Business Technology, PMO, and technical project teamsDevelop a gap plan strategy along with roadmap to assist in migration from current to future state.Lead discussions on alternatives analysis to facilitate the decision-making processesSeek and propose constant improvement efforts to enhance the overall PMO and Business Technology delivery capability.Represent Holland Partner Group in a professional manner always.Conform to company apparel standards and set a positive example for all Associates.Perform all other duties as directed and assist the overall team effort in any way possible.Qualifications Education: High school diploma or equivalent is required. A college degree or coursework in a related field is strongly preferred. A PMI-BA® or BABOK Certification (ECBA) is preferred.  Experience: Two years' business process analysis or data analysis experience required. Bachelor's Degree in information technology, information services, management information systems, or related field may be considered in lieu of some experience. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:Ability to work independently and effectively prioritize competing demands and execute tasks in a fast-paced operating environment meeting timelines, milestones, and deliverables.Demonstrated high-level of skill in both verbal and written communication, including ability to convey technical issues to non-technical individuals.Strong problem analysis and resolution skills.Effective teamwork and interpersonal skills.Detail oriented and well organized.Must be proactive, flexible, responsible, and resourceful.Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI desired but not required.Demonstrate and display honesty, integrity, and personal accountability.Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality.Strong customer service orientation.Knowledge of Information Technology systems that support Commercial Construction Projects.Knowledge of Agile delivery methodologies as well as waterfall and agile project methodologies.Exceptional skills in Microsoft Office and Visio required.Knowledge of SIPOC, ERD, BPMN Process Mapping & Data Flow Mapping. Attendance: This full-time position is exempt and requires the ability to be present and available during business hours to meet company and department needs. Additional hours or flexible schedule may be required. This position also requires:Ability to lift or move up to 20 pounds.Hearing and visual ability to observe and detect signs of emergency situations.Fluency in English both verbally and non-verbally. This is an excellent opportunity to apply your talent, vision, drive, and experience to the Holland Team.SDL2017

Name: Systems Analyst - IT
Description: Job Details  Description ***Applicants must upload a cover letter and resume to their application in order to be considered for this opportunity.***TITLE: Systems AnalystDEPARTMENT: Information TechnologySCHEDULE: Monday-Friday 8am-5pmSALARY: $56,000-$72,000/Annually DOESUMMARY: The Systems Analyst (SA) is a member of the Information Systems (IS) team. The position is responsible for analyzing the agency workflows and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems across the organization. The position is challenged to automate and/or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities and limitations. In addition improvements and automation, the SA is an active participant in software administration tasks, which includes but not limited to major software updates. The SA position works collaboratively with other IT team members and internal/external stakeholders to understand and translate agency needs into conceptual designs, data visualization, and system enhancements.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Consult with managers to determine the role of the IT system in the organization.2. Research emerging technologies to decide if they can increase the organization’s effectiveness and efficiency.3. Read manuals, periodicals, and technical reports to learn how to develop applications that meet agency needs.4. Prepare an analysis of costs and benefits so that management can decide if IS upgrades are financially worthwhile.5. Devise ways to add new functionality to existing computer systems.6. Expand or modify systems to serve new purposes and/or improve workflow.7. Design and develop new systems by choosing and configuring software.8. Oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of information systems.9. Customize software applications to align them with CCC operations.10. Develop, document and revise system designs, tests, and quality standards.11. Conduct testing to ensure the systems work as expected.12. Assist in training end users and writing instruction manuals.13. Provide staff with assistance solving computer related problems, such as malfunctions and application issues.14. Confer with customers/staff regarding the nature of the information processing or computation needs.15. Perform ongoing monitoring and refinement of reports.16. Attend all mandatory CCC trainings.17. Adhere to all state and federal privacy regulations, including HIPAA and 42 CFRPart 2, and to CCC policies and agreements regarding confidentiality, privacy,and security. Support compliance with all privacy and security requirementspursuant to community partners’ and outside providers’ patient confidentialityagreements, including privacy and security requirements for EMR access. Thisincludes immediately reporting any breach of protected health information orpersonal identification information of any person receiving CCC services by CCCor an outside provider to the CCC Compliance Department, as well as to yoursupervisor or their designee.DESCRIPTION OF OTHER DUTIES:The System Analyst may also perform other duties as assigned that are aligned withanalyzing, designing, and implementing information systems, which includesdetermining the suitability of IS solutions in terms of their intended outcomes, functionsand interactions with end users, software vendors and programmers to achieve desiredoutcomes.Other duties as assigned.SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Candidates must be proficient in collaborating with product owners and developmentteams to understand and contribute to vision and value of specific projects. Candidate isa skilled expert in navigating competing requirements and technical restraints ininnovative environments. Candidate is knowledgeable in documenting use cases,process maps, and design/lean/agile artifacts.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:1. Bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science (CS), comparable program OR equivalent combination of education and experience.2. 2+ years experience in business/systems analysis, application development,report writing or other IS activities.3. Good understanding in user experience and interface design and development.4. Familiar with Visual Studio IDE.5. Knowledgeable in Visual Basic and/or C#.6. Accomplished with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or other web developmentlanguages.7. Capable in Unified Modeling Language, wireframes, and/or other designpractices.8. Experienced in writing queries, views and stored procedure in T-SQL.9. Skillful in reporting tools, such as SQL Server Report Services.10. Knowledgeable in Design Thinking, Lean Thinking and/or Agile practices.11. Must be able to work a flexible schedule.12. If in recovery, must be currently clean and sober.13. Must pass a pre-employment drug screen, TB test, and background check.14. Must adhere to agency’s non-discrimination policies15. Ability to effectively interact with co-workers and clients with diverse ethnicbackgrounds, religious views, political affiliation, cultural backgrounds, life-stylesand sexual orientations, and treat individuals with respect and dignity.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:1. Master’s degree MIS, CIS or a Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree.2. Desired certifications:o Certification of Capability in Business Analysis (CCBA)o Project Management Professional (PMP)o Certified Scrum Master (CSM)o Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO)o Continual Education certifications related to SA responsibilities3. 5+ years experience in business/systems analysis, application development,report writing or other IS activities.4. Advanced understanding of SQL Server and related tools and languages .5. Professionsal UML and prototyping experience.6. 1-2 years C# developer experience using Visual Studio.7. History of working on full stack web development projects/products.Central City Concern is a second chance employer and complies with applicable laws regarding consideration of criminal background for employment purposes. Government regulations, contractual requirements, or the duties of this particular job may require CCC to conduct a background check and take appropriate action to address prior criminal convictions. Name: Technology Analyst

Name: Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium
Description: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.  Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.  Position Title:  Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium  Location:  Remote, US Wide  Core Responsibilities:  Serve as Senior Electronic Health Record (EHR) subject matter expert for the provision of any combination of two or more Cerner Millennium Clinical Solutions (SurgiNet; SurgiNet ANES; CareNet or PharmNet). Scope of duties include all aspects of implementing and subsequent operational support of Cerner Millennium.  Responsible for working collaboratively with all Atos Cerner Millennium Solution Teams Consultants for the delivery of migration services at the client engagement level.  Minimum Qualifications: Assigned to and works with the Cerner Millennium EHR migration team (domestic and global) to articulate business requirements related to client projects and operational support.Is fully compliant in the use of Atos’ “end-to-end” and “Best Practices” documented framework for EHR migration initiatives, abides by all defined processes, activities and goals to maintain the repeatability, leveragability and reference-ability for EHR related services.Identify opportunities, performance measurement methodologies and reporting tools necessary to improve business processes resulting in improved efficiencies and/or quality in healthcare and delivery of services to our clients.Act as a liaison between client operations, client informati, and Anthelio EHR practice service teams to ensure systems meet the functional specifications as defined by operations.Acts as a liaison between client(s) and vendor(s) related to system functionality specificationsSupports and/or leads EHR departmental and interoperability business process optimization activities as assigned for client sites.Maintains current knowledge of applicable federal and state EMR/EHR related laws and accreditation standards; monitors and communicates changes to ensure customer adaptation and compliance.Documents and maintains a knowledge base of Cerner Millennium products implemented at client sites. Mentors junior team members on product functionality, package validation as well as application solution build activities etc.Consistently demonstrates skills with thorough documentation in customer issue cases.Participates in Domain validation; package testing ; application break/fix resolution ; design change build/testing as approved by customer and other application support related activities as assigned.Serves as a Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet Anesthesia Subject Matter Expert in the delivery of services including but not limited to:Consults with client on workflow design; functional specifications, design, build and test changes to workflow logic in response to requested changes; provides education for build and maintenance of master tables from the EHR databaseDevelops and/or updates test scripts for all system implementations, changes and upgrades.Participates in system functional and integrated testing as assigned.Participates in change control process meetings and if fully compliant with Atos Change Management processes.Develops internal WIKI support articles/troubleshooting tipsheets for Cerner Millennium Solution analysts and Atos’ Healthcare National Service Desk.Provides knowledge transition to client staff and/or Cerner Millennium Solution teams and other sub-practice service teams to perform daily, weekly and monthly system maintenance and monitoring to ensure the good health of the systems (if applicable).Works collaboratively with all Atos Service Delivery teams to achieve high customer satisfaction levels for services delivered. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent healthcare and/or technical certification/licensing required. Registered Nurse highly desired.3-5 years of practical experience in the Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet ANES or Supply Chain Management required.3+ years experience in EHR system related implementations and/or application support in a healthcare environment required, hospital experience preferred. Skills & Requirements:Analytical ability to identify, analyze and evaluate market changes, create solutions to difficult administrative, technical or human situations.Effective written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills for contact with internal and external customers and peers to obtain and interpret a variety of information based on knowledge of departmental practices, hospital policies and programs and specific technical and regulatory knowledge.Must possess the ability to learn new things in a variety of ways (i.e., self learning and/or virtual classroom setting) and think innovatively for solutions to business and technical problems related to patient care/record process flow.Ability to participate on multiple projects simultaneously and remotely.Superior organizational skills.Intermediate to expert level skill in use of standard Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to travel as required by client engagement and as otherwise defined by the Atos’ Digital Healthcare Solutions Leadership team. Career site: https://atos.net/en/careers​  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/atos  Twitter: https://twitter.com/atos  LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/atos​  Youtube: https://youtube.com/atos  #JoinAtosTeam  #AtosCareers Your Application If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format.  Atos does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements.  We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities.

Name: Compensation and HR Systems Analyst
Description: Job Title: Compensation and HR Systems Analyst Date: November 2018Reportsto: Director, People & Culture Operations Department: P&C (HR)Status: Exempt, Salaried DirectReports: 0 General Summary: The People & Culture (P&C) Compensation and HR Systems Analyst is responsible for data and analytics within the Fuerst Group Human Capital Management (HCM) systems in support of People & Culture’s service delivery processes, compensation programs and metrics. This role provides a full range of compensation and human resources information services to functional areas across P&C through the maintenance, implementation, testing and reporting through new and existing systems and data analytics. This includes the analysis and evaluation of positions across Fuerst Group Companies, as well as a variety of day-to-day administrative HCM functions. Serves as the technical subject matter expert for recurring P&C processes and provides ongoing reporting, documentation, training/skills development and support to the P&C team. Key Responsibilities:Partner with P&C functional areas to assess HCM technology and reporting needs, providing options and recommendations that meet requestsCollaborate with the P&C team to define business requirements and analyze and recommend best technical and compensation solutions to meet operational requirements and mitigates risk system and equity changes may have on other P&C or FG processesAdvises and assists staff in the application and interpretation of compensation and HCM related policies and serves as a resource to the P&C DepartmentCreate, complete and run standard and ad hoc reports, including data analytics, compensation equity reports, participate in compensation surveys, audits and creating organizational charts to support P&C internal and external customer and compliance needs Understand and anticipate P&C/customer requirements to provide data insights and recommend alternativesConducts benchmarking, performs data analysis and formulates recommendations, to ensure competitive, cost-effective, and legally compliant compensation programs and practices. Conducts special market studies, where appropriate, to validate or establish competitive pay strategies for specific jobsServes as a liaison with third party vendors and internal stakeholders (e.g. payroll, benefits, finance) and utilize project management skills to develop, implement and maintain P&C technical and analytical solutionsDevelop user procedures, guidelines and documentation, Train new system users on processes and functionalityKnowledge/Skills Required:BS/BA in Human Resources or business-related discipline is preferred. PHR/SPHR certification is desiredThree or more years of progressive experience working with HCM systemsTwo or more years of experience working with salary surveys and compensation programsWorking knowledge of ADP Workforce now strongly preferredExperience supporting multiple projects simultaneously while capturing milestones and mitigating potential barriers to successStrong written communication skills including a demonstrated ability to write business requirements, user-friendly documentation and procedure guides, and professional reports and presentationsExcellent verbal communication and customer service skills with both internal and external customers and partnersAdvanced Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, and PowerPointOther Requirements: May require some local and domestic travelAbility to sit or use the computer for the majority of the work day.Ability to lift up to 20 pounds.Employee Conduct: It is the responsibility of every employee to contribute to a positive work environment through: teamwork, positive, honest and effective communication, and professional interactions with co-workers, customers and partners. Why KEEN: Driven by a passion for life outside, KEEN is a values-led, independently owned brand from Portland, Oregon, that’s on a mission to create original and versatile products, improve lives, and inspire outside adventure. Founded in 2003, KEEN launched a revolution in the footwear industry with the introduction of the Newport adventure sandal, and has donated more than $17 million to non-profit organizations and causes around the world to promote responsible outdoor recreation, including conservation efforts to protect open spaces. KEEN strives to show the world through its products and its actions that a business for good can actually be good for business. By giving back, reducing impact, and activating communities and individuals to protectthe places where we work and play, KEEN puts its values in motion and takes action to leave the world a better place. Learn more at https://www.keenfootwear.com/our-purpose.htmlKEEN is an equal opportunity employer, who values an inclusive and diverse community. Qualified candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status or disability.

Name: Investment Banking 2019 Summer Analyst Internship
Description: Job Description:D.A. Davidson & Co., a leading investment banking firm with operations throughout the U.S., is accepting applications for the Investment Banking Internship Program in various locations. The Investment Banking Internship Program will be a 10 week program that will introduce potential candidates to our Investment Banking business and the firm. Interns are expected to work on strategic assignments assisting deal teams with mergers and acquisitions, public offerings, private placements and other advisory services. Interns are expected to commit such time as is necessary to effectively fulfill their responsibilities, which will require 40 hours per week. A portion of our permanent Analyst positions will be filled from our summer internship program. Davidson Companies  Apply now

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Position PurposeWorking at the world's fourth largest retailer mixes the best of many worlds: cutting-edge technologies meet real business needs meets real customers who spend billions of dollars across our stores in North America. What is it like to work at The Home Depot QuoteCenter? We were a startup once upon a time and much of our startup culture still exists: the agility of a small operation, the impact that comes with being a leader in our industry. Our team uses the latest technologies to build new products that facilitate 9-figure project sales at The Home Depot. We invest proactively in our people. The mission of the QuoteCenter product team is to radically reimagine the shopping experience at Home Depot utilizing the latest data tools and web technologies. We are searching for a Senior Business Analyst who is passionate about taking an ownership role in translating business and technical requirements into solutions. The goal of your efforts in this role is to leverage data to create merchandising programs that streamline the sales process for our associates. This is a full-time permanent role located in Vancouver, Washington. We are seeking someone who has a knack for linking numbers to business opportunities, and who can effectively communicate with and influence stakeholders. Degree in business or similar field required. Experience in Tableau (or other analytical software), SQL, project management a strong plus.ResponsibilitiesPlan and lead all phases of a project's life cycle (i.e. feasibility, design implementation, evaluation); this includes extracting the business need; defining the business requirements, understanding the impact on the business, and designing and carrying out the project(s) Serve as liaison between merchandising and finance by facilitating meetings including both departments Mentor other analysts in developing/honing business knowledge and analytical skills Serve as a subject matter expert and perform research and/or analysis within assigned projects Multi-task to work on 2 to 4 projects simultaneously, recommending process improvements and making final project recommendations which impact the business Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects to gauge business valuePreferred QualificationsExperience developing complex technology solutions and performing analysis on feature requirements against system capabilities. Experience communicating and delivering content to external parties. Ability to recognize and proactively manage the appropriate content and interactions for dealing with third parties. Ability to prioritize tasks/objectives with strong organizational and analytical skills. History of documenting expectations in clear and presentable format. Experience with various applications and tools, including JIRA, Visio, MS Office, Powerpoint, Excel. Knowledge of SQL, relational databases and various analytics tools. Clear and articulate communication style to partner collaboratively across multiple departments with a consultative approach to assess and solve business problems for internal and external customers. You must build cross-department relationships to further business requirement definition. Must be successful in a team environment and drive collaborative work initiatives. Able to be successful in a more ambiguous role with targets and goals that change frequently. Retail industry experience preferred, not required. Experience analyzing and visualizing data through BI solutions (Tableau) a plus.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and CompetenciesWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Typing skills Excellent written and verbal skills Strong organization skills with attention to details Must possess the ability to handle multiple task at once with minimal direction Training and procedural documentation skills

Name: Data Modeler / Analyst
Description: Data Modeler / Analyst Portland, OR  This is an excellent opportunity to join AZAD Technology Partners' team of professionals as a Data Modeler / Analyst. The AZAD consultant will contribute to established data integration and reporting groups and will be responsible for gathering and transforming business and technical requirements into conceptual, logical and physical data models repositories.  The ideal candidates will possess the following experience and qualifications:  Experience performing logical data modeling, physical data modeling (including reverse engineering) using the Erwin Data Modeling tool. Data modeling experience with a strong emphasis on the design and development of conceptual, logical and physical data models using industry standard tools such as Popkin, Computer Associate’s AllFusion Data Modeler (Erwin) or Sybase’s Power Designer. Experience performing logical data model design including normalization/denormalization referential integrity, data domains; primary and foreign key assignments and data element definitions as applied to both relational and dimensional modeling. Demonstrated experience in the gathering, assimilation, organization, categorization and analysis of business requirements to create corresponding designs of logical and physical data models. Such tasks may include client interviews and/or facilitating Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions. Experience with technical interviewing in the Information Technology environment. Assist Business Subject Matter Experts and data stewards to review and “scrub” their data in a timely manner and perform data audits, as necessary. Assist in creation of document data flow diagrams, entity relationship diagrams and other project deliverables, as requested. Ability to assist project team with trouble-shooting of “data issues” as they arise during testing cycles. Ability to conduct data modeling sessions with business users and technical staff, which includes conveying complex ideas both verbally and in written form. Ability to negotiate priorities and resolve requirement conflicts among various stakeholders. Desired:  Experience in FIPS 184 Integration Definition for Information Modeling (IDEF1X) or experience with an alternative modeling notation such as Information Engineering (IE). AZAD Technology Partners is looking for bright, talented, flexible, and customer centric problem solvers who enjoy the challenges associated with solving the most complex problems by utilizing the most sophisticated technologies and strong people skills.  Founded and managed by technologists and engineers, AZAD is a leading provider of Technology Consulting and Engineering Solutions to Fortune 500 and innovative high-tech firms since 1992. AZAD works closely with its clients to solve their most complex technological challenges. Join AZAD's professional team and enhance your career by being engaged with some of the most innovative projects in the Pacific Northwest.  Our collaborative approach to support our clients, projects and our passion about technology is key to our success. If you enjoy working in such an environment, we encourage you to apply.  EXCELLENT EMPLOYEE BENEFITS including Co-paid Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Cafeteria Plan, Paid Sick Leave, 401K Plan, Credit Union Membership, and Referral Bonus. U.S. Citizens only for Federal Clearance RequirementAZAD Technology Partners is an equal opportunity employer that considers and employs qualified individuals based upon job related qualifications regardless of race, color, sex, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, veteran’s status, sexual orientation, national origin, age or any other status protected under applicable local, state or federal law. AZAD Technology Partners takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified employees and applicants who are disabled, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, Armed Forces services medal veterans, and other protected veterans.Apply for this position >>

Name: Analyst - Risk
Description: Analyst - Risk  html, body {  font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;  } Analyst - RiskReturn to Job OpportunitiesLevel EntryJob Location OR - Portland, ORJob Category Professional ServicesLegitScript, one of the Top 100 Workplaces in Oregon, is seeking an exceptional Risk Analyst to join our team at our Portland, Oregon-based headquarters.  Please apply via our corporate jobs page: https://www.legitscript.com/company/careers/ Role Title: Risk Analyst Role Purpose: The purpose of this role is to accurately analyze assigned merchants, assess associated risk, and convey merchant analysis in an actionable note to the client, in accordance with program standards and deadline requirements. A risk analyst must develop a foundational knowledge of, as well as ability to make decisions in, all content areas monitored by the program. At this level, the employee is building foundational skills in order to become a full-fledged contributor to program work. There is an expected training period for all analysts (currently 60-90 days). Over the course of the first year at LegitScript, an analyst should be fully contributing to the program(s). Key Areas of Accountability: Key Area #1: Culture and values alignment  Key Area #2: Accurately analyze and report merchants to client  Key Area #3: Attain expertise in high-risk merchant business models Key Area #1: Culture and values alignmentTasks and ActivitiesEngage in behaviors aligned with LegitScript’s core values: Be Awesome, Be Open, Be Thoughtful, Be InvestedExhibit a growth mindset by being open to feedback, embracing change as an opportunityAccountabilitiesColleagues view employee as being aligned with LegitScript core valuesWelcomes feedbackTreats change as an opportunity to learn and growKey Area #2: Accurately analyze and report merchantsTasks and ActivitiesAnalyze and assess merchant risk levels by using internet investigative techniques and leveraging contextual dataMake quick, accurate analytical decisions based on information that is, at times, ambiguousProvide analysis details to clients under strict deadlinesAdhere to program’s reporting standardsAccountabilitiesProduce accurate, well-reasoned, and concise merchant analysisBy the end of MM training, or by 6 months of hiring date, analyze ~750 merchants a weekBy 8-12 months after hiring date, analyze ~1200 merchants a weekKey Area #3: Expertise in high-risk merchant business modelsTasks and ActivitiesAttain and maintain a thorough understanding of regulations and policies for various high-risk areas in the payment industryAttend weekly team meetings and continuous training opportunitiesStay informed of market trends by reading relevant resources shared by team membersAccountabilitiesIdentify missing or new applicable information to contribute to current reporting standardsProduce internal documentation, as neededExpected competenciesAlignment with company values and cultureGrowth mindset (receptive to feedback, learning)Detail-orientedIndependent/resourcefulEfficient time managementSelf-motivatedCuriousAbility to work under pressureTech savvyAdaptableGood judgment/common senseClear communicator (both in writing and verbally)Bachelors degree or equivalent experienceInvestigative research/analysis skillsExperience with large data sets (Excel not necessary)Experience assessing riskBonus competencies1-2+ years work, especially in relevant fieldDecision-making skillsManagement experience (project or people)Relevant additional language proficiencyMasters degreeRelevant specialty skill(s) [e.g., writing/editing, client relations]About LegitScript:  We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. We share our expertise about high-risk online activity to empower businesses, governments, and consumers to make incremental changes that will result in a secure, more transparent internet. We catch bad guys.  Our spacious, modern Pearl District office is cubicle-free with plenty of natural light. We have sit-to-stand convertible desks. Many of us bike to work and we have indoor bike parking. There's an ofﬁce dog. Our friendly in-house barista serves complimentary beverages every morning, and we have lots of catered lunches and social events. It's a small, culturally diverse company (about 90 people at present) where people work hard and love what they do. Starting salary for this position is between 40k to 50k annually.  In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package: We contribute toward individuals and spouse/ dependents (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Flexible spending account - We contribute funds on your behalf and allow you to contribute pre-tax (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)401k with company match after 6 months.Life insurance and short-term disability insurance policy that are both fully paid by employer (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Transportation package to help alleviate commuting costs (available immediately!)Generous Paid Time Off policy Bonus: We offer full-time employees extra perks like company-paid massages, gift cards to local businesses, paid time off to volunteer, company sponsorship of your hobby, and group social outings! Name: Implementation Analyst
Description: CLINICIENT CULTUREAre you looking for a fast-paced company where our people are our competitive advantage? A company that fosters your entrepreneurial spirit by encouraging you to act like an owner? Do you have the passion and drive to push beyond the adequate to exceptional? Are you passionate about fixing the healthcare system? Do the core values of People; Client-Focused; Trust; Innovation; Fun; Excellence and Teamwork inspire you? If so, please apply for our open position.At Clinicient we help physical therapy practices care with confidence and it feels good to know that what we do ultimately contributes to a patient’s well-being. We do it by coaching our customers to help them take control, simplify and thrive in their practices. You’ll be a part of the Clinicient Coaching staff helping therapists do what they do best—heal people.Implementation AnalystAs a key member of Clinicient’s implementation team, this team member will be responsible for partnering with the project manager and other team members to ensure the successful implementation of our products and services, driving total customer satisfaction.As an Implementation Analyst, you will work to deliver our software and revenue cycle management solutions to our clients. You will assist the implementation team in helping our clients achieve their strategic goals. You will help with implementation projects by interviewing clients’ subject matter experts, documenting business requirements, and providing best practice recommendations for applying our best-in-class solutions. You will also assist with testing and go-live activities.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESTranslating business requirement to system functional requirements. Configure those requirements into the Insight platform.Partner with project managers on check in calls with clients.Answer basic training and system functionality questions in our Empower Community.Support the implementation consultant on the go live configuration checklist.Participate in the sales-to-implementation handover and the implementation-to-support handover meetings.Update Salesforce with relevant client information.Will be fully trained on the Insight Platform and the implementation process.SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESTraining, Travel, Ad Hoc ProjectsEXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONBachelor degree in healthcare administration or similar fields or equivalent experience.Strong passion for healthcare and helping our customers.Customer service experience preferredSKILLS AND ABILITIESMust be a role model of Clinicient’s Core Values: People, Client Focus; Trust; Innovation, Fun, Excellence and Teamwork.Competencies: Collaborates, Customer Focus, Communicates Effectively, Instills Trust, and Situational Ability.Logical and technical mindset that is able to analyze problems and identify root causesExcellent oral and written communication skillsComfort leading groups, facilitating customer conference callsFamiliarity with business applications, including Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and preferably SalesforceMust work well as a team member and individuallyAbility to work with multiple clients concurrentlySelf-starterFlexibility and comfort with ambiguity and changing situationsWORK ENVIRONMENTClinicient offers a competitive benefits package, $100 monthly transportation reimbursement, monthly All-Hands meetings, company hosted happy hours and special events. Our offices are located in the heart of downtown Portland, Oregon, close to Pioneer Square, Food Carts and TriMet bus and MAX stops.Clinicient is an equal opportunity employer.

Will accept any suitable combination of  education, experience, or training.3+ years experience in treasury  or finance, preferably in a large, multinational company.System knowledge should include  proficiency with Microsoft Office products, advanced Excel skills with  ability to write macros, Oracle Financials, data mining tools and banking  software.Advanced knowledge regarding  global treasury and banking conventions, processes and procedures,  regulatory constraints, cost analysis, letters of credit, bank guarantee  transactions, investment theories and concepts, financial markets, foreign  exchange markets, conceptual framework, US and international bank account  structures, and financial modeling.Ability to collect, reconcile,  analyze, and summarize data into reports.Strong communication skills (oral  and written); communicate effectively with internal staff, foreign  exchange traders, investment brokers, banking partners, auditors, support  peers, end users, and all levels of corporate management.Good interpersonal skills;  participate in a team environment and build strong working relationships.

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce's Portland, Oregon (OR) automotive client is looking for a Compensation Analyst for a 7-month contract position.  Overview:  Primary responsibilities will be around generating offers for both internal/external candidates. This particular team makes 100% of white collar offers. The internal workings with the team: seeking information, asking questions. Primary communication stream for the candidate will be with the HRBP. Majority of time will be interacting with the respective HRBP regarding the offers. They will also be taking part in project work (annual pay adjustment and bonus program cycle).  The company also participates in salary surveys. The candidate will provide assistance in benchmarking survey information. A good portion of the person's day will be spent reviewing job descriptions. Another good portion of their time will be spent making actual offers. It is extremely important for the person to have experience working within a large company (high volume) and have good familiarity working within an HRIS system. Fair amount of work will be completed within offer databases and worksheets (good Excel skills).  The candidate must have excellent negotiation skills and handle high-pressure situations. The first week will include job shadowing, learning systems and processes and understanding the tempo at which tasks must get accomplished.  Responsibilities:  Determine and make competitive salary offers for both external and internal job placements Provide analytical support in the development, administration, and implementation of compensation programs, including base pay, variable pay, and executive compensation Assist with the administration of compensation programs of exempt and non-exempt employee groups. Interpret policies and provide advice to HR and location managers on issues; Using feedback systems, monitor compensation trends and recommend actionsREQUIREMENTS: BA/BS would be required, and the preferred area of study would HR, Psychology, and/or Statistics At least three years of performing statistical analysis and ability to use data to communicate and guide intended outcomes Past and proven evidence of effectively communicating complex and sensitive topics Past compensation, experience within a large company, preferably a manufacturing company, where salary plans, organizational and offer processes are implemented on a daily basis; Also including daily interaction with various levels of management and HR Business Partners HR knowledge beyond compensation, such as recruiting, payroll and benefits, etc. Top 3 Must Have's:  Knowledge of Oregon Pay Equity Law Must be willing to seek answers on their own Experience with handling pay adjustments for 5000+ people Would be nice if:  Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) and/or Professional in Human Resources (PHR, SPHR) Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Project Analyst, Implementation
Description: The role on the Enterprise Professional Services Team is a strategic role that involves sophisticated project management, needs assessment and project delivery. This individual will be leading strategic conversations with Enterprise Customers, vetting requirements and translating customer needs into technology solutions. Cvent hires bright people who are willing to learn and are extremely motivated to succeed.  This Professional Services team is focused on consulting on Event Management technology solutions, and supports some of the company’s most valuable clients. Our customers use our software to manage Events, Meetings and Seminars of all sizes. This role will help manage and facilitate the process in which Cvent implements and configures the software on our customer’s behalf.  This successful candidate must be a process oriented, customer focused, multi-tasking individual, with a proven track record against their current role’s metrics and activities. In addition, a successful candidate proposes new and creative ideas, possesses highly effective communication skills, and builds constructive and effective relationships. Title will be Project Analyst, Senior Project Analyst or Project Lead based on candidate experience. Position Duties: Serve as a point of contact for the customer on a single or multiple large scale events implementation projects Act as Project Lead managing planning and execution of Project Plan and deliverables Act as a liaison between the customer and a team of international based technical product experts who are configuring the system per the customers’ requirements Perform QA for various outputs and project versioning Lead consultation with internal team on the feasibility of event management operational design and timeline for complex projects. Must be able to plan, define milestones, allocate tasks to resources, track resource performance, track progress against milestones, coordinate QA, engage with clients and external entities for any dependencies. Communicate effectively with all team members (across locations) and with the management team concerning project schedule and delivery. Manage quality assurance process for client deliverables and provide constructive feedback to internal team members in an effort to improve overall delivery process. Cultivate new business opportunities by asking questions, mining opportunities presented and sharing findings with sales. Collaborate with Event Cloud Sales team to develop project requirements and project quotes. Manage activities and liaise between the client and the various departments within Cvent, including Technology, Sales, and Client Services. Demonstrate detailed product knowledge. Contribute towards internal departmental process documentation. Manage several concurrent projects of differing sizes and complexity Strong project management skills Project Management certifications a plus Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional industry working experience strongly preferred Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a client support role, customer service, corporate or association meeting planning, or IT/Tech project management Experience working in a Fortune 1000 corporation, travel, hospitality, software or other high-tech industry a plus Event Management or Hospitality experience a plus Excel at developing client relationships Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously Ability to communicate effectively with clients and internal team members Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Prior use of products such as Salesforce.com and WebEx a plus Feedback management industry knowledge including competitive intelligence

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst (L5)

Name: Epic Orders Analyst
Description: Job ID: 37787***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies***  Epic Orders Analyst Our client is looking for a Epic Orders Analyst to join their team. The Epic Application Analyst will design, validate and confirm new or changed functionality with the Epic environment that meets customer specifications. Epic Orders Analyst Responsibilities Develop and modify system configurations that meet design requirements.  Provide complex qualitative and quantitative analysis on data and information collected as part of application requirement gathering.  Analyze system requirements and determine system functional specifications.  Provide consulting support for customized implementation and installation of the software and related integration elements.  Prioritize system build efforts.  Understand and translate the business functionality into Epic system configuration and workflow validations.  Work closely with business users and application team to design, build and execute a comprehensive integration and user acceptance test plan and scripts.  Gather requirements, provide fit gap analysis and create effective technical solutions for the business needs.  Collaborate with vendors, staff and analysts to resolve outstanding issue relating to design and workflow challenges.  Conduct most phases of testing: unit, assembly, integration and user acceptance tests.  Follow project compliance procedures such as obtaining sign-offs before developing program code or migration to production.  Provide input on required processes and schedule dependencies on the overall project roll-out plan.  Proactively identify impact of changes upon other applications and downstream systems.  Update Change Control schedule with upcoming production releases and monitor production of recently migrated components.  Lead large groups to make key decisions.  Work with the team leadership to create detailed application designs that conform to application architecture guidelines.  Create and maintain all necessary documentation and training materials for application implementation and changes.  Provide highly complex qualitative and quantitative analysis on data and information collected as part of application requirement gathering.  Conduct programming code related peer reviews; resolve issues.  Audit Application Analyst's work; train and mentor Application Analysts.  Resolve the most complex technical applications issues.  Conduct all phases of testing: unit, assembly, integration and user acceptance tests.  Design test approach for unit testing stage for releases & enhancements.  Develop and execute test plan and test scripts for unit testing and maintain log of test results.  Collaborate with Application Analysts from other service lines to build test plans for integration testing.  Work with project and infrastructure team to manage and maintain test environments as needed.  Prepare cycle test environment including data, processes and configuration setup tests as necessary.  Lead highly complex technical decision making efforts. Epic Orders Analyst Qualifications Proficient in all aspects of design, development and testing and best practices of Enterprise application implementations.  Proficient in complex troubleshooting and problem solving, performing root cause analysis on development and production support related issues.  Bachelor's degree OR equivalent combination of education and experience.  Minimum 9 years industry related experience (healthcare, information services, or within applicable area) with information services experience preferred.  Previous experience with client/server and host based systems, SQL proficiency is preferred.  Clinical experience is a plus.  Previous project management experience is preferred.  Previous Epic experience is strongly preferred.  Any certifications relating to software applications, technology infrastructure and or clinical specializations are an advantage.  Some application suites require advanced current clinical knowledge and expertise (Pharmacist, RN and LPN) as demonstrated by a current state license. Benefits Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k. About VanderHouwen VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.

Name: Deployment Analyst--Danone North America
Description: Danone North America is the largest Benefit Corporation in the world. Our mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible.  Danone North America is looking for a Deployment Analyst--Danone North America in their Portland, Oregon manufacturing facility. Position Overview The Deployment Analyst reports directly to the Supply Chain Manager and is responsible for overall deployment of finished goods from plant production locations, distribution centers, and customer locations. Will be responsible for developing and monitoring deployment strategies that optimize costs and operational capacities for a specified category. The ideal candidate will possess the skills and knowledge sought below but, of equal importance, he or she will be self- motivated, organized, possess a positive attitude, demonstrate a hands-on approach and be an effective influencer. Responsibilities:Ensure overall deployment strategy is optimized and system planning parameters are adhered to. Conduct regular consistent reviews of all parameters and maintain database.Review and release daily/weekly deployment suggestions (STOs) to ensure accuracy and consistency.Manage issues and communicate with plants, DCs, Customer Service, Finished Goods Planners and Supply Chain counterparts.Review daily inventory levels at DCs to manage shelf life and customer orders to proactively address service issues and returns.Work with Distribution Centers/Plant Coolers to assist with capacity constraints and optimization strategies as appropriate. Responsible for accurate and consistent data accuracy throughout SAP to provide appropriate mid to long range plans and adjustments.Participate in weekly supply planning team meetings relating to finished good planning, deployment, forecasting and procurement to deliver key KPIs - Service, weeks of supply, loss and damage, forecast accuracy, material, obsolete minimization and sourcing optimizationTrack and report key KPIs – loss and damage, fill rate, plant customer sourcing, etc.Transportation budget goalsMake daily decisions on carrier selection to maximize lowest cost and highest service levels. Use the transportation management system to build efficient loads and build long term relationships with carriers to maximize equipment availability in difficult lanes and take advantage of low price opportunity (lean).Actively engage with Customer Service/Logistics, Coolers, Distribution Centers & Carriers to meet and exceed customer service levels & transportation related KPI’s.Productivity - Researching and implementing cost reduction / sustainability opportunities.Review and authorize all accessorial charges for payment. Keep lean data updated for proper routing and costing. Promptly review any rejected invoices and authorize / decline payment properly.Develop and work with internal & external partners on productivity initiatives.Multiple systems follow up and clean up required.Management of international and domestic shipments.Manage and forecast of supply materials for multiple warehouses.Independently manage multiple projects.QualificationsSupply Chain experience in Consumer Packaging Goods including supply planning preferred.Bachelor degree in Supply Chain Management/Logistics/Business or related degree.SAP/APO experienceEDI knowledge a plusProficient in Excel, Microsoft, PowerPoint, WordForklift certified trainer a plusDemonstrated understanding of supply chain processes and safety stock optimization strategies.Demonstrated understanding of deployment practices.Solid communication skills, particularly in highlighting issues and taking corrective action.Ability to set deadlines and key timetables to achieve with minimal guidance. Danone North America is a Certified B Corporation business unit of Danone and operates in the U.S. from headquarter offices in White Plains, NY and Broomfield, CO. For more information, please visit DanoneNorthAmerica.com.　  Danone North America is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other unlawful criterion.　#LI-NORAM  http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf
