Name: Business Systems Analyst 2 (N-IT)
Description: Company/Position Overview  Salient CRGT is a leading provider of health, data analytics, cloud, agile software development, mobility, cyber security, and infrastructure solutions. We support these core capabilities with full lifecycle IT services and trainingto help our customers meet critical goals for pivotal missions. We are purpose-built for IT transformation supporting federal civilian, defense, homeland, and intelligence agencies, as well as Fortune 1000 companies.  In this role you will provide reporting, system support and analysis for Asset Suite & Sunflower and other applications used by Supply Chain Services (SCS). This position is the center point for report creation & management for Supply Chain Services. This position supports reporting requirements for SCS reporting in Hyperion, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI and Sharepoint maintenance. This position will create and manage very complex reports, ad-hoc queries, and on demand reports consumed by SCS. It will also perform data analysis, offering suggestion for improvement to management. It will also interface with users to support functional requirements development.  The team is collaborative and transparent in how they work. They follow a calendar that has a standard cadence but have to be agile for emergency work as well. The best in this position remain agile to change.  Mandatory Qualifications (Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills) Required Experience: A minimum combination of work-related experience, on-the-job training, and/or vocational training is desired. Experience should be consistent with the specific requirements of Information Technology, Business Systems, or other related IT specialty.This is a Level 2 position: 10 years previous Information Technology, Business Systems or other closely related technical experience (or a combination thereof) is required without a degree (6+ years required with an applicable Bachelor's Degree; 8+ years required with an applicable Associates Degree).3 years of experience with the following:Creating complex SQL's and ad-hoc queries into a relational databaseDatabase knowledge of the Asset Suite enterprise asset management application (or similar enterprise relational database applications) sufficient to create complex queries without input from Subject Matter Experts (SME's).Advanced report creation in Excel, Power BI, SSRS, JasperSoft or SSAS1 year of experience with the following:Intermediate skills/experience with SharePoint, sufficient to support, manage, edit, and maintain sites, document repositories, workspaces, libraries, lists, views, etc.Analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Modeling processes, determining requirements, analyzing alternatives, and verifying solutions to meet business needs. Desired Qualifications (Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills) Associate's Degree in Information Technology, Business Systems or closely related technical discipline is preferred. (Associates degree in applicable discipline can be substituted for 2 years required experience)Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Business Systems or a closely related technical discipline is highly desired (Bachelor's degree in applicable discipline can substitute for 4 years related experience).Experience in organizational change management methods and tools.Ability to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.Ability to communicate with diverse groups, executives, managers, highly technical people and lead requirements definition and requirements workshops.Strong technical writing skills and the ability to present information in various forms such as textual, graphical and statistical If you feel you are qualified for this position, express interest by clicking the Apply button below (if you are viewing this position on the Salient CRGT website). If you are viewing this job posting outside of the Salient CRGT website, please visit: www.salientcrgt.com/careers to express interest in this position through the Salient CRGT Careers page.  Salient CRGT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other factor prohibited by applicable anti-discrimination laws.SDL2017

Name: Project Manager/Sr. Analyst
Description: You succeed because you get things done. You’ve had hard-won project success through practical approaches and excellent communication. You’ve taken on more challenging engagements, but lately the work seems to be about completing forms, filing reports, and checking boxes … not your idea of a fulfilling career. It’s time to check out Resource Data. We’re all about achievement and our project managers are at the heart of that. They fill diverse roles and work with technical staff, clients, and business users. They understand effective project management is about communication and they pay attention to the little things. Some of their other attributes includeExpert analysts with the ability to assure business needs are met in the systems they deliver.Relational managers that lead engaged teams and expand our work. Proactive communicators that use their influence and diplomacy to smooth tensions.Interested? Let’s look at your first year here. Three months into the jobYou’ve started with an existing client, tackling some of the identified analysis needs. You’re getting a feel for the client’s organization and the team dynamics.You have quickly earned the team’s respect and they are in support of you taking on broader aspects of the client’s business problem.You’ve gained insight into the technical decisions made to date and how they support the business needs. You’re making sure that business users can validate their requirements in the solution design.After six months on the jobYou’ve gained the complete confidence of the client. They know you represent their interests and trust you as a partner. You have taken on ownership for several segments of the project.You are establishing communication patterns with the client, the project team, and with other Resource Data staff. They are recognizing your leadership abilities. You’ve built a network at Resource Data. You appreciate the level of autonomy you have, but also the wide array of talent available for support, when needed.Project leadership at Resource Data is relational and based on accomplishment, not titles. After six months, the client’s business team and technical staff default to you with questions and feedback.At the end of year one, you have absolutely no regrets about joining Resource Data and are looking forward to continuing to build your career here.You are making use of Resource Data systems to easily provide budget updates and regular status reports to the client. You are easily fulfilling your project management responsibilities.You’ve engaged your entrepreneurial spirit and are looking for opportunities with your existing clients, as well as ways to engage new clients.You’re able to bring in more junior staff members to your team; they stay highly productive while growing. You’re fully integrated into Resource Data and are considered a peer with our other project managers. You’re leading training sessions and facilitating company-wide roundtable discussions.Only one year ago the client was concerned whether a new person would be able to come in and deliver. Their assessment is exactly the opposite now – they credit you and Resource Data with their success and are looking forward to a continued partnership. This is the project that launches your long and successful career here. Our staff has gone on to lead critical enterprise projects, run branch offices, and oversee major aspects of the business. No matter what your career aspirations are, we have opportunities for you. Interested? We should talk! Send us your resume and a quick summary of two significant accomplishments. One should be related to a team project and the other an individual accomplishment highlighting a consultant-type role. They should each be a paragraph or two and the more descriptive (fewer bullets) the better. Starting in Alaska 30 years ago, Resource Data has grown to over 180 professionals in 5 offices. We’re ready and eager to demonstrate high value results to local clients through our commitment to people, technology, and results.Resource Data, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Unfortunately, we are not able to provide any visa sponsorship or transfers for this position.Keywords: PMP, PMP Certified, Project Management, Database, Analysis, PMP, Software Development, Technical Project Manager, Custom Development, Data Warehouse, Reporting, Consulting, Professional Services, SDLC, Scrum, Business Analysis

Name: Senior Database Analyst
Description: Who We Are: Inflexion is a nonprofit consulting group that helps educators better prepare students for life. Our mission is to make education work for all students. We give districts and schools a new way to look at themselves with all their complexity and culture to find ways to create a learning community with the best systems and supports to ensure all students graduate ready for college, career, and life. What We Need: Inflexion has an immediate opening for a full-time (1.0 FTE) Senior Database Analyst to work out of our office in Portland, Oregon. We are looking for a candidate who will contribute collaboratively to our 5-person Business Technology Team to maintain, develop and enhance a web-based application and a large set of dynamic data. What You Need To Know: MySQL experience is required (PostGreSQL, MariaDB, SQL will be considered) Experience in web based software development is strongly preferred What You Will Be Doing: Data reporting Data maintenance QA testing Software documentation What You Need To Be Successful: We expect the incumbent to be highly skilled, intrinsically motivated, enthusiastic about our mission, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to balance working alone and with others. The position requires strong communication and analytical skills, including the ability to confer with end-users, clients, and developers. The ability to accept and provide constructive feedback is highly valued for this role. We encourage you to read through our website to learn more about our philosophy, values, and work portfolio. What We Offer: Inflexion wages are based on a nonprofit market-based compensation scale, with the annual starting salary for this exempt position ranging from $64,800 to $76,500. Inflexion offers a highly competitive benefits package currently including medical, dental, vision, life, 403(b) retirement plan that incorporates base and match employer contributions, pretax medical flexible-spending, dependent care, pretax transportation, and a generous paid-time-off program. This is not a telecommuting opportunity. How to Apply: To apply to this position, please click "Apply Now" link below. You will be asked to submit a cover letter and rsum. In your cover letter, please specifically address how you are qualified to perform each one of the primary responsibilities and why you are a good fit for Inflexion. Inflexion is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer Inflexion provides equal opportunity for all qualified persons and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status. This policy applies to recruitment, placement, promotion, training, transfer, retention, rate of pay, and all other details and conditions of employment. Grievances should be brought to the executive director or Inflexion Board of Directors. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history and identity verification. Application Link: https://inflexion.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk01bkb?cjb_hash=O_htUo77&apply_now=true - provided by DiceMySQL, MariaDB, SQL, PostgreSQL

lbs.Ability to perform repetitive hand movements for long periods of time.BenefitsHealth insurance, 401K matching, professional development budget, optional voluntary insruance2 weeks of accrued paid Intuitive Digital Values: Our values were chiseled out of the bedrock of our collective experience and ground down to actionable phrases. (translation: these are important) Build Long-Term Relationships is the practice of seeking first to understand before being understood, communicating effectively, providing excellent service, and always going the distance for a team member or partner.Do What’s Right is the practice of being honest, taking responsibility for mistakes, and always fighting for the best solution on behalf of partners.Create Fun is the practice of making space for play, showcasing a culture of fun, and understanding that work is a joyful privilege.Continuous Improvement is the practice of bringing a spirit of learning into every single day, improving a process every time it is touched, making every account a success that can be shared, and admitting that there is a more effective way to do everything. This position supports reporting requirements for SCS reporting in Hyperion, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI and Sharepoint maintenance. This position will create and manage very complex reports, ad-hoc queries, and on demand reports consumed by SCS. It will also perform data analysis, offering suggestion for improvement to management. It will also interface with users to support functional requirements development.  The team is collaborative and transparent in how they work. They follow a calendar that has a standard cadence but have to be agile for emergency work as well. The best in this position remain agile to change. Mandatory QualificationsRequired Experience: A minimum combination of work-related experience, on-the-job training, and/or vocational training is desired. Experience should be consistent with the specific requirements of Information Technology, Business Systems, or other related IT specialty.This is a Level 2 position: 10 years previous Information Technology, Business Systems or other closely related technical experience (or a combination thereof) is required without a degree (6+ years required with an applicable Bachelor’s Degree; 8+ years required with an applicable Associates Degree).3 years of experience with the following: Creating complex SQL’s and ad-hoc queries into a relational databaseDatabase knowledge of the Asset Suite enterprise asset management application (or similar enterprise relational database applications) sufficient to create complex queries without input from Subject Matter Experts (SME’s).Advanced report creation in Excel, Power BI, SSRS, JasperSoft or SSAS1 year of experience with the following: Intermediate skills/experience with SharePoint, sufficient to support, manage, edit, and maintain sites, document repositories, workspaces, libraries, lists, views, etc.Analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Modeling processes, determining requirements, analyzing alternatives, and verifying solutions to meet business needs.How to Apply If you feel you are qualified for this position, express interest by clicking the Apply button. If you would like to know more about Salient and other job posting please visit: www.salientcrgt.com/careers. Req 2018-7723 Salient CRGT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other factor prohibited by applicable anti-discrimination laws.Company DescriptionSalient CRGT is a leading provider of health, data analytics, cloud, agile software development, mobility, cyber security, and infrastructure solutions. Headquartered in Fairfax, VA, Salient CRGT has 22 offices, plus personnel in more than 270 locations across the United States and overseas.  Our 2,400 employees support these core capabilities with full lifecycle IT services and training, helping our customers meet critical goals for pivotal missions. We are purpose-built for IT transformation supporting federal civilian, defense, homeland, and intelligence agencies, as well as Fortune 1000 companies.  Salient CRGT offers excellent benefits, including 15 days PTO, 10 holidays, and tuition reimbursement. Medical, Dental, Vision, and Short and Long-Term disability are also offered.

Name: Disability Management Consultant
Description: To provide initial triage, education and management of disability claims for KPNW employees. Supports managers at the department head level and Disability Case Managers on a daily basis. Work with KPNW supervisor/managers and employees to assure disabled employees are receiving all available DM Services. Primary trainer on DM services and systems.Essential Responsibilities:Facilitate and monitor all paperwork related to an employee claim of a work related injury or illness. Facilitate and monitor claims processing based on State mandated timelines.Population, maintenance and system management of the DM Database which is used to track all DM Cases.Assures regulatory compliance by maintaining and tracking pertinent information. This includes contacting supervisors when in receipt of information from Occupational Health or the Worker's Compensation TPA regarding claims paperwork that does not have the required State forms 801/SIF-2 which are needed for compliance.Provide education to supervisors and managers via telephone, email or written materials regarding their responsibilities as related to compliance of claims reporting.Provides initial consultation to managers and employees for all incoming Workers' Compensation Claims.Assigned Case Management Service Area. Provides Case Management for all of the following: Understand federal and state laws and how these interact with the multiple labor contracts and KPNW policies including leave of absence, ADAAA, Worker's Compensation and return to work. Provide consultation to employees and managers on federal, state and contractual leaves of absence, ADAAA, Worker's Compensation and Return to Work issues. Ensure that the integration of the various disability management programs are facilitated as needed and that any benefits are provided in a timely and accurate manner. Ensure integration with other benefit programs such as Short Term Disability (STD), Long Term Disability (LTD), health benefits, paid time off programs, and other internal and external benefits. Conduct the ADAAA interactive process, including determining appropriate and reasonable accommodation. Facilitate the return to work process for employees with occupational and non-occupational injuries or illness who have restrictions and find available and suitable work within the region. Identify employees with occupational and non-occupational injuries or illness who are unable to return to a suitable position within the region due to their limitations. Refer the employee to applicable resources such as vocational rehab, ADAAA interactive process, or retirement. Document all correspondence, medical documentation, meetings, and interactions with the employee, manager, and any involved parties. This includes tracking the progress of the case and initiating any follow-up. Partner with HR Consultants in managing escalated cases that also involve labor management issues. Collaborate with third party vendors to manage leave of absence or worker's compensation cases, including complex issues. Represent the employer's interests with informed decision-making on complex and litigated worker's compensation cases. Provide instruction to managers and timekeepers on how to appropriately code an employee's timecard while on leave or in transitional work for both occupational and non-occupational injury and illness.As a team member, support the Disability Management Department to improve department wide programs, planning and educational materials.Monitors TPA to assure claims information accuracy.Complete a wide variety of services while maintaining confidentiality of employee's personal and medical information.Work autonomously supporting the departmental needs and within committees applying the regulatory and administrative requirements of the department.Provide training to managers, supervisors, employees, labor, safety committees and the medical community about the region's disability management policies, procedures and compliance. This includes Leave of Absence (FMLA, OFLA, WFLA, WFCA, Contractual/KP Policy, etc), ADAAA, Worker's Compensation and Return to Work Program.Assist Occupational Health with claims information as needed.Provides a wide variety of services in a confidential environment supporting information needs of other departments, committees and safety initiatives.Maintain applicable certifications and actively participate in education continuation opportunities for all areas of the program.Basic Qualifications:ExperienceMinimum two (2) years of experience in Return to Work Programs, Disability Management, ADAAA Case Management Workers' Compensation or Leaves of AbsenceEducationBachelor's degree in business administration or related field OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field.High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required.License, Certification, RegistrationValid driver's license and the ability to travel throughout the NW region required upon hire/transferCPDM (Certified Professional Disability Management) or similar professional licensure required within three years of hireOregon Workers' Compensation Claims Examiner certification required within one year of hire or a minimum five (5) years of recent experience in Workers' Compensation program administration in lieu of the certificationAdditional Requirements:Experience working with injuries/illness and physical limitations.In-depth understanding of the laws and regulations related to leave of absence and disability management, including but not limited to FMLA, OFLA, WFLA, WFCA, ADA, etc.Working knowledge of physical job analysis and job description essential functions.Functional understanding of Ergonomics and worksite modification.Demonstrated customer-focused service skills.Demonstrated group presentation skills to instruct, inform and persuade.Basic understanding of regulatory requirements, bargaining agreements and workplace safety principles.Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.Demonstrated ability to tolerate and cope with ambiguous situations.Creative, innovative, self-directed, works well in a team environment.Strong problem solving skills.Basic computer skills.Preferred Qualifications:Minimum three (3) years of experience with Kaiser Permanente Northwest.Minimum one (1) year of experience processing WC related information in a claims office or equivalent.Working knowledge of Kaiser Permanente departments and functions.Ability to type 60 WPM or equivalent keyboarding skills.

Name: Lead Strategic Marketplace Analyst -Demand and Supply Management (DSM)
Description: At Nike, we serve athletes. Fueled by the insights of the world's best, we design and create products to elevate human potential on a global scale. And it's on us, the Global Operations Team (GOT), to help bring this mission to life.  We are a diverse lineup of thousands spread across the globe. Together, we are building a smarter, more connected and automated value chain. And we are looking for world-class talent like you to contribute to this journey.  Working in Nike's Marketplace Analytics team will be rewarding, it will be challenging, and it will most definitely not be just another job. You'll be an ambassador of the Nike brand -- everything we stand for: drive, determination, the unyielding commitment to excellence, these all will be a part of your everyday experience. We're committed to making every consumer's experience a rewarding one, and as a member of our analytics team, your contributions will be a big part of our success. OVERVIEW As the Lead Key City Analyst, you will help the team make decisions that will drive performance, directly leading to the accomplishment of annual goals. You will support leadership to help drive insights and will be the point person on understanding the business. You will apply various data modeling techniques to mine data for the identification of trends that suggest new business opportunities. You will serve as an evangelist for the power of predictive/ prescriptive analysis. You will think broadly and creatively about the role of analytics at Nike and about how your work can be used to inspire the broader organization.  You must be a self-starter, flexible thinker, and outstanding communicator who is comfortable learning quickly and connecting the dots between disparate methodologies. You will need those skills as you work across multiple functions and geographies within Nikes matrixed organization. Success will depend on your ability to quickly form both professional and personal relationships with colleagues and drive to rigorous, actionable, user-friendly deliverables.  Overall, we are looking for someone who is passionate about working with numbers, who is highly technical but also has strong business acumen. The candidate should be self-driven, proactive and must show the capacity to manage several concurrent tracks of work. Superb teamwork skills are essential as is to communicate complicated ideas and conclusions in simple business terms. QualificationsBachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Marketing, Statistics or a related field (an additional 2 years of experience in lieu of a degree). MS/MBA preferred.Minimum 8 years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on business reporting and analytics required.Strong technical and analytical skillset required. Proficient in data wrangling and cleansing, optimization, simulation, and statistical analysisProven ability to sift through data, identify critical information, develop hypotheses, apply relevant techniques, and perform rigorous analyses quickly and consistentlyExperience, interest, and adaptability to working in a fast-paced, ambiguous environmentExceptional interpersonal and communication skills, and ability to communicate complex concepts to senior and business audiencesStrong project management experience managing multiple project streams and delivering results across cross-functional teams. Propensity for thinking through projects in a process-oriented mannerExpert skill level in Excel and SQL as well as familiarity with R, SAS, or Python. Comfortable in Cognos. Tableau and familiarity with big data environments is preferred, but not required.Demonstrated ability to learn new tools quickly and independentlyDemonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making.Ability to develop strong partnerships across a multi-layered organization requiredExperience in developing an understanding of customers, competitors and retail trends; knowledge of sports apparel and footwear market preferredFamiliarity with Nike product types and how they are marketed and distributed to accounts is strongly preferred

Name: Customs Analyst
Description: Job Description The Nike, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accountants, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide - making the impossible happen every single day. Description Work alongside a team of knowledgeable, dedicated, and professional employees in a fast paced and dynamic work environment. Be on the front lines of the one of the most "iconic" shoe and clothing brands in the world! Every day brings new challenges and new opportunities to learn and grow. Working with our organization will be rewarding, challenging, and most definitely not be just another job.  Scope and Responsibilities: As the US Customs / Footwear Import Analyst your role on the team will include: Classify footwear according to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States in an accurate and efficient mannerRespond to US Customs Brokers requests for information regarding import shipments.Communicate daily with appropriate parties, including foreign factories to obtain information necessary for Customs clearance.Monitor regulatory changes and help with revising compliance policies and practices in accordance with changing legal framework and business modelsParticipate in special projects or programs such as Free Trade, duty drawback, and carnetsCollect and compile brokerage metric reports and report results to import team and personnel in other departmentsProvide training on import compliance topics as requestedAttend line reviews with departments to provide guidance on the forecasted duty rate for footwearIdentify applicability for duty-free entry using trade preference programs or other duty free provisions in the US regulations.Help maintain written procedures for the nominated U.S. Customs brokers.QualificationsBachelor's degree, plus a minimum of 2 years relevant work experience. In lieu of a degree, an additional two years of experience is acceptable.Knowledge of U.S. Customs regulations and HTSUS Classification.Footwear classification experience strongly preferredProficiency in Microsoft Office, internet, web-based and job specific applications.Demonstrated experience handling multiple projects with competing priorities.Strong attention to details and proficient recordkeeping and database maintenance skillsDemonstrated experience meeting time sensitive deadlines.Cooperative and willing to assist others / team player.US Customer Brokers License preferred.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionChat with a recruiter today! Follow this link: https://flashrecruit.com/jobs/446627 OVERVIEW We are seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst (BSA) in Portland, OR to own solution definition and manage requirements for agile software projects focused on healthcare transactions, data transformation and reporting. BSAs are responsible for all aspects of software requirements elicitation and intake, modeling and documentation, organization, prioritization, verification and validation. Through their excellence in the execution of all requirements management activities, BSAs build productive relationships with both clients and software delivery teams, and they enable the success of both the client and team by making sure we are delivering against a correct, cohesive and precisely defined requirements backlog.  The BSA works closely with clients to understand their business needs, key stakeholders, technology needs and product vision. By bridging the gap between client business stakeholders and the development team, the BSA makes sure that development efforts are well-guided and deliver value.  The ideal BSA candidate is someone with a deep understanding of what it takes to build out a requirements backlog that is clear, concise, accurate, and represents requirements at the right level of detail. Given the technical nature of the role, the BSA must be competent and comfortable working on the technical aspects of software projects as well, diving into the details of systems, interfaces, APIs, data structures and mapping, querying, and scripting. The ideal BSA is also adept at communication and facilitation; he or she knows how to bring people together to solve problems, resolve conflicts and make decisions.  Experience in software delivery is critical this role must understand the operational execution of and challenges around how enterprise, web and mobile applications are built, enhanced and modernized. BSAs welcome complex challenges and relish the opportunity to consult with clients to solve their problems and transform their approach to requirements management and product ownership.  BSAs build trust by communicating flawlessly, establishing trust and credibility, delivering to their commitments, understanding problems, crafting solutions, providing thought leadership and offering observations and recommendations to improve clients requirements management practices. ROLE DESCRIPTION Our Business Systems Analysts are professionals on the front lines of agile software delivery they consult with clients and stakeholders, elicit and model requirements, verify requirements quality, validate requirements accuracy, and ensure that development teams have excellent, stable requirements to build software from. Technical BSAs drive both project success and client satisfaction by communicating flawlessly, delivering to commitments, recognizing and managing risks and issues, aligning clients and teams to best practices, solving problems, encouraging innovation and providing thought leadership. RESPONSIBILITIES Business Systems Analysis and Requirements Management Quickly understands clients business issues and technical challenges as well as their organization and industry.Collaborates with client Product Owner to understand and define the product roadmap and minimum viable product (MVP) for a project. Understands and supervises the production of requirements, specifications, and recommendations related to proposed solutions.Reviews, analyzes and revises requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solutions.Creates and delivers quality requirements of all types business, stakeholder, functional, non-functional and transition - for software solutions.Expertly documents and refines requirements in the models appropriate for the client and project, e.g., user stories & acceptance criteria, scenarios and use cases, data models, data flow diagrams, process models, scope models, sequence diagrams, state diagrams, API documentation, etc.Capably leads and facilitates requirements-related events and activities, e.g., brainstorming sessions, story mapping, focus groups, interviews, observation, interface analysis, requirements workshops, structured walkthroughs, backlog grooming and estimation, etc.Ensures that requirements are of impeccable quality, meaning that they are correct, consistent, complete, cohesive, modifiable, unambiguous, feasible, independent, negotiable, verifiable, estimable, sized appropriately and testable.Works with clients to appropriately organize and prioritize all requirements.Maintains a backlog of 2 sprints worth of fully defined, estimated, dev-ready cards/stories for the project team. Project Execution Ensures deliverables meet quality standards.Reviews and ensures the quality of both internal-facing and client-facing deliverables.Understands the software development lifecycle.Coaches team through best practices in requirements management. Consulting and Client Relationship Management Understands the business domain and technical domain well enough to understand and respond to domain-specific risks.Develops strong relationships with client stakeholders, leading to partnership and collaboration around requirements risks and issues.Communicates effectively with clients to identify business needs and evaluate solutions.Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships.Manages client expectations effectively.Identifies opportunities for improvement in client processes and tactfully advocates for action. Communication Facilitates team and client meetings.Delivers informative, well-organized presentations.Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.Facilitates decision making, conflict resolution and clear understanding of trade-offs.Acts as a liaison between technical and non-technical stakeholders. Problem Solving Identifies, manages and resolves critical issues with ease.Exhibits confidence and knowledge of industry practices when resolving project issues. Culture and Leadership Leads by example.Takes responsibility for personal performance and success.Demonstrates action orientation by moving decisively, learning from mistakes, and taking initiative.Communicates and listens actively to build relationships and eliminate misunderstandingsStrives to set the standard and perform at the highest level in all activities.Provides constructive feedback to team, peers and senior management in order to drive personal, professional and organizational growth.REQUIRED SKILLSPossesses an expert understanding of software requirements management, and a solid understanding of user experience design, application programming and system design.Has a high level understanding of software systems and architectures.Proven in-depth, hands-on experience with Agile/Scrum/Lean software development methods, including the ability to lead and execute all software requirements/backlog management activities.Proven success in leading requirements management activities for new application development and/or application modernization/re-write projects.Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills.Ethical, organized and trustworthy.Strong oral and written communications skills.Strong facilitation skills.Proven experience balancing multiple priorities and dealing with ambiguity.Ability to teach/mentor others around best practices in business systems analysis and requirements management.Experience in using/administering an issue management system (Jira, Rally, VersionOne, etc.).Certification in business analysis (CCBA, CBAP, PMI-PBA) is a big plus.Certification in agile disciplines and/or agile product ownership (PMI-ACP, CSPO, SAFe POPM) are a plus.Consulting experience, particularly in the private sector and/or retail operations, is a big plus.REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLSProven competency and comfort working on the technical aspects of software projects and systems analysis, including diving into the details of systems, interfaces, APIs, data structures and mapping, querying, and scripting.Proven competency interpreting and delivering elements of systems design, including data migration rules, business rules, data models, API documentation and service contracts.Proven competency in data analysis, data mapping and SQL querying, and in performing data manipulation through data conversion scripting.Familiarity with programming languages and software development strongly preferred.Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in IT / Computer Science, mathematics, or other technical discipline preferred. Name: SAP MM Business Analyst

The nature of the work is focused on the company's computer and telephony technology tools used to create, store, exchange, and use all forms of information. Name: Data Strategy Analyst
Description: OverviewIn 2007, in a rental apartment in Columbus, Ohio DiscoverOrg had the vision of building the world’s foremost sales enablement tool. To get there our CEO Henry Schuck and co-founder maxed out their credit cards and borrowed every dime they could find. By 2012, DiscoverOrg had grown to 35 employees and $5 million of revenue. Since then, we’ve taken funding from Global Private Equity firms like TA Associates and The Carlyle Group, and grown to over $150M+ in annualized revenue. However, we’ve been careful not to lose the culture that has made us strong. We’re lean, we’re nimble, we’re passionate and we’re changing the lives of salespeople and business development representatives all over the world. We make mistakes, we are humble, and we are data driven.  If you are the type of person who has to know how things work, and questions why things are the way that they are, then you may be a great fit for our Data Strategy Analyst role. We are looking for an analytical thinker interested in making sense of large quantities of data, and who isn’t afraid to question the status quo. In this position, you will have the opportunity to make an impact on DiscoverOrg’s core product, while further developing your data analysis skills along the way.ResponsibilitiesHere is what a typical day will look like as the Data Strategy Analyst:Works with the Data Strategy team on integrating new data offerings into the DiscoverOrg platform.Helps to analyze and assess potential data partners and relationships.Offers insights on improvements to existing research tools and technologies, and the development of new solutions to improve efficiency and accuracy of our data.Optimizes existing data filters and algorithms to increase efficiency QualificationsYou're likely a great fit for this opportunity if you have the following:Bachelor's Degree in an analytical field and 1+ years of experience working in a data related capacity, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.An ability to interpret large amounts of data.A great problem solver, inquisitive, resourceful, and high cognitive ability.An ability to work independently and manage multiple projects at once.Experience with MS Excel, SQL, or data analysis related tools.Knowledge and an interest in the data that fuels sales and marketing campaigns BenefitsWe offer an attractive benefits plan with health benefits that include three medical coverage options, vision and dental coverage – HSA, FSA, 401(k) with employer match, paid parental leave, paid time off, and paid sick leave.Why You Should Join DiscoverOrg:An 8-time honoree of the Inc. 5000 fastest growing private companiesSoftware Industry (SIIA) 2017 Growth Company of the YearA three time recipient of the Deloitte Fast 500 awardWas named the 2017 Growth Company of the Year at the Oregon Technology AwardsIs the industry bellwether with award-winning productsSupported by an award-winning Learning and Development teamIs led by an EY Entrepreneur of the Year finalistHas an impressive 4.6 star rating on GlassdoorIs honored to be a 2017 Fortune Magazine Best Workplaces, andFinally, is recognized as a 2017 Inc. Magazine Top 50 Best Workplaces DiscoverOrg is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive work environment. Our policy on equal opportunity and anti-discrimination applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

Name: Director, Membership Business Growth, North America
Description: Nikes Consumer Direct Offense is  designed to serve the athlete faster and more personally, at scale, led by  digital. With focused growth through key categories, this new offense will  connect the NIKE Brand and products with consumers in new and more powerful  ways. At the heart of the Consumer Direct Offense is Nikes new membership  program that will provide member-only access to the products and experiences  members love, matched to their individual preferences and behavior patterns.  Our mission is to create the worlds most distinctive membership program that  accelerates consumer connections while driving growth and profitability for the  Nike Brand.  The Role: We are looking for a data-driven growth hacker to join the North  America Membership team in the newly created role of Director, Member Growth. This  leader will create and manage the membership growth plan in North America, with  a focus on managing a membership P&L, growth KPIs and targets as well as  designing growth strategies to increase the growth and profitability of Nikes  Membership program through the use of data analytics. This is a hands-on, cross  functional role at the intersection of marketing and business and is focused on  member acquisition, activation, retention and upsell. Ideal backgrounds for  this role include leaders with expertise in operating digital business with a  focus on driving consumer growth and monetization. Candidates should have experience  building consumer-centric growth business models and both business and financial  measurement.  This role will have strong influence  on the future direction of Nikes membership program in NA, and we are looking  for candidates with a track record of building and leading high performing  teams in fast paced and complex environments, with a desire to be at the center  of a massive transformation of Nikes digital and direct capabilities.  Flexibility, drive, and communication capabilities will be critical  characteristics.  Key responsibilities of this role  include: Define  the NA member growth plan, design and execute growth programs with cross  functional teams, and optimize the member funnel against growth KPIs and  targetsDevelop  economic analysis frameworks to support decisions related to member  segments and benefit performance in NA and key citiesIdentify  and prioritize opportunities to drive consumer-focused business growth  through business analytics, and partner with cross functional teams bring  new growth hacks to market quicklyHelp develop growth  hacking, growth hacking learnings, and a culture of A/B testing and  experimentation with data-driven hypotheses and reportingOperationalize  the processes for tracking and assessing progress against goals, risks,  and areas of opportunityPartner  with Nikes NA finance team and consumer and business analytics teams to  link activities within the membership program to Nikes P&L and growth  funnelLead  and coach one direct report (Manager, NA Member Benefits Analyst) to  maximize the impact of the Member Growth team Success for this role requires the  establishment of a best-in-class membership program, driven by a strong  understanding of both consumer connectivity and profitable growth. But beyond  the core responsibilities, this role must also be a key contributor to the  evolution of Nikes business model and the acceleration of the Consumer Direct  Offense with membership at the center.Qualifications8-12 years  relevant experience in growth roles in media, marketing, consumer  subscription business, or a startupEducational  experience in Economics, Finance, and/or Business StrategyExperience in a  startup environment and/or having a startup mindsetA/B testing  and data analytics experienceBackground influencing  teams to drive business growth from loyalty/membership programs or digital  commerce and technology at major global companiesExperience  applying behavioral economics in subscription or member-centric business modelsExperience  developing economic models and decision frameworksExperience  translating economic opportunities into compelling stories, influencing the  work of cross-functional partnersExperience  with digital commerce and content platforms is a plus

We support these core capabilities with full lifecycle IT services and training—to help our customers meet critical goals for pivotal missions. We are purpose-built for IT transformation supporting federal civilian, defense, homeland, and intelligence agencies, as well as Fortune 1000 companies.  In this role you will support Bonneville Power Administration’s (BPA’s) Transmission Services Project Management Analysis & Scheduling (TEPO) organization. The position will also provide support to the Construction & Maintenance Services (TFH) organization. This position will facilitate the optimization of BPA’s Transmission planning and execution of capital programs. In addition, this position will support both large transformational initiatives as well as desk-level improvement initiatives within the business unit.  TEPO provides technical input, project and financial analysis support for project and program managers within the larger Transmission Engineering organization. TFH manages construction crews who travel out of Ross to assist in large projects across the districts, typically for capital work that has a big portion of electrician work. Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: Sr. Business Systems Analyst  If you are a Senior Business Systems Analyst with experience, please read on! Top Reasons to Work with Us 1. Based in Portland, we use data analytics to create and maintain high-performance agile development teams that deliver innovative software design for the digital enterprises.2. Our company has been around for over a decade, so we offer a unique balance of stability and a small, tight-knit feel.3. You will have the chance to work on exciting new development projects with a talented team. What You Will Be Doing - Consult with clients and stakeholders, elicit and model requirements, verify requirements quality, validate requirements accuracy, and ensure that development teams have excellent, stable requirements to build software from. - Quickly understands clients' business issues and technical challenges as well as their organization and industry.- Collaborates with client Product Owner to understand and define the product roadmap and minimum viable product (MVP) for a project. Understands and supervises the production of requirements, specifications, and recommendations related to proposed solutions.- Understands the business domain and technical domain well enough to understand and respond to domain-specific risks.- Develops strong relationships with client stakeholders, leading to partnership and collaboration around requirements risks and issues. What You Need for this Position - Possesses an expert understanding of software requirements management, and a solid understanding of user experience design, application programming and system design.- Has a high level understanding of software systems and architectures. - Proven in-depth, hands-on experience with Agile/Scrum/Lean software development methods, including the ability to lead and execute all software requirements/backlog management activities.- Proven success in leading requirements management activities for new application development and/or application modernization/re-write projects.- Proven experience balancing multiple priorities and dealing with ambiguity.- Ability to teach/mentor others around best practices in business systems analysis and requirements management.- Experience in using/administering an issue management system (Jira, Rally, VersionOne, etc.).- Certification in business analysis (CCBA, CBAP, PMI-PBA) is a big plus.- Certification in agile disciplines and/or agile product ownership (PMI-ACP, CSPO, SAFe POPM) are a plus.- Consulting experience, particularly in the private sector and/or retail operations, is a big plus.REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS- Proven competency and comfort working on the technical aspects of software projects and systems analysis, including diving into the details of systems, interfaces, APIs, data structures and mapping, querying, and scripting.- Proven competency interpreting and delivering elements of systems design, including data migration rules, business rules, data models, API documentation and service contracts. - Proven competency in data analysis, data mapping and SQL querying, and in performing data manipulation through data conversion scripting.- Familiarity with programming languages and software development strongly preferred.- Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in IT / Computer Science, mathematics, or other technical discipline preferred. What's In It for You - Competitive salary- Vacation/PTO- Medical- Dental- Vision- Bonus- 401k  So, if you are a Senior Business Systems Analyst with experience, please apply today!  - Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Your Right to Work In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Job ID: 37702Systems Analyst The Systems Analyst (SA) is a member of the Information Systems (IS) team. The position is responsible for analyzing the agency workflows and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems across the organization. The position is challenged to automate and/or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities and limitations. In addition, improvements and automation, the SA is an active participant in software administration tasks, which includes but not limited to major software updates. The SA position works collaboratively with other IT team members and internal/external stakeholders to understand and translate agency needs into conceptual designs, data visualization, and system enhancements.Systems Analyst Responsibilities Consult with managers to determine the role of the IT system in the organization. Research emerging technologies to decide if they can increase the organization’s effectiveness and efficiency. Read manuals, periodicals, and technical reports to learn how to develop applications that meet agency needs. Prepare an analysis of costs and benefits so that management can decide if IS upgrades are financially worthwhile. Devise ways to add new functionality to existing computer systems. Expand or modify systems to serve new purposes and/or improve workflow. Design and develop new systems by choosing and configuring software. Oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of information systems. Customize software applications to align them with company operations. Develop, document and revise system designs, tests, and quality standards. Conduct testing to ensure the systems work as expected. Assist in training end users and writing instruction manuals. Provide staff with assistance solving computer related problems, such as malfunctions and application issues. Confer with customers/staff regarding the nature of the information processing or computation needs. Perform ongoing monitoring and refinement of reports. Attend all mandatory trainings. Adhere to all state and federal privacy regulations, including HIPAA and 42 CFR Part 2, and to company policies and agreements regarding confidentiality, privacy, and security. Support compliance with all privacy and security requirements pursuant to community partners’ and outside providers’ patient confidentiality agreements, including privacy and security requirements for EMR access. This includes immediately reporting any breach of protected health information or personal identification information of any person receiving services by the company or an outside provider to the Compliance Department, as well as to your supervisor or their designee. The System Analyst may also perform other duties as assigned that are aligned with analyzing, designing, and implementing information systems, which includes determining the suitability of IS solutions in terms of their intended outcomes, functions and interactions with end users, software vendors and programmers to achieve desired outcomes.Systems Analyst Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science (CS) OR equivalent combination of education and experience. 2+ years experience in business/systems analysis, application development, report writing or other IS activities. Good understanding in user experience and interface design and development. Familiar with Visual Studio IDE. Knowledgeable in Visual Basic and/or C#. Accomplished with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or other web development languages. Capable in Unified Modeling Language, wireframes, and/or other design practices. Experienced in writing queries, views and stored procedure in T-SQL. Skillful in reporting tools, such as SQL Server Report Services. Knowledgeable in Design Thinking, Lean Thinking and/or Agile practices. Must be able to work a flexible schedule. Candidates must be proficient in collaborating with product owners and development teams to understand and contribute to vision and value of specific projects. Candidate is a skilled expert in navigating competing requirements and technical restraints in innovative environments. Candidate is knowledgeable in documenting use cases, process maps, and design/lean/agile artifacts.Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree MIS, CS or a Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree. Desired Certifications: Certification of Capability in Business Analysis (CCBA). Project Management Professional (PMP). Certified Scrum Master (CSM). Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO). Continual Education certifications related to SA responsibilities. 5+ years’ experience in business/systems analysis, application development, report writing or other IS activities. Advanced understanding of SQL Server and related tools and languages. Professional UML and prototyping experience. 1-2 years C# developer experience using Visual Studio. History of working on full stack web development projects/product. Benefits Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k. About VanderHouwen  VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.

Name: Data Modeler / Analyst
Description: Data Modeler / Analyst Portland, OR  This is an excellent opportunity to join AZAD Technology Partners' team of professionals as a Data Modeler / Analyst. The AZAD consultant will contribute to established data integration and reporting groups and will be responsible for gathering and transforming business and technical requirements into conceptual, logical and physical data models repositories.  The ideal candidates will possess the following experience and qualifications:  Experience performing logical data modeling, physical data modeling (including reverse engineering) using the Erwin Data Modeling tool. Data modeling experience with a strong emphasis on the design and development of conceptual, logical and physical data models using industry standard tools such as Popkin, Computer Associate’s AllFusion Data Modeler (Erwin) or Sybase’s Power Designer. Experience performing logical data model design including normalization/denormalization referential integrity, data domains; primary and foreign key assignments and data element definitions as applied to both relational and dimensional modeling. Demonstrated experience in the gathering, assimilation, organization, categorization and analysis of business requirements to create corresponding designs of logical and physical data models. Such tasks may include client interviews and/or facilitating Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions. Experience with technical interviewing in the Information Technology environment. Assist Business Subject Matter Experts and data stewards to review and “scrub” their data in a timely manner and perform data audits, as necessary. Assist in creation of document data flow diagrams, entity relationship diagrams and other project deliverables, as requested. Ability to assist project team with trouble-shooting of “data issues” as they arise during testing cycles. Ability to conduct data modeling sessions with business users and technical staff, which includes conveying complex ideas both verbally and in written form. Ability to negotiate priorities and resolve requirement conflicts among various stakeholders. Desired:  Experience in FIPS 184 Integration Definition for Information Modeling (IDEF1X) or experience with an alternative modeling notation such as Information Engineering (IE). AZAD Technology Partners is looking for bright, talented, flexible, and customer centric problem solvers who enjoy the challenges associated with solving the most complex problems by utilizing the most sophisticated technologies and strong people skills.  Founded and managed by technologists and engineers, AZAD is a leading provider of Technology Consulting and Engineering Solutions to Fortune 500 and innovative high-tech firms since 1992. AZAD works closely with its clients to solve their most complex technological challenges. Join AZAD's professional team and enhance your career by being engaged with some of the most innovative projects in the Pacific Northwest.  Our collaborative approach to support our clients, projects and our passion about technology is key to our success. If you enjoy working in such an environment, we encourage you to apply.  EXCELLENT EMPLOYEE BENEFITS including Co-paid Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Cafeteria Plan, Paid Sick Leave, 401K Plan, Credit Union Membership, and Referral Bonus. U.S. Citizens only for Federal Clearance RequirementAZAD Technology Partners is an equal opportunity employer that considers and employs qualified individuals based upon job related qualifications regardless of race, color, sex, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, veteran’s status, sexual orientation, national origin, age or any other status protected under applicable local, state or federal law. AZAD Technology Partners takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified employees and applicants who are disabled, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, Armed Forces services medal veterans, and other protected veterans.Apply for this position >>

Name: Business Systems Analyst II, Master Data (Supply Chain)
Description: Summary:Position is responsible for the development, maintenance and advancement of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system master data used by Hillsboro Technical Operations. Successful candidates will represent the department as a subject matter expert and liaison between a variety of key internal and external stakeholders to maintain the integration between SAP other business and paper based systems. The successful candidate will be adept at leading cross-functional teams in problem identification and resolution and driving quantifiable business results. They will represent the department in interactions with the global business process management community and will proactively identify areas for improvement. They will be relied upon to work collaboratively and independently to solve emerging challenges inherent to project and system implementations. To this end, the successful candidate must also demonstrate competency and interest in broader aspects of Drug Substance and Drug Product, including; manufacturing, materials management, master production scheduling, capacity management, detailed scheduling, and quality. Job Responsibilities Scope of Work - The Business Analyst will be responsible for leading and implementing the Master Data business process, and collaborate with multiple functions to manage the entire lifecycle of data (Define, deploy, mature, update and retire data). They will lead the data management process to enable planning and execution, utilizing their extensive business and technical knowledge to drive resolution to data issues. Responsibilities of this position include:Be an expert on the Master Data business process. Lead and support the business process as required, including training others and supporting continuous improvementDevelop SAP Master data for load into system and evaluate impacts to other business systemsSupport site readiness to plan and be ready for executionProvide technical solutions to a variety of problems of varying scope and complexityCoordinate and lead Data Strategy meetings with site and network representativesAdhere to change management processes to ensure data is deployed and maintained in a controlled mannerProvide analysis and reporting of data to manage key performance indicatorsTranslate business requirements to technical specifications and collaborate with key stakeholders to complete requestsDevelop solutions that are imaginative, thorough, practical, and consistent with organization’s objectivesProvide training on usage, enhancements and changes to business systemsParticipates in developing courses of action that may impact multiple functions in the organizationNetworks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. Represent organization on assigned projects.Identify opportunities for improvement that may impact multiple functions in the organizationLeads cross-functional teams in the identification and implementation of improvement initiatives.Key team member on Business Systems Integration (BSI) TeamWork is performed under limited direction and guidance, with general instructions on new assignments.Job Requirements:B.A. or B.S. degree with 5 to 7 years work experience in the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical or related industry, or a Master’s Degree with 3-5 years relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Experience with ERP systems Recipe Development, Master Data and Detailed SchedulingFull use and application of basic Supply Chain/Business Process/cGMP theories, principles, and techniquesPossess strong analytical skills and understanding of systems and technical designsKnowledge of cGMPs and equivalent regulationsDemonstrated ability to effectively interpret Quality standards for implementationDemonstrated ability to manage small projects from initiation to delivery to achieve measurable resultsDemonstrated ability to independently evaluate situations and propose potential solutionsDemonstrated ability to communicate clearly and professionally both in writing and verballyDemonstrated ability to quickly learn a broad range of skillsFlexibility in problem solving and work hours to meet business objectives and dynamic production requirementsPreferences:Experience in GMP Biopharmaceutical production facility.Demonstrated project management skillsExperience with SAPExperience with MES or other SAP interfacing Business Systems APICS CPIM certificationWork Environment/Physical Demands/Safety Considerations Extensive mousing and keyboarding activities in office setting
