Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionMISSION: Participates in development of systems to effectively measure financial and operational performance. Assists in preparing financial analyses, forecasts and special studies for management in areas such as performance against plan, capital investments, and alternative management strategies. Reports to Manager, Financial Planning. Involvement with wide range of functional areas within the Company. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:Development, coordination and maintenance of systems that assist management in financial control and decision making.Prepares monthly and quarterly financial analysis and status reports of on-going business activities, e.g., operating performance vs. budget, status of major spending activities.Participates in special studies as required relative to profitability, pricing, cost reduction projects, capital expenditures, cash flow and return on investment.Assists in the development of short and long range financial plans.Maintains liaison with other operations regarding financial matters.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree in business or engineering (MBA preferred). Two to two years experience in financial analysis, accounting, budgeting and computer systems in a manufacturing environment.Ability to think and work with minimal supervision. Must have a working knowledge of financial and quantitative analysis techniques, management accounting, cost accounting, management information systems, and microcomputers. Good communication skills. Precision Castparts Corp. is an equal opportunity employer committed to recruit, hire, train, and promote in all job categories without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or other status protected by applicable law.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Business Planning and Analytics
Description: The position is responsible for leading Business Planning & Financial Analytics for Home Printing Solutions (HPS) organization, supporting leadership team of Business Unit (BU) General Manager and the head of BU finance. The job requires financial analysis of current product portfolio which would feed into planning for New Product Introductions (NPI) in outer years. The analysis would also serve as a starting point for bottoms-up financial planning that this position will lead.  The key components required to be successful in this position are strategic thinking, ability to perform complex financial analysis, and strong communication skills. The analyst should also be a strong collaborator who can partner with different organizations BU finance, supply chain, customer support, region category, etc. to lead the planning process. Key responsibilities: Build complex financial models that provide insights into margin profile of current portfolio with detailed analysis of cost structure. The model should have capability to perform bottoms-up financial planning and run sensitivity analysis for different inputs.Partner with New Product Introduction (NPI) analysts and product management team to drive data-driven, highly accurate assumptions in product performance planning.Partner with supplies organization to create integrated product performance view of Hardware and Supplies.Develop various reports including profitability by business, region, and product segment and aid in using these reports to drive improvements in the business. These reports are done on a monthly and quarterly basis to closely monitor the business results.Perform variance analysis comparing actual performance to budget, last year, and forecast for the different areas of the business that you support.Fully participate in budgeting and forecasting processes.Use Strategic thinking and critical reasoning ability to question everything we do and drive business and team to greater heights.Strong communication skills are a must as this role will work with various levels of management, both in finance and the business, and must be able to clearly relay results of analytical projects as well as monthly and quarterly results.Drive improvements in the financial and reporting processes, and the quality of information provided to the business.Skills required include strong Excel, Access and PowerPoint knowledge with the aptitude to extract information from the existing business systems. Education and Experience Required:First level university degree with a focus in business or economics; advanced degree or accounting certification (e.g., CPA, MBA, CFA) preferred.Typically 6+ years of experience as a financial analyst preferred.Typically experienced in more than one finance function. Knowledge and Skills Required:Excellent financial modeling skills and critical reasoning abilityExcellent understanding of accounting principles and financial analysis.Excellent analytical skills.Superior business application skills (e.g., Microsoft Excel).Superior communication and influencing skills.Superior teamwork skillsExcellent business acumen.Excellent project management skills.  Primary consideration will be given to candidates in Vancouver, WA #LI-POST

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Position PurposeWorking at the world's fourth largest retailer mixes the best of many worlds: cutting-edge technologies meet real business needs meets real customers who spend billions of dollars across our stores in North America. What is it like to work at The Home Depot QuoteCenter? We were a startup once upon a time and much of our startup culture still exists: the agility of a small operation, the impact that comes with being a leader in our industry. Our team uses the latest technologies to build new products that facilitate 9-figure project sales at The Home Depot. We invest proactively in our people. The mission of the QuoteCenter product team is to radically reimagine the shopping experience at Home Depot utilizing the latest data tools and web technologies. We are searching for a Senior Business Analyst who is passionate about taking an ownership role in translating business and technical requirements into solutions. The goal of your efforts in this role is to leverage data to create merchandising programs that streamline the sales process for our associates. This is a full-time permanent role located in Vancouver, Washington. We are seeking someone who has a knack for linking numbers to business opportunities, and who can effectively communicate with and influence stakeholders. Degree in business or similar field required. Experience in Tableau (or other analytical software), SQL, project management a strong plus.ResponsibilitiesPlan and lead all phases of a project's life cycle (i.e. feasibility, design implementation, evaluation); this includes extracting the business need; defining the business requirements, understanding the impact on the business, and designing and carrying out the project(s) Serve as liaison between merchandising and finance by facilitating meetings including both departments Mentor other analysts in developing/honing business knowledge and analytical skills Serve as a subject matter expert and perform research and/or analysis within assigned projects Multi-task to work on 2 to 4 projects simultaneously, recommending process improvements and making final project recommendations which impact the business Establish and report on metrics of assigned projects to gauge business valuePreferred QualificationsExperience developing complex technology solutions and performing analysis on feature requirements against system capabilities. Experience communicating and delivering content to external parties. Ability to recognize and proactively manage the appropriate content and interactions for dealing with third parties. Ability to prioritize tasks/objectives with strong organizational and analytical skills. History of documenting expectations in clear and presentable format. Experience with various applications and tools, including JIRA, Visio, MS Office, Powerpoint, Excel. Knowledge of SQL, relational databases and various analytics tools. Clear and articulate communication style to partner collaboratively across multiple departments with a consultative approach to assess and solve business problems for internal and external customers. You must build cross-department relationships to further business requirement definition. Must be successful in a team environment and drive collaborative work initiatives. Able to be successful in a more ambiguous role with targets and goals that change frequently. Retail industry experience preferred, not required. Experience analyzing and visualizing data through BI solutions (Tableau) a plus.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and CompetenciesWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Typing skills Excellent written and verbal skills Strong organization skills with attention to details Must possess the ability to handle multiple task at once with minimal direction Training and procedural documentation skills

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: Trupp HR - Compensation AnalystLooking to develop your career in compensation as part of an innovative and collaborative team?At Trüpp, we believe in harnessing the power of our collective teamvaluing the unique talents, strengths, and even quirky traits of each of our employees. The Compensation Analyst role at Trüpp plays a key role in gathering and analyzing compensation and other related data in support of designing, planning, and managing compensation programs and structures for our small to mid-sized clients located in the greater Portland area and across the U.S.Successful candidates will: thrive in a team environment; have a proven ability to excel at detail-oriented tasks; demonstrate excellent time-management skills; stay organized in the mist of changing priorities; and consistently deliver quality work.Essential Job FunctionsThe individual in this position is expected to engage in the following work-related duties:Review client documentation, job descriptions, and engage with client and team members to evaluate jobs and identify quality benchmarks in salary databases and public sector compensation data.Capture and analyze market salary data.Create and facilitate job analysis and pay equity questionnaires.Develop surveys, spreadsheets, reports, and templates in support of client projects and Trüpp process improvement.Review reports, spreadsheets and other large deliverables for larger projects as a QA check.Recommend process improvements for the Projects Team, including improving process flow, templates and overall systems.Success ProfileTo be successful in this position, the Compensation Analyst must:Maintain working knowledge of HR policies and compensation programs/structures including job classifications and descriptions.Demonstrate excellent communication and time-management skills.Organize and prioritize own work in a fast-paced setting with frequent and rapid priority and assignment changes.Utilize active listening skills with colleagues and clients to mitigate conflict and improve operational efficiency.Consistently deliver quality, timely, accurate and useful work products.Demonstrates a high attention to detail.Behave in a manner that supports Trüpps core values and represents the company in the best possible light.Exemplify professionalism and a sincere concern for contributing to the success of our clients.Treat confidential information gained through employment with Trüpp HR with sensitivity and tact.Demonstrate expert working knowledge in Microsoft Excel and advanced working knowledge in Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and market salary databases.Minimum Qualifications1-2 years experience in a similar position, or equivalent combination of education and experience.Bachelors Degree required in Human Resources, Accounting, Business Management or other related field.Compensation and/or classification experience preferred.About Trüpp Trüpp (Swedish for team) was founded in 2011 and has been recognized for the past three consecutive years as one of Oregon and SW Washingtons Top 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies and Top 50 Women-Owned Businesses. Providing HR Outsourcing and Consulting services to small and mid-sized employers, we are a collaborative team of professionals, passionate about helping our clients thrive. Perks & BenefitsTrüpp values its employees! Our team members enjoy convenient access to public transportation, ergonomic sit-stand desks, a modern, open office with loads of ambient light, and a work environment where we enjoy supporting each other along with sharing good laughs and great food.Medical insurance, with a significant portion of employee coverage paid by the employer, as well as buy-up options and option to extend coverage to employee dependents/spouse/partner.Dental and Vision insurance 100% employer paid for employees, with the option to extend benefit participation to employee dependents/spouse/partner.Short-and Long-Term Disability paid 100% by employer.401(k) with company match.Optional Flexible Spending Account (FSA).Generous paid time off program.Flexible work schedules.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: The Finance team at Viewpoint supports the executive team with analysis, reporting, and strategic project leadership. This position provides an opportunity to learn broadly about the software industry, understand Viewpoint as a whole across the entire organization, and see first-hand how the business is being managed from the highest level.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities Prepares timely and accurate Financial and KPI reporting packages to inform operational business decisions on a monthly basisBuilds financial models to support strategic decision makingPerforms variance analysis on actual financial results against Plan to gain insights about the business to improve iterative forecastingUpdates our reporting systems with our latest financial results and administrates them to align with organizational changesIntegrates acquisitions' finances and KPIs into our reporting packages on a Pro Forma basisAssists in preparing, analyzing, and coordinating the annual budget process across multiple departmentsCollaborates cross functionally to produce recurring revenue and Bookings forecastsDevelops new reports and dashboards to provide deeper insights into the evolving business modelWorks with senior leadership on ad hoc projects to address key business risks and opportunities Core Competencies Demonstrated analytical skills, comfort with Finance and Accounting principles, and solid understanding of financial KPIsAbility to think cross functionally, join data from various sources, and develop solutions in a fast-paced environmentStrong written, verbal, and presentation skillsMeticulous attention to detail while managing competing prioritiesDesire for continuous improvement of departmental and organizational processesAbility to process and simplify complexityAbility to work independently and as part of a teamPositive, can-do attitude coupled with a strong work ethicRequirements4 year accredited degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or similar field; or comparable work experienceAdvanced skills in Excel; proficient skills in Word, PowerPoint, and other Office applications Viewpoint is an Equal Opportunity Employer  DISCLOSURE for US-BASED POSITIONS ONLY: Viewpoint requires a criminal background investigation, and employment and education verification as a condition of employment.SDL2017

Name: Operational Risk Analyst
Description: Umpqua Bank is seeking an Operational Risk Analyst for our Portland office.  The Operational Risk Analyst is responsible for providing support to Risk Officers and Managers in facilitating process-centric risk assessments, providing applicable operational risk consultation to business units, and providing content in state of risk management reporting to the various committees and the Board of Directors. MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIESFacilitate cross-functional business process risk assessments, consistent with the risk assessment framework established by Enterprise Risk Management (ERM).Assist management in developing both operational controls to bring risks identified in risk assessments, audits, and examinations within acceptable levels.Perform risk monitoring across multiple business units to determine the adequacy of key risk controls and communicate findings, root cause analysis, and recommendations for corrective action to management.Provide effective challenge when reviewing business units risk self-assessments.Assist in the development of remediation roadmaps and prioritization by considering all aspects/options for risk mitigation.Conduct appropriate level of research to support technical risk advice and guidance in response to business units; associates’ and management’s questions and in reviews of new products, services, marketing, processes, and/or delivery systems through use of ERM approved communication templates.Provide or review job-specific risk management training to associates in business units.Demonstrate compliance with all bank regulations applicable to the position.Follows all Bank policies and procedures, compliance regulations, and completes all annual required or job-specific training.Actively learns, demonstrates, and fosters the Umpqua corporate culture in all actions and words.Takes personal initiative and is a positive example for others to emulate. Embraces our vision to become "The World's Greatest Bank."QUALIFICATIONS:Work experience and wide ranging, in-depth knowledge of banking finance, technologies, laws, regulations, company policies and procedures.Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.CRCM, CISA, CRISC, CIA, or similar certification preferred.Experience with Governance Risk Compliance (GRC) systems desired.Proven ability to develop and present risk management consultation, including carrying out research to support risk positions.Experience demonstrating a full understanding of all aspects of implementing and supporting risk management programs.Proven risk management competencies acquired either through work experience or training.Project management experience and skill with proven ability to manage multiple, concurrent projects or programs and operate under limited supervision.Proven ability to professionally communicate with senior and executive level management, complex compliance requirements that are at times in conflict with business/production initiatives, appropriately separating opinion from fact.Ability to think strategically about risk.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work in and resolve sensitive situations and/or conflict oriented environments. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORKING CONDITIONS Work involves extended periods of sitting, occasional walking, and lifting up to 10 pounds. Requires close visual acuity.  Umpqua Bank is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability. We maintain a drug-free workplace and may perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. LI-UP

Name: Sr. Systems Application Analyst
Description: Work Unit DescriptionWork Schedule, Hours, FTE, Salary Range FTE: 1.0, Full TimeSchedule: Flex hours between 7:00am to 5:00pm, Monday - Friday.Salary Range: $101,059.40 $117,163.28Location: Portland, OR (Marquam Hill)JobType: AFSCME, Union Represented Functions/Duties of PositionDuties: Implement new software systems to collect, store, manage, and analyze datarelated to Anesthesiology and Perioperative Medicine research and clinical needs. Collaborate with Vice Chair of Clinical Services and Director of Clinical Research to plan, implement, and develop vast research and clinical data repository and dashboard. Work with clinicians and assist in identifying data needs for clinical projects, gathering and documenting requirements and specifications. Design, develop, and document new applications and systems for clinical/operational workflows. Work with BI Architects, Developers, Analysts and users to design, create, and publish ETL processes and ETL meta-data using Data Stage and other tools. Analyze internal data to meet reporting requirements. Recommend data standardization practices at department level. Collect and manage vast research and clinical data repository. Coordinate data transfer to repository. Provide datasets to clinicians. Track and provide metrics on utilization of repository database. Provide support to data warehouse developers, line-of-business analysts and users to validate data warehouse. Lead and oversee creation of project specific databases.  Job Requirements  Education:Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field(foreign equivalent acceptable); and  Experience:4 years experience as a Data Warehouse Developer, SQL Developer, SoftwareEngineer, Programmer Analyst, or related field. Name: SCADA Systems Analyst
Description: Non-Union PositionNetwork Control System; Portland, ORRegular; Full-TimePosting # 50276007November 9, 2018At NW Natural, we like to say, "We grew up here." We've been an energy supplier and community leader since 1859. Some of our neighbors know us through our philanthropy and volunteer programs and innovative approaches to carbon reduction. Our customers know us because of the clean, safe, efficient, and low-cost natural gas we provide. We are a service-oriented utility, with a "Best in the West" customer satisfaction ranking. If you share our core values integrity, safety, service ethic, caring and environmental stewardship we invite you to apply to NW Natural.The Role: Responsible for the design, development, and support of gas management/control systems (HMI/SCADA and others). May have responsibilities for leading or directing a team of application developers.Day to day:• Provides application development, configuration and maintenance of the main SCADA application (IFIX), as well as its associated data polling applications and interfaces with field remote terminal units (RTUs) and programmable logic controllers (PLCs).• Designs and programs HMI screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, and system interfaces.• Collaborates with operating departments to design and program RTU/PLC devices for Gas Control and storage plant operations.• Provides SCADA system data access and configuration tools to support safe monitoring and control of NW Natural's transmission and distribution systems. • Works with IT team leads to ensure consistency in architecture, development, security and change control for Gas Management Systems.• Provides creative and technical leadership through the development of new ideas and application design approaches to meet customers' needs.• Researches and evaluates possible solutions to problems; presents recommendations and implements the selected solution.• Effectively communicates design considerations and recommendations to team members and NW Natural business partners.• Collaborates with team members to promote knowledge transfer.• Develops and maintains system documentation including process maps, data flows, infrastructure diagrams, as well as installation and configuration procedures.• Establishes processes to resolve problems and provides support to system operators and dispatchers on the use of the SCADA systems.• Provides on-call (24-hour) systems support, on a rotating basis, with other Gas Management Systems team members.• Supports Company's commitment to a culture of safe work practices.  Come on your first day with:• Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent combination of related education/experience.• 5+ years' experience as a controls system developer or equivalent experience as an application developer.• Experience in designing, implementing, troubleshooting, and commissioning HMI/SCADA applications and demonstrated problem solving skills using SCADA systems and architectures is required.• Experience in design, development, testing and implementation of controls programming for RTUs/PLCs is required.• Experience in installing, optimizing and troubleshooting communication drivers is required.• Experience in architecting and developing solutions utilizing VB, C#, .Net or SQL is desired.• Demonstrated ability to communicate complex problems and issues in a concise manner to many different audiences (customers, peers and upper management).• Demonstrated ability to lead and encourage collaboration among a team of IT and business resources to effectively and efficiently accomplish established goals.• Demonstrated high level of initiative and effectiveness working independently.• Demonstrated ability and willingness to investigate complex business problems in detail, diagnose, and provide an effective and efficient alternative.• Experience in a leadership/project management role with increasing responsibility is preferred. • Strong change management and control systems security experience is preferred.• Experience in programming General Electric, Rockwell or Schneider Industrial Controls is preferred. • Knowledge of Natural Gas business is preferred.• ITIL Foundations certified or must successfully complete within 90 days of hire date.• Subject to random drug testing. What we offer:• Arguably the most competitive healthcare and wellness benefits in the Pacific Northwest • Meaningful Annual Incentive Bonus Opportunity in addition to base salary• 401(k) with generous match and additional 5% employer contribution • Company provided Trimet or C-Tran passes/Bike storage for cyclists• Green Team/Diversity & Inclusion Council/Safety Team/Women's Network• Numerous volunteer and community engagement opportunities• Employee Stock Purchase Plan with a 15% discount• 20% Employee discount on Natural Gas• Generous Vacation/Sick leave program• 7 Paid Holidays and up to 3 floating holidays to add an extra paid day off to Holidays Observed by NW Natural• Flexible work schedule opportunitiesBase salary range Min. $79,450 (*$87,600 to $110,000) Max. $115,200; *Expected Hiring RangeApplication Process: To be considered for this position, submit a complete electronic application including a cover letter and a resume. https://www.nwnatural.com/Careers/JobOpportunitiesDeadline: December 7, 2018At NW Natural we are committed to fair compensation, pay equity and equal opportunity for advancement in the workplace. Salaries are determined based on a combination of education, experience, skills, performance and internal equity to similar roles within our organization. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, disability, or any other federal, state or local protected class.SDL2017

Name: Analyst - Risk
Description: Analyst - Risk  html, body {  font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;  } Analyst - RiskReturn to Job OpportunitiesLevel EntryJob Location OR - Portland, ORJob Category Professional ServicesLegitScript, one of the Top 100 Workplaces in Oregon, is seeking an exceptional Risk Analyst to join our team at our Portland, Oregon-based headquarters.  Please apply via our corporate jobs page: https://www.legitscript.com/company/careers/ Role Title: Risk Analyst Role Purpose: The purpose of this role is to accurately analyze assigned merchants, assess associated risk, and convey merchant analysis in an actionable note to the client, in accordance with program standards and deadline requirements. A risk analyst must develop a foundational knowledge of, as well as ability to make decisions in, all content areas monitored by the program. At this level, the employee is building foundational skills in order to become a full-fledged contributor to program work. There is an expected training period for all analysts (currently 60-90 days). Over the course of the first year at LegitScript, an analyst should be fully contributing to the program(s). Key Areas of Accountability: Key Area #1: Culture and values alignment  Key Area #2: Accurately analyze and report merchants to client  Key Area #3: Attain expertise in high-risk merchant business models Key Area #1: Culture and values alignmentTasks and ActivitiesEngage in behaviors aligned with LegitScript’s core values: Be Awesome, Be Open, Be Thoughtful, Be InvestedExhibit a growth mindset by being open to feedback, embracing change as an opportunityAccountabilitiesColleagues view employee as being aligned with LegitScript core valuesWelcomes feedbackTreats change as an opportunity to learn and growKey Area #2: Accurately analyze and report merchantsTasks and ActivitiesAnalyze and assess merchant risk levels by using internet investigative techniques and leveraging contextual dataMake quick, accurate analytical decisions based on information that is, at times, ambiguousProvide analysis details to clients under strict deadlinesAdhere to program’s reporting standardsAccountabilitiesProduce accurate, well-reasoned, and concise merchant analysisBy the end of MM training, or by 6 months of hiring date, analyze ~750 merchants a weekBy 8-12 months after hiring date, analyze ~1200 merchants a weekKey Area #3: Expertise in high-risk merchant business modelsTasks and ActivitiesAttain and maintain a thorough understanding of regulations and policies for various high-risk areas in the payment industryAttend weekly team meetings and continuous training opportunitiesStay informed of market trends by reading relevant resources shared by team membersAccountabilitiesIdentify missing or new applicable information to contribute to current reporting standardsProduce internal documentation, as neededExpected competenciesAlignment with company values and cultureGrowth mindset (receptive to feedback, learning)Detail-orientedIndependent/resourcefulEfficient time managementSelf-motivatedCuriousAbility to work under pressureTech savvyAdaptableGood judgment/common senseClear communicator (both in writing and verbally)Bachelors degree or equivalent experienceInvestigative research/analysis skillsExperience with large data sets (Excel not necessary)Experience assessing riskBonus competencies1-2+ years work, especially in relevant fieldDecision-making skillsManagement experience (project or people)Relevant additional language proficiencyMasters degreeRelevant specialty skill(s) [e.g., writing/editing, client relations]About LegitScript:  We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. We share our expertise about high-risk online activity to empower businesses, governments, and consumers to make incremental changes that will result in a secure, more transparent internet. We catch bad guys.  Our spacious, modern Pearl District office is cubicle-free with plenty of natural light. We have sit-to-stand convertible desks. Many of us bike to work and we have indoor bike parking. There's an ofﬁce dog. Our friendly in-house barista serves complimentary beverages every morning, and we have lots of catered lunches and social events. It's a small, culturally diverse company (about 90 people at present) where people work hard and love what they do. Starting salary for this position is between 40k to 50k annually.  In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package: We contribute toward individuals and spouse/ dependents (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Flexible spending account - We contribute funds on your behalf and allow you to contribute pre-tax (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)401k with company match after 6 months.Life insurance and short-term disability insurance policy that are both fully paid by employer (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Transportation package to help alleviate commuting costs (available immediately!)Generous Paid Time Off policy Bonus: We offer full-time employees extra perks like company-paid massages, gift cards to local businesses, paid time off to volunteer, company sponsorship of your hobby, and group social outings!  If you meet all of the requirements and would like to be considered, please respond to this ad with your resume and cover letter. Name: Implementation Analyst

Our offices are located in the heart of downtown Portland, Oregon, close to Pioneer Square, Food Carts and TriMet bus and MAX stops.Clinicient is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Finance Analyst Inventory & Sales Audit
Description: PurposePerforms general multifaceted inventory control and sales audit functions. Responsible for gaining detailed insight and understanding of the overall retail business both internally and at the vendor level to provide a high level of service and direction. Reviews business processes and makes recommendations for improvement. Provide business partners with concise and insightful analysis through data gathering and reporting. Responsibilities include maintaining accurate inventory records for all adidas Retail stores (Inline and Outlet) to maximize sales potential.  Key Responsibilities  Manage all receiving, transfers, mis-ships, missing documents, missing styles, style set up, cycle counting, pricing and markdown related ASPEN issues created by 100+ Sports Performance, Originals and Factory Outlet stores. Follow-up and resolve issues within the SLA required period. Facilitate the RFID process for stores by completing the daily back office requirements including reconciliation, inventory transactions, resolving issues within the system of record and between the system of record and other third-party systems. Research and process daily receiving, non-sale transactions errors. Analyze each error to determine appropriate course of action. Receipts must post in a timely manner to guarantee the data integrity of inventory levels. Monitor store inventory levels (including negative on hands), research and resolve issues to ensure accurate inventory. Monitor store to store transfer transactions and PO/ASN receipts. Partner with accounting team. Research missing or incorrect goods receipts and missing or incorrect articles to ensure invoice match and timely payment to vendors. Research credit memos and provide appropriate information to Accounting group for processing. Overall analysis of inventory flow from point of purchase to point of sale ensuring inventory is correctly accounted for. Research inaccuracies and grow relationships with appropriate departments to develop solutions. Partner with store operations, Retail IT & Finance to evolve the current process for retail buying and inventory flow with the intent of creating business efficiencies and prevent further errors. Evaluate exception situations and seek out creative solutions which represent the best positive impact and least risk to the Business. Organize workload creating a balance between main functions of ASPEN and Inventory control, and sales audit functions to ensure all tasks are completed within deadlines. Assist in the preparation, posting and reconciliation of bi-annual physical inventories. Identification and implementation of process improvements and compliance. Create and update policy and procedure manual. Identify training/retraining needs and initiate store/team training on systems and processes with IT/ Store Operations. Conduct concept based training on case-by-case basis. Action the daily sales audit reconciliation process supporting 100+ Sports Performance, Originals and Factory Outlet stores Partner with supervisor to maintain and update the sales audit and reconciliation documentation. Partner with accounting and IT teams to identify and resolve issues within the sales audit process. Provides support to supervisor, senior management and headquarters with ad hoc financial analysis and database management  Key Relationships  Store management Buyers, Distributors IT Operations teams District Managers Accounting Department  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  Ability to be self-directed while working under tight deadlines Advanced MS Office skills, specifically Excel Ability to organize and keep track of multiple projects simultaneously Ability to work with diverse groups of people and cultures on a daily basis Strong interpersonal and communication skills Ability to understand and use financial data to make decisions and influence outcomes Ability to effectively interact with all levels of business via phone, written communication and in person Strong understanding of the adidas Retail Supply chain process. Minimum Qualifications Bachelors degree with a focus on Finance, Accounting, Business or similar field Two plus years experience in business or financial analysis or planning Equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be substituted for degree Retail specific experience preferred

Name: Healthcare Analyst Analyst 0"> San Francisco, CA, United States Oct 25, 2018 Full Time
Description: Milliman’s San Francisco Health Management Consulting Practice is seeking to fill a healthcare analyst position. The ideal candidate has:• Demonstrated interest and experience in the healthcare market and health policy • Excellent written and oral communication skills• Training in and a strong foundation in quantitative and qualitative research and analytic methods• Curiosity and enthusiasm about applying their skills to improving healthcare efficiencies, outcomes, and value• Interest in taking on client-facing roles and growing into a consulting positionThis position is based in San Francisco, California. Interested candidates should submit resume, cover letter and writing sample, all of which are mandatory to be considered for the position. (Candidate must be the sole or primary author of the writing sample. Anything can be submitted, but examples include research papers; or issue brief explaining results of assessment, analysis or research.) About Milliman and the San Francisco Healthcare Management Consulting (HMC) PracticeMilliman is one of the world’s largest independent professional services firms. Founded in 1947, the firm provides consulting services to clients in four practice areas: Healthcare, Life Insurance and Financial Services, Employee Benefits and Pensions, and Property and Casualty Insurance. Today, Milliman has more than 3,500 employees, $1 billion in annual revenue, and over 60 offices worldwide.The San Francisco HMC is a growing practice within Milliman, working closely with the Milliman Technology & Operations Solutions (TOPS) practice and the San Francisco and San Diego Health Actuarial practices. We provide health policy analysis, management, and operations consulting services to a wide range of clients, including federal and state government agencies, foundations, managed care organizations, hospitals and health systems, and other organizations that provide or support the delivery of healthcare services.Milliman consultants, with our emphasis on solution-focused consulting, are leading the way to help clients develop and implement strategies for adapting to new models of payment and delivery. Our projects vary depending on type of engagement. Smaller, fast-paced projects involve teams of two to three consultants engaged by a client to evaluate a situation to make recommendations about how the client can solve a particular challenge or seize an opportunity. Examples include:Conduct a market study to evaluate the feasibility of launching a new productAnalyze historical healthcare utilization and cost data to develop recommendations for business line expansions and growth opportunitiesAssess the ROI or a particular disease management strategy or interventionEvaluate a providers’ population health management programs and tools to identify opportunities for improvementLong-term engagements involve larger teams including consultants, analysts, and actuaries in multiple Milliman offices to design and conduct analytic projects and provide analytic support. Examples include:Assess the value of patient centered medical home initiativesStudy the cost and utilization of telehealth-enabled healthcare services in the Medicare and Medicaid markets.Support and facilitate the design and implementation of Medicaid payment reform for state clientsExpertise and KnowledgeOur specific engagements vary by client; however the typical client engagements require the following knowledge and expertise with analytic and writing tasks including:Draft white papers, support proposal writing, and other business development activityConduct literature reviews and background research on topics such as value-based insurance design, alternative payment methodologies and delivery system transformation initiativesCoordinate project management activity, including supporting Consultants on timely delivery of milestones/deliverables and coordinating communications among diverse groups of clients and team membersDesign study specifications for quantitative analyses, including those using large claim databasesSummarize findings, draft descriptive statistics, and communicate technical information for client audiencesPrepare and use charts, graphs, and tables to present analytical resultsBuild presentations for meetings and executive communicationsMinimum Qualifications and Experience: Demonstrates interest and experience in healthcare, healthcare financing, and policy related issuesPhD or Master’s degree in business administration, public health, health policy, economics, or statistics with three or more years of relevant work experienceExcellent written and verbal communication skills with proven ability to communicate effectively across the organizationCurious, attentive to detail, and problem-solving mindsetAbility to work independently and effectively with team membersProficiency in Microsoft Office products, particularly ExcelDesired Qualifications and Experience: Experience in writing for business and policy oriented audiencesKnowledge of mixed-method evaluation methodologies such propensity score matching techniques, and difference-in-difference methodsExperience in statistical analysis software such as SAS or data query language such as SQLNOTE: Applicants must be presently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. The San Francisco Health Management Consulting Practice does not sponsor individuals for the purpose of obtaining or maintaining H-1B, O-1, or other nonimmigrant work authorizing status for this position.Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Name: Cloud Billing Analyst
Description: Cloud Billing Analyst - Vancouver Big dreams often start small. From an idea in a London pub, we have grown into a global cloud enabler which operates across 7 countries and speak over 30 languages.  Our purpose at Cloudreach is to “enable innovation.” We do this by helping enterprise customers adopt and harness the power of cloud computing. We believe that the growth of a great business can only be fuelled by great people, so join us in our partnership with AWS, Microsoft and Google and help us build one of the most disruptive companies in the cloud industry. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.  Centrally located in the heart of Gastown, the Vancouver office overlooks the City’s iconic Steam Clock and boasts amazing ocean and mountain views. Our open concept heritage office is outfitted with bean bags, foosball, darts, pool table, big screen TVs, and a well-stocked kitchen. See what it’s like to work in one of the world’s most livable cities!  A day in our Vancouver office!  We are looking for a talented Cloud Billing Analyst in our Vancouver office! The Cloud Billing Analyst will own the customer experience for enterprises that undertake our Billing Products from end-to-end. He/She will gather customer billing requirements, onboard the Billing Product in a smooth and seamless manner and deliver the service by assisting with customer service reviews, generating analytical reports and ensuring customers are knowledgeable of key concepts of public cloud billing and best practice in financial optimizations. How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?Own the delivery of customer billing workshops, explaining key concepts of public cloud billing and gathering of information required to facilitate a seamless onboarding to Cloudreach Billing ProductsTo own the onboarding process of customers undertaking Cloudreach Billing Products, working with Service Introduction Analysts and Cloud Engagement Managers where customers contract to receive multiple Cloudreach servicesTo assist with the administration of the Cloudreach Billing Service, ensuring the CRM system (Salesforce) contains all the necessary information to facilitate customer invoicingTo work with the wider Operations team, specifically Core Ops Analysts, to facilitate and deliver new Account Provisionings for Cloud Service Providers (CSP), ensuring these are complete under SLA and to customer requirementsBecome a subject-matter expert in Public Cloud Billing, developing an in-depth knowledge of the billing process for Cloud Service Providers (AWS and Azure), alongside the resale processTo own all escalations from customers of Cloudreach Billing Products, working with the Finance Team to investigate issues with invoices, ensuring that any changes are implemented and actionedTo produce analytical usage reports for external customers using tools such as the Cloud Billing System and/or CloudHealth, assisting with service reviews and providing support as necessary on these platformsTo develop an understanding of financial optimisations for the delivery of Cloudreach Billing ProductsTo act as an administrator for the Cloudreach Billing System (CBS), coordinating the continuous improvement and resolution of issues with the Product Development TeamWhere third party tools are used, such as CloudHealth, to facilitate and oversee the initial provisioning of these tools.Provide ongoing support and training on third party tools utilised for Cloudreach Billing Products, such as the CBS and CloudHealth, both internally and externallyAct as a focal point for facilitating CloudHealth accredited training for colleaguesOwn the completion of documentation on all things billing and related, building up a comprehensive source to share and disseminate information to the broader teamThis includes, for example, the on and off-boarding process, documenting common incidents and service requests and unique characteristics of Cloud Service Providers and their billing setupsDeveloping additional training material that explains key concepts of public cloud billing, the Cloudreach billing and invoicing process and an initial overview to financial optimizationTo identify improvements to processes and sharing feedback from customers on Cloudreach Billing Products with the designated OwnersHow to stand out?Analytical skills and aptitude with large datasets, spreadsheets and SQLAn understanding of cloud technologies and particularly commercial pricing models and billing structures from providers such as AWS, Microsoft and GoogleAn understanding and passion for exceptional customer serviceStrong written and oral communication skills, with the ability to adapt your style and language depending on the audienceConfident with undertaking customer meetings, reviews and delivering presentations as a subject-matter expertAn ability to explain key billing and cloud concepts to multiple stakeholdersAn ability to listen and gather customer requirementsAn ability to maintain relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, building relationships with both customers and partners alikeTo be firm but fair in the way that you manage the customer to not over or under deliver the serviceOrganizational skills and an ability to manage time requirements and prioritise requests from key customersA desire to develop or enhance your skills and knowledge of both cloud and tooling partnersWhat are our cloudy perks?MacBook Pro, big screen monitors, a super cool smartphone and health benefitsUncapped holidays..... Seriously! You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake!Spot bonus based on your and the company’s performanceCloudreach University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunitiesUnique ‘cloudy’ culture where we work hard and play hardFully stocked in-office kitchen and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday. There are also cool office amenities like beanbags, games like pool and foosball, and big screen TVsWorking with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere elseQuarterly meetings around North America and an annual kick off event in a cool secret destination BackYou Might Also Be Interested In… #VancouverCloud Billing AnalystCloud Operations#Vancouver Cloud Operations AnalystCloud Operations#EdinburghCloud Operations AnalystCloud Operations

Name: Capital Planning Modeler/Quantitative Analyst
Description: The incumbent will assist in completing model validation requirements for a variety of financial and non-financial models used across the bank. This position will assist business units with quantitative model monitoring projects, including building performance metrics for econometric capital, operational risk and credit risk models. You will have the opportunity to learn different models and modeling techniques that are used at the bank including but not limited to: financial planning models, fraud detection models, credit risk management, anti-money laundering, asset and liability management, and Dodd-Frank Act Stress Testing (DFAST) models. This position will report to the Modeling Manager within the capital planning team. Ideal candidate will forge a strong partnership with business units across the bank and work with them to understand the impacts of model findings and aid business units in addressing and remediating the model validation findings. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES • Partner with business units to support the development and embedding of a robust and auditable framework for remediation of model findings that are issued by Model Risk management in accordance with SR 11-7. Assist business units in assessing quality of model inputs/outputs through back testing against realized outcomes, benchmarking against alternative models and other relevant tests. Recommend short term and long term model monitoring solutions based on the nature and tier of the model. • Develop quantitative tools and techniques to measure and analyze model risks, and establish conclusions on strengths and limitations of the model. Assess conceptual foundations of a model, model specification, underlying assumptions, limitations, variable selection, underlying data, developmental evidence, documentation. • Interview model developers/vendors and model owners to understand the business context for model use and facilitate the adoption of model risk management standards. Keep up-to-date with any banking regulations affecting model risk management practices across the bank. • Advocate quantitative practices across the bank. Assist model users, and model owners in the completion of model documentation and the design of scorecards to track the on-going performance of models under their responsibility. Propose and execute model validation tests for new and existing models in the inventory. • Assist manager in production of regular and ad-hoc reports on individual and Bank-level model findings for Senior Management and regulators. • Coordinate with model validation team on any changes to the Bank’s model inventory or End user Applications. • Demonstrates compliance with all bank regulations for assigned job function and applies to designated job responsibilities – knowledge may be gained through coursework and on-the-job training. Keeps up to date on regulation changes. • Follows all Bank policies and procedures, compliance regulations, and completes all required annual or job-specific training. • Maintain a working knowledge of Bank's written policies and procedures regarding Bank Secrecy Act, Regulation CC, Regulation E, Bank Security and other regulations as applicable to this job description. • May be asked to coach, mentor, or train others and teach coursework as subject matter expert. • Actively learns, demonstrates, and fosters the Umpqua corporate culture in all actions and words. • Takes personal initiative and is a positive example for others to emulate. • Embraces our vision to become "The World's Greatest Bank." • May perform other duties as assigned. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES • Master’s degree in economics, mathematics, statistics, financial engineering, quantitative finance, or actuarial sciences. Doctoral degree preferred; or equivalent experience. • Financial Risk Manager(FRM) or Certification in Quantitative Finance (CQF) Preferred. • 3-5 years of work experience working as a model validation analyst, model developer or as a quant working at a bank or financial firm. Candidates may be considered for junior or senior position based on the experience matching job requirements. • Knowledge of stress testing and regulatory requirements related to model risk management (FRB/OCC SR 11-7), Basel II/III capital requirements, and Dodd-Frank Act Stress Testing (DFAST). • Experience with industry best practice modeling techniques and demonstrable skills in prototyping, benchmarking and empirical analysis. Experience with credit risk models, commercial/consumer banking models preferred. • Ability to translate complex problems into clear and simple stories. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with ability to translate complex statistical or economic theories and analysis into practical implications for business units and Management. • Proven organizational skills are required to perform multiple tasks simultaneously to meet strict deadlines. Critical thinker with business intuition, intellectual curiosity, and ability to execute. • Candidate must have working knowledge of SAS/R or other advanced statistical/econometric analysis software. Must be able to learn SAS/R as needed in the role. Ability to forge strong partnerships with business units across the bank. PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS  • Office environment – no specific or unusual physical or environmental demands. • Travel not required for this position. Umpqua Bank is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability. We maintain a drug-free workplace and may perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. *LI-UP

Name: Actuarial Analyst - Health Plan
Description: Let’s do great things, together Founded in Oregon in 1955, Moda is proud to be a company of real people committed to quality. Today, like then, we’re focused on building a better future for healthcare. That starts by offering outstanding coverage to our members, compassionate support to our community and comprehensive benefits to our employees. It keeps going by connecting with neighbors to create healthy spaces and places, together.  Moda Health is seeking an Actuarial Analyst who be responsible for setting new and renewing rates for group business; performs actuarial analysis of benefit utilization, pricing and trends using mathematical concepts and formulas; provides actuarial support to underwriting by developing and maintaining pricing models; and monitors profitability of Moda lines of business relative to budgeted targets. We are seeking a candidate that has passed 3 actuarial exams and has 2 years of industry experience. Primary Functions:Determines appropriate rate actions to maintain profitability of Moda fully insured group medical and dental pooled business.Develops tools to measure overall performance of fully insured group plans with actuarially sound principles using SQL, SAS, R, Excel or similar applications.Assists in the development and maintenance of pricing models used by Underwriting to determine new and renewal group rates.Develops trend analyses that both provides insight into changes in historical utilization and supports projections of future trends.Compiles and verifies data, prepares reports and provides various levels of analysis and modeling work.Provides guidance and advice regarding rates, benefits and related matters for insurance products.Prepares regulatory rate filings for group plans as needed.Assists in the training of underwriting personnel.Performs other duties as assigned. Are you ready to be a betterist? If you’re ready to make a difference that matters, we want to hear from you. Because it’s time to discover what’s possible.  Together, we can be more. We can be better.  Moda Health seeks to allow equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

Name: Deployment Analyst-
Description: Danone North America is the largest Benefit Corporation in the world. Our mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible.  Danone North America is looking for a Deployment Analyst--Danone North America in their Portland, Oregon manufacturing facility. Position Overview The Deployment Analyst reports directly to the Supply Chain Manager and is responsible for overall deployment of finished goods from plant production locations, distribution centers, and customer locations. Will be responsible for developing and monitoring deployment strategies that optimize costs and operational capacities for a specified category. The ideal candidate will possess the skills and knowledge sought below but, of equal importance, he or she will be self- motivated, organized, possess a positive attitude, demonstrate a hands-on approach and be an effective influencer. Responsibilities:Ensure overall deployment strategy is optimized and system planning parameters are adhered to. Conduct regular consistent reviews of all parameters and maintain database.Review and release daily/weekly deployment suggestions (STOs) to ensure accuracy and consistency.Manage issues and communicate with plants, DCs, Customer Service, Finished Goods Planners and Supply Chain counterparts.Review daily inventory levels at DCs to manage shelf life and customer orders to proactively address service issues and returns.Work with Distribution Centers/Plant Coolers to assist with capacity constraints and optimization strategies as appropriate. Responsible for accurate and consistent data accuracy throughout SAP to provide appropriate mid to long range plans and adjustments.Participate in weekly supply planning team meetings relating to finished good planning, deployment, forecasting and procurement to deliver key KPIs - Service, weeks of supply, loss and damage, forecast accuracy, material, obsolete minimization and sourcing optimizationTrack and report key KPIs – loss and damage, fill rate, plant customer sourcing, etc.Transportation budget goalsMake daily decisions on carrier selection to maximize lowest cost and highest service levels. Use the transportation management system to build efficient loads and build long term relationships with carriers to maximize equipment availability in difficult lanes and take advantage of low price opportunity (lean).Actively engage with Customer Service/Logistics, Coolers, Distribution Centers & Carriers to meet and exceed customer service levels & transportation related KPI’s.Productivity - Researching and implementing cost reduction / sustainability opportunities.Review and authorize all accessorial charges for payment. Keep lean data updated for proper routing and costing. Promptly review any rejected invoices and authorize / decline payment properly.Develop and work with internal & external partners on productivity initiatives.Multiple systems follow up and clean up required.Management of international and domestic shipments.Manage and forecast of supply materials for multiple warehouses.Independently manage multiple projects.QualificationsSupply Chain experience in Consumer Packaging Goods including supply planning preferred.Bachelor degree in Supply Chain Management/Logistics/Business or related degree.SAP/APO experienceEDI knowledge a plusProficient in Excel, Microsoft, PowerPoint, WordForklift certified trainer a plusDemonstrated understanding of supply chain processes and safety stock optimization strategies.Demonstrated understanding of deployment practices.Solid communication skills, particularly in highlighting issues and taking corrective action.Ability to set deadlines and key timetables to achieve with minimal guidance. Danone North America is a Certified B Corporation business unit of Danone and operates in the U.S. from headquarter offices in White Plains, NY and Broomfield, CO. For more information, please visit DanoneNorthAmerica.com.　  Danone North America is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other unlawful criterion.　#LI-NORAM  http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf Nearest Major Market: Portland Oregon Job Segment: ERP, Logistics, Supply Chain Manager, Supply, SAP, Technology, Operations

Name: Financial Analyst 5
Description: Provides financial analyses related to budgets, forecasting, allocation of expenses, ad hoc analysis for business case development and custom financial analyses, peer group analysis and internal consulting for all levels of management. Develops and maintains spreadsheets and statistical models for financial analysis. Prepares a variety of management presentations. Researches and resolves problems and errors in data from financial reporting systems. May provide assistance in the development of financial applications. May prepare interest rate pricing and forecasting information for use in asset and liability management.**Qualifications:**Basic Qualifications- Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting, and- Eight or more years of experience in financial analysis activitiesPreferred Skills/Experience- Considerable knowledge of financial analysis techniques and general accounting procedures- Excellent mathematical and analytical skills- Considerable knowledge of financial analysis, forecasting, and planning- Expert ability to identify and resolve exceptions and to interpret data- Master's degree preferred- Working knowledge in Microsoft Access- Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel**Job:** Accounting / Finance**Primary Location:** Oregon-OR-Tigard**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180042906**Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-MarshallU.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. Name: IT Operations Analyst
Description: DescriptionThe Oregon Health Authority is modernizing and expanding their IT infrastructure and currently has a fantastic opportunity for an IT Operations Analyst to join an excellent team and work to advance their IT operations.  The Oregon Health Authority promotes health equity by developing policies and programs to eliminate health disparities and reach health equity for all Oregonians. What you will do! As an IT Operations Analyst, you will assist the IT Director of Business Operations by providing support for agency-wide activities and initiatives including legislative coordination between agencies and management, workforce development coordination, governance, contracting, internal communications, analyzing data for performance metrics and reporting, and system and process improvement.   In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, facilitating, and implementing process improvements to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the Office of Information Services (OIS). You will develop and maintain ongoing communication links and contact with managers and other staff throughout the Oregon Health Authority (OHA) and the Department of Human Services (DHS). What's in it for you? Collaboration in an open office with a team of bright individuals to work with and learn from. We offer full medical, vision and dental with paid sick leave, vacation, personal leave and ten paid holidays per year. If you are interested in becoming our new IT Operations Analyst, don't delay, apply today!    This is a full-time, permanent position that is classified and represented by a union.  This position will be located in Salem at 3990 Fairview Industrial Drive SE. This recruitment announcement will be used to establish a list of qualified candidates to fill the current vacancy and may be used to fill future vacancies as they occur.The Oregon Health Authority is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer committed to work force diversity.Qualifications, Required & Requested SkillsMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:A Bachelor's Degree in Business or Public Administration, Behavioral or Social Sciences, Finance, Political Science or any degree demonstrating the capacity for the knowledge and skills; and two years of professional-level evaluative, analytical and planning experience involving IT Operations. OR;  Any combination of experience and education equivalent to five years of professional-level evaluative, analytical and planning experience involving IT Operations.Note: Transcripts are required as part of our interview process if you are using education or coursework to meet the minimum qualifications. Transcripts can be either be provided at the time of application or during an in-person interview. Transcripts must be from an accredited institution and clearly show 1) your name; 2) the name and address of the institution; 3) the degree received; 4) conferred date; and 5) required courses completed with a passing grade. For application purposes, photocopies are acceptable; however official or original documents may be requested to validate education. REQUESTED SKILLS:Experience using MS SharePoint for document sharing, communication and/or workflow automation. Ability to organize complex and sometimes competing projects. Experience working in a fast-paced environment and dealing with stressful situations. Experience handling multiple assignments and frequent interruptions. Ability to conceptualize and complete projects independently. Ability to effectively facilitate group meetings. Strong customer service skills in working with all levels of management and staff. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio and Project. Solid understanding of rules, regulations, policies and procedures, particularly as they related to OHA, DHS and OIS business operations. Strong analytical skills. Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills. Experience in promoting a culturally competent and diverse work environment.Applicants that meet the minimum qualifications and most closely match the requested skills will be invited for an interview.Additional InformationAPPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS To apply, please follow these steps. Complete the application. We will not accept a resume or position description in place of a completed application. Because of the volume of applications we receive, we do not review any attachments that we do not ask for. The work experience and/or education section of your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet all of the minimum and special qualifications listed above. If it does not, we are required to disqualify it. Complete the supplemental questions. Answers to the supplemental questions must be substantiated with the experience you listed in the work experience section of the application. If you say you have 10 years of experience in customer service, but don't show 10 years of experience in the application, you may be disqualified.ADDITIONAL APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS – PLEASE NOTE TWO ITEM ACTIONS BELOW: ***To apply please submit the following. A full online application is not required, but you must establish an account/user profile with the State of Oregon's E-RECRUIT system and submit the following materials:  Please attach a current resume (in pdf format) and be sure to highlight your relevant experience in IT OperationsPlease name the resume file: Resume OHA18-0901. Please attach a cover letter (in pdf format) addressing each of the Requested Skills listed above (no more than 2 pages in length). Please name the cover letter file: Cover Letter OHA18-0901.  Your resume must clearly show how you meet the minimum qualifications for the position and your cover letter must address each of the requested skills. If you do not attach the items listed above, you may not be offered an interview. Qualified applicants whose background most closely matches the requested skills as listed in the announcement above will be invited to interview. Caution: If you fail to follow these instructions, your application will be disqualified. Incomplete or late applications will not be considered.PRE-EMPLOYMENT CHECKS If you are offered employment, the offer will be contingent upon the outcome of an abuse check, criminal records check and driving records check, and the information shall be shared with the Oregon Health Authority (OHA), Office of Human Resources (OHR). Any criminal or founded abuse history will be reviewed and could result in the withdrawal of the offer or termination of employment. VETERANS INFORMATION If you are an eligible veteran and wish to claim veterans' preference points AND you also meet the minimum qualifications for this position, the points will be added to your score. To receive veterans' preference points you MUST attach the following required documentationto your electronic application. > A copy of your DD214/DD215 form; OR a letter from the US Dept. of Veterans Affairs indicating you receive a non-service connected pension for the five (5) point preference.  > A copy of your DD214/DD215 form; AND a copy of your veterans' disability preference letter from the Dept. of Veterans Affairs for the ten (10) point preference.  For more information on veterans' preference points visit www.oregonjobs.org, and select veterans' preference. PAY EQUITY The Oregon Health Authority is committed to fair employment practices and non-discrimination, including pay equity for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of protected class (race, sex, veteran status, disability, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation) in the payment of wages or screen applicants on the basis of their current or past compensation. We determine salary by completing a review of your application materials to evaluate your related education, experience and training for this position. NEED HELP? If you need assistance to participate in the application process, you are encouraged to call Noah Pokorny at 503-945-6970 (voice) 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (Pacific Time) Monday through Friday. TTY users please use the Oregon Telecommunications Relay Service: 1-800-735-2900.  For technical support, please call toll free 1-855-524-5627, for customer service assistance.  PLEASE CONSIDER JOINING US! The Oregon Health Authority (OHA) includes most of the state's health care programs, including Public Health, Health Policy and Analytics, Health Systems Division, and Oregon State Hospital. Incorporating the state's health care programs within one agency gives the state greater purchasing and marketing power to begin tackling the issues of cost, quality, and access to care.  OHA strives to create inclusive environments that welcome and value the diversity of the people we serve. OHA fosters fairness, equity, and inclusion to create workplace environments where everyone is treated with respect and dignity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, disability, physical stature, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, political affiliation and any other factor applicable by state or federal law. The Oregon Health Authority does not offer VISA sponsorships or transfers at this time. Within three days of hire, you will be required to complete the US Department of Homeland Security's I-9 form confirming authorization to work in the United States.
