Name: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description: This position is responsible for engineering efforts in support of the Research Data Warehouse (RDW). The focus is BI solution design, development, testing and implementation of ETL using a combination of Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), T SQL queries, PL/SQL along with SQL Server and Oracle database objects. The primary Data Source is Epic Clarity and the target is the Research Data Warehouse. This person will work with Microsoft SSIS packages and T SQL and Oracle PL/SQL to process Research and Clinical data to meet analytic requirements. This position will need to perform scoping and estimating on Data Warehouse activities. Present technical information and design proposals in easily understood terms in both verbal and written form. This position is also responsible for detailed technical analysis to assure the availability and accuracy of data processed by the ETL or contained in the OHSU Research Data Warehouse.Role:  Microsoft SSIS and TSQL, Oracle PL/SQL support, maintenance and development  Build and migrate SSIS projects, TSQL and database objects and perform necessary testing and validation such as unit testing during development and/or QA testing as required.  Share SQL Server SSIS, TSQL and related development expertise and provide support to data warehouse developers, data analysts, and users in the ETL migration and support of the Research Data Warehouse environment;  Develop and modify Oracle PL/SQL and related database objects in the ETL migration and support of the Research Data Warehouse environment;  Participate in peer code review sessions and offer suggestions that improve performance, maintainability, and best practice compliance;  Review and troubleshoot SSIS packages, TSQL and PL/SQL queries to address errors that occur during nightly and ad hoc processing;  Apply updates and ensure that data are loaded into the data warehouse according to defined requirements;  Maintain, support, and apply change data capture (CDC) processes for incremental loading of data  Apply standard data warehouse transformation concepts for the integration, validation, and organization of data necessary for loading into a dimensional data warehouse environment.  Perform query and process tuning and optimization  Follow change and version control procedures  Apply appropriate security structures and/or policies to data and/or database objects  Make recommendations on best practices for code maintenance, deployments, and migrations specific to SSIS Required: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, a related field, or a clinical field and six years work related experience  3 years experience applying advanced MS SQL server knowledge in the use of SSIS, T SQL and database object definition  3 years experience designing, developing, implementing and optimizing Oracle PL/SQL solutions  Experience supporting and maintaining a Data Warehouse and associated ETL in a MS SQL Server database  Knowledge of data warehousing architecture  Ability to read, write and maintain T-SQL and SSIS code, define and maintain, MS SQL Server database objects  Demonstrate Core Competencies as established for your position (Leading Self, Leading Others, Leading Leaders, Leading Function) Desired: Epic Clarity Experience  Experience in a data warehouse environment utilizing Epic Healthcare Data and Research Data  Proficiency working with Apache Hadoop based opensource tools such as Hive, Oozie, Spark, Kafka, Ranger, Falcon  Experience with Big Data environments such as Hadoop  Experience in a research or academic health care environment  Experience with HIPAA and PHI compliance  MS SQL Server Developer Certification  MS SQL Server Administrator Certification

Name: DURATIONAL: Cost Analyst
Description: Responsible for consulting with Regional Decision Support Services in costing clinical utilization data and balancing cost data back to regional financial statements, analyzing costed utilization to ensure that costs are spread correctly, and auditing the costing process to ensure that overheads and direct costs are allocated correctly. Reviews statistics used to allocate costs to ensure they are accurate when compared to utilization information. May be responsible for special analytical projects and research of data quality problems.Essential Responsibilities:Ensures timeliness and accuracy of the monthly costing process, including managing and monitoring work to ensure that work is completed within defined service level agreements. Obtains and loads clinical utilization data and work with regions to correct errors and ensure that utilization is mapped to the correct clinical department. Responsible for determining correct mapping of utilization to industry standard codes to get the relative value units. Responsible for allocating overhead costs to direct costs and auditing and analyzing results. Reports on status of the costing process to regional and central management. Analyzes and solves problems in utilization process, costing process, and supporting statistics and works with regional financial and clinical personnel to develop appropriate solutions. Provides Decision Support System (DSS) data consulting services to regional financial and clinical personnel on mapping of costs and statistics in support of the costing and analysis process. Responsible for providing consulting and expertise to other analysts in support of the costing process. Provides back-up for regional cost analysts.Basic Qualifications:ExperienceMinimum two (2) years of accounting or health care related financial experience EducationBachelor's degree in accounting, business administration, finance or healthcare related field, OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, RegistrationN/A Additional Requirements:Computer skills, including excellent knowledge of spreadsheets and a basic understanding of database applications and use of end-user tools such as AQT or MS Access and/or SQL to Access database tables and report writing, are required. Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications:Experience with Avega's Alliance for Decision Support System is preferred. Knowledge of Alliance for Decisions Support Application or other healthcare costing application is preferred.

Name: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Description: Johnstone Supply, Inc., the nation's largest HVACR distribution Cooperative, has an opportunity for a Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our team! This position is located at our corporate office in Portland, Oregon.  As a member of the Supply Chain team reporting to the Director of Supply Chain, the Supply Chain Data Analyst is responsible for working closely and cross functionally within the cooperative to organize, create, and maintain data for supply chain team initiatives, key performance indicators, and reporting. This role requires in depth analysis of large amounts of data in order to provide recommendations based on the findings while maintaining an appropriate level of confidentiality.  This role will provide techincal leadership and training for data collection best practices and analysis across the supply chain team. Key Responsibilities:Retrieve, organize, analyze, and maintain data using technology tools such as Excel, SQL, etc.Develop visually appealing visualizations and dashboards of data and process information for various levels of the organization.Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business initiatives.Develop and propose new metrics, recommend actionable intelligence to business stakeholders.Support cross-functional teams on the day-to-day execution of projects and initiatives.Assist in and/or lead process and continuous improvement opportunities within the supply chain team utilizing formal project management tools.Serve as a lead for system changes, upgrades, implementations, evaluations, etc. for the supply chain team.Share knowledge and skills for data analysis with the team by training and coaching team members.Serve as a liason between supply chain and IT technical staff.Manage improvement requests and provide leadership for prioritization of those improvements.Perform routine audits of systems and reports to ensure the highest level of performance and accuracy and identify problems and impliment solutions.Cross train with members of the supply chain team to ensure understanding of improvement opportuniites and continuity of business practice and analytics.Special projects or assignments as requested.Our Ideal Candidate Will Have:Bachelors (BA/BS) degree in Business, with preference given to a specialized degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Finance, or Statistics.Minimum of 3-4 years experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and other data analytic tools (Tableau, VBA, etc.)Advanced systems proficiencies including the use of Microsoft Office Suite of products.Ability to learn programming languages as needed.ERP experience preferred.Advanced mathematical skills, including statistical analyses.Demonstrated comprehension and skills with descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.Knowledge of supply chain inventory management principles and techniques, including key performance indicators.Advanced proficiency collecting and synthesizing large amounts of data to draw valid conclusions.Ability to use systems and tools to stay organized, using a consistent approach, with attention to details.Strong analytical skills and ability to use data and business knowledge to solve problems.Ability to approach work with a strong sense of urgency.Skill in developing effective working relationships with individuals from different organization levels.Strong professional written and verbal communication skills.Knowledge of product distribution operations.Ability to prioritize multiple tasks, get work done and meet deadlinesStrong needs assessment skills (listening and interpretation).Has the ability to assess the current processes and work with together to drive continuous improvements in processes familiarity with continuous improvement principles (lean/Six Sigma is a plus)Formal project management skills are preferredExpected Work Behaviors:Delivers value consistent with the Supply Chain team's values, mission, and vision statementMaintains confidentiality of information.Keeps the company's best interest in mind when considering or addressing issues.Desire to support and meet the needs of customers, other employees, and the Cooperative as a whole.Demonstrates a high level of interest and curiosity in learning more, developing his/her skills and growing as a professional. Johnstone has been in business for over 60 years and has grown into an industry leader, with 425 store locations and over $2 billion in annual sales. We work with some of the largest companies in the world, including Daikin/Goodman, Honeywell, Emerson, Johnson Controls, and Fujitsu, to provide our customers with excellent products, technical expertise, and quality service.  We offer a competitive wage, benefits that include medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), generous Paid Time Off, convenient location just off I-205 & Airport Way, and a great work environment. EOE We are an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.  If you want to view the EEO is the Law poster, please choose your language: English Spanish Arabic - Chinese  View Company Information  To see other positions, click here.SDL2017

Name: Dir, Membership Business Growth, America
Description: Job Description Nike, Inc. Retail Corporate is the backbone to stores around the world. A global network of teams - Finance, Human Resources, Talent Development, Marketing, Merchandising, Real Estate and Strategic Planning - direct the daily operations of Nike.com and the hundreds of Nike Stores and Nike Factory Stores. Retail Corporate teams share the same passion and energy for the brand as their in-store teammates, and it shows: Retail continues to be one of Nike's top areas of growth. Description Nike's Consumer Direct Offense is designed to serve the athlete faster and more personally, at scale, led by digital. With focused growth through key categories, this new offense will connect the NIKE Brand and products with consumers in new and more powerful ways. At the heart of the Consumer Direct Offense is Nike's new membership program that will provide member-only access to the products and experiences members love, matched to their individual preferences and behavior patterns. Our mission is to create the world's most distinctive membership program that accelerates consumer connections while driving growth and profitability for the Nike Brand.  The Role: We are looking for a data-driven growth hacker to join the North America Membership team in the newly created role of Director, Member Growth. This leader will create and manage the membership growth plan in North America, with a focus on managing a membership P&L, growth KPI's and targets as well as designing growth strategies to increase the growth and profitability of Nike's Membership program through the use of data analytics. This is a hands-on, cross functional role at the intersection of marketing and business and is focused on member acquisition, activation, retention and upsell. Ideal backgrounds for this role include leaders with expertise in operating digital business with a focus on driving consumer growth and monetization. Candidates should have experience building consumer-centric growth business models and both business and financial measurement.  This role will have strong influence on the future direction of Nike's membership program in NA, and we are looking for candidates with a track record of building and leading high performing teams in fast paced and complex environments, with a desire to be at the center of a massive transformation of Nike's digital and direct capabilities. Flexibility, drive, and communication capabilities will be critical characteristics. Key responsibilities of this role include: Define the NA member growth plan, design and execute growth programs with cross functional teams, and optimize the member funnel against growth KPIs and targets Develop economic analysis frameworks to support decisions related to member segments and benefit performance in NA and key cities Identify and prioritize opportunities to drive consumer-focused business growth through business analytics, and partner with cross functional teams bring new growth hacks to market quickly Help develop growth hacking, growth hacking learnings, and a culture of A/B testing and experimentation with data-driven hypotheses and reporting Operationalize the processes for tracking and assessing progress against goals, risks, and areas of opportunity Partner with Nike's NA finance team and consumer and business analytics teams to link activities within the membership program to Nike's P&L and growth funnel Lead and coach one direct report (Manager, NA Member Benefits Analyst) to maximize the impact of the Member Growth team Success for this role requires the establishment of a best-in-class membership program, driven by a strong understanding of both consumer connectivity and profitable growth. But beyond the core responsibilities, this role must also be a key contributor to the evolution of Nike's business model and the acceleration of the Consumer Direct Offense with membership at the center. Qualifications 8-12 years relevant experience in growth roles in media, marketing, consumer subscription business, or a startup Educational experience in Economics, Finance, and/or Business Strategy Experience in a startup environment and/or having a startup mindset A/B testing and data analytics experience Background influencing teams to drive business growth from loyalty/membership programs or digital commerce and technology at major global companies Experience applying behavioral economics in subscription or member-centric business models Experience developing economic models and decision frameworks Experience translating economic opportunities into compelling stories, influencing the work of cross-functional partners Experience with digital commerce and content platforms is a plus

Name: Bilingual Dutch-English Analyst-Healthcare web-site classification
Description: Bilingual Dutch-English Analyst-Healthcare web-site classification html, body { font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; }  Bilingual Dutch-English Analyst-Healthcare web-site classification Return to Job OpportunitiesLevel EntryJob Location OR - Portland, ORLegitScript, one of the Top 100 Workplaces in Oregon, is seeking an exceptional Analyst to join our team at our Portland, Oregon-based headquarters.Please apply via our corporate jobs page: https://www.legitscript.com/company/careers/Role Title: General AnalystProgram: Platform SweepsLanguage Required: Fluency in Dutch and English (reading, writing, and speaking)Role Purpose: The purpose of this role is to ensure that all websites, products, and merchants are classified and reported accurately, compliance issues are reported to clients, and client reports are submitted to meet the daily, weekly, and monthly deadline requirements. At this level, the employee is building foundational skills in order to become a full-fledged contributor to program work. There is an expected training period for all analysts. Over the course of the first year at LegitScript, an analyst should be fully contributing to a program or programs.Key Areas of Accountability: Key Area #1: Culture and Values AlignmentKey Area #2: Accurately classify websitesKey Area #3: Accurately classify productsKey Area #4: Client Reporting / Merchant EvaluationKey Area #5: Continuous TrainingKey Area #1: Culture and Values AlignmentTasks and ActivitiesEngage in behaviors aligned with LegitScript’s core values: Be Awesome, Be Open, Be Thoughtful, Be InvestedExhibit a growth mindset by being open to feedback, embracing change as an opportunityAccountabilitiesColleagues view employee as being aligned with LegitScript core valuesWelcomes feedbackTreats change as an opportunity to learn and growKey Area #2: Accurately Classify WebsitesTasks and ActivitiesAn analyst will classify and reclassify websites accurately. Analysts find new applicable websites to classify and add domain names to the database as well as maintain the integrity of currently stored data. Analysts create new and edit outdated classifications on a daily basis.AccountabilitiesAnalyst’s website classifications will be 95% accurate. The 5% of inaccuracy will be within a level 1 or 2 error. Analysts will follow the database best practice guidelines. For more information regarding accuracy, refer to the Training Overview and Expectations document.Key Area #3: Accurately Classify ProductsTasks and ActivitiesAnalysts classify and reclassify products accurately. Analysts research and find new products to classify and add to the database as well as maintain the integrity of currently stored data. They create new and edit outdated products classification on a daily basis.AccountabilitiesAnalysts will have 95% product classification and the 5% inaccuracy will be a level 1 or 2 error. Analysts will upload product classifications and seek guidance when classifying difficult products. For more information regarding accuracy, refer to the Training Overview and Expectations document.Key Area #4: Client Reporting / Merchant EvaluationTasks and ActivitiesAnalysts monitor and report all compliance issues in comprehensive client reports, following the guidelines set forth per contract. Analysts maintain the integrity of the data associated with the assigned contract. Analysts attend meetings and additional trainings associated with the assigned contracts. Analysts complete and submit an accurate, comprehensive report by given deadlines. Analysts will be responsible for multiple client reports that are not necessarily associated with the same contract. Analysts continue to improve and enhance the client reports. Analysts demonstrate an intermediate proficiency in Excel and other applicable computer programs. Analysts will analyze large sets of data, generate conclusions and a report under strict tight deadlines. Analysts will use various tools and research skills to evaluate merchants based on program parameters and established certification standards. Analysts will drive communication with merchants and create evaluation summaries as a basis for decision-making.AccountabilitiesWithin one month of working on a contract, analysts will have met client report deadlines 8 out of 10 times, and reports submitted past the reported deadline will be no later than 30 minutes. Within one month, following the feedback given, analysts will not have made the same error more than once for the same contract including feedback in regards to file formatting. The analyst’s reports will be 100% accurate following the review process.Key Area #5: Continuous Training Tasks and Activities Analysts will engage in learning more about the contract and programs associated with this role by asking questions and seeking advice from applicable program leads or supervisors, by reading relevant documentation, and/or performing additional research. Analysts along with their supervisors, will identify strengths, weaknesses, and interests in order to determine where continuous training might be applicable and how individual interests can be further pursued.Accountabilities Analysts will be capable of transitioning on to and/or working on three or more projects simultaneously independently, with minimal supervision. Analysts will demonstrate well rounded general knowledge about the company’s various programs. The analyst will drive the one-on-one meetings in order to seek out growth opportunities and information. Analyst will represent applicable program in client/merchant email interactions using sound, independent judgement and a high level of professionalism, with minimal supervision.Expected CompetenciesAligned with valuesGrowth mindset (receptive to feedback, learner)Detail-orientedIndependent/ResourcefulCuriousAble to work under pressureTech savvyAdaptableGood judgment/common senseClear communicatorBachelors Degree or equivalentExperience with large data sets (Excel)Bonus Competencies1-2+ years work exp, esp in relevant fieldDecision-making skillsManagement experience (project or people)Relevant additional language proficiencyMasters degreeRelevant specialty skill(s) [e.g., writing/editing, for FIT]Fluency in multiple languagesAbout LegitScript:We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. We share our expertise about high-risk online activity to empower businesses, governments, and consumers to make incremental changes that will result in a secure, more transparent internet. We catch bad guys.Our spacious, modern Pearl District office is cubicle-free with plenty of natural light. We have sit-to-stand convertible desks. Many of us bike to work and we have indoor bike parking. There's an ofﬁce dog. Our friendly in-house barista serves complimentary beverages every morning, and we have lots of catered lunches and social events. It's a small, culturally diverse company (about 90 people at present) where people work hard and love what they do. Starting salary for this position is between 40k to 50k annually.In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package:We contribute toward individuals and spouse/ dependents (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Flexible spending account - We contribute funds on your behalf and allow you to contribute pre-tax (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)401k with company matchLife insurance and short-term disability insurance policy that are both fully paid by employer (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Transportation package to help alleviate commuting costs (available immediately!)Generous Paid Time Off policyBonus: We offer full-time employees extra perks like company-paid massages, gift cards to local businesses, paid time off to volunteer, company sponsorship of your hobby, and group social outings! If you meet all of the requirements and would like to be considered, please respond to this ad with your resume and cover letter. For more information on us, please check out our website: legitscript.com.Return to Job Opportunities First Time User? Create Account Returning user? Please sign in!  Sign In  Forgot password? Name: Resolution Services Analyst

Daily Duties:  Provide primary support, escalation and resolution management for hardware, connectivity, and applications Work under general supervision, provides first line of support and problem Trust products and/or applications for the client business lines and external Trust clients Responds to inquiries and requests for assistance, and escalates issues as warranted, to include opening ITSM Tickets Analyzes simple to moderate issues and determines appropriate resolution Analyst will be required to recognize issues that should be escalated, and notify appropriate parties Identifies when procedures need to be updated and makes the appropriate changesREQUIREMENTS: 1-3 years related work experience Experience handling 80+ calls per day Must be responsible, prompt, timely, and reliable Previous call center experience would be nice to have Spanish speaking ability also a nice to have Must be willing to sit on-site in Downtown Portland, Oregon Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: CERNER FSI SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212776  Seeking a Cerner Millennium Foreign System Interface support analyst. Responsibilities include all support activities such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This is a remote position but must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Support includes being be part of the 24/7 on call rotation. Preferred candidates will have 5 years of Cerner experience, particularly around Cerner Core build and functionality.  ? Review interface design specs and integrate external applications with the Cerner Millennium suite  ? Work with business users to identify requirements for maintaining application tables, dictionaries, and parameters required for system operation and configuration  ? Understand current design and implications to process and workflow  ? Serve as primary contact for application design regarding new requirements  ? Provide support for testing and conversion activities  ? Install patches/fixes provided by the vendor in accordance with change control processes  ? Work closely with all area application analysts to coordinate and resolve cross-department design and implementation issues  Candidates should be prepared to be part of a multifunctional team and provide support where needed.  Cerner 2015.01.19 code level  Ability to understand the impact of interface issues on Cerner clinical applications  Expert understanding of both inbound and outbound processing  Expert understanding of both basic matching parameters and special interface configurations (SI_Manager)  Expert knowledge of interface monitoring tools, including all levels of Millennium logging and Olympus server monitoring  Expert knowledge of various levels of scripting required for interfaces  Strong CCL Skills a plus Qualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. Name: Taxation Analyst
Description: If you want to make a positive difference and stand out from the crowd, you’ll fit in at The Standard (www.standard.com). Through our retirement plans and insurance products and services, we help people achieve financial well-being and peace of mind. Come join us and share our passion for serving our customers in a positively different way.  The Taxation Analyst ensures accurate tax reporting for Disability Insurance Benefits, Life Insurance Benefits, and Producer Commissions. Analyzes group taxation structures and administrates claimant tax rate data within the Tax Rate Service. Evaluates and fulfills requests to correct tax reporting issued in error. Provides expertise to internal and external partners on low to moderately complex taxation topics. Contributes to Tax Knowledge documentation. Participates in small to medium scope operational improvement initiatives or projects. Build a network of contacts inside The Standard to share best practices and solve problems Provide expertise in response to tax related inquiries from multiple internal departmentsAnalyze taxation structures for group insurance customers; calculate taxability rates for complex groups; load and administrate data to the Claimant Tax Rate ServicePerforms controls to ensure accuracy of year-end tax reporting (e.g. reconciliations, manual adjustments, etc…)Research assigned IRS and State Regulations; document findings and contribute content to Tax knowledge documentationEvaluate errors in tax reporting and issues corrected tax statements and reports where applicableIdentify and implement opportunities for continuous improvement of departmental processesBuild a network of internal contactsEducation: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field Experience: 2-4 years of experience in accounting, tax, or group disability insurance, plus 1-2 years of experience researching and interpreting State & Federal regulatory topics or an equivalent combination of education and/or relevant experience. Professional certification required: none  Standard Insurance Company, The Standard Life Insurance Company of New York, Standard Retirement Services, Inc., StanCorp Equities, Inc. and StanCorp Investment Advisers, Inc., marketed as The Standard, are Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status or any other condition protected by federal, state or local law. The Standard offers a drug and alcohol free work environment where possession, manufacture, transfer, offer, use of or being impaired by an illegal substance while on Standard property, or in other cases which the company believes might affect operations, safety or reputation of the company is prohibited. The Standard requires a criminal background investigation, drug test, employment, education and licensing verification as a condition of employment. All employees of The Standard must be bondable.  For more information regarding your Equal Employment Opportunity applicant rights, click here.  Individuals with disabilities who need assistance or accommodation with the application process should contact HR Direct at 971-321-7871. This number is only for the use of individuals with disabilities who need accommodation with the application process. General inquiries about application status will not be addressed.

Name: Change Management Consultant
Description: APPLICATION DEADLINE: Open until filled  PGE's success is inextricably linked with the success of its customers and community. To be the most trusted energy partner, we must deliver exceptional customer experiences. We are doing this by investing in a reliable and clean energy future and by building a smarter, more resilient grid.  Change Management Consultant (R18-491)  This is a limited duration position for up to 2 years depending upon performance and business needs. Full benefits are included.  Are you ready to bring your best to maximize adoption, improve business performance, and unleash our employees' potential?  As part of the IT Integrated Security Program team, you will drive adoption of new processes, tools, and cultural behaviors of employees throughout the company to improve our security posture and protect our customers and our community. At the same time you'll be supporting a larger cultural transformation taking place within IT. Projects within the program include Security Awareness, Identity Access Management, and Multi-Factor Authentication. Success for the projects depends on behavioral changes among our wide range of employees, so we need your expertise, passion, and creativity.  To deliver these results, you'll take the role of change lead on one or more projects and collaborate with the IT change team to plan, prioritize, and execute change strategy and tactics. In addition to supporting the projects within the Integrated Security Program, you will have the opportunity to contribute to other IT projects, including the large-scale culture and transformational change taking place.  Change Management Consultant  Serve as organizational change consultant on mid-size to moderately complex projects. Assist in coordinating efforts of internal change agents, communications and training professionals to ensure an integrated change management effort.  Partner with project managers and business leaders as part of program team for initiatives and projects.  Consult with officers, managers, supervisors and individual contributors to assess change impacts of process, technology, organization structure, and policy shifts. Create change management plans to address and mitigate assessed impacts of change.  Design and implement appropriate interventions for improving employee adoption and morale, ensuring user readiness, preparing leaders for change, and supporting enhancing cultural shifts.  Design and develop change related communications and deliverables such as presentations, FAQs, newsletters, key benefits, roadshows, surveys etc.  Recommend and facilitate group and team dialogue such as planning sessions, employee focus groups, feedback sessions, process improvement and training  Change Methodology and Curriculum  Develop or enhance change management tools and methodology to build capability across the organization to lead change and improve personal resilience to change.  Design or enhance change/transition management training curriculums, and deliver training in a variety of forums.  Develop and utilize change measurements and metrics to measure and track the effectiveness of change interventions at individual and organization levels; using approaches including as examples; survey feedback, focus groups, 360-degree assessments, and custom designed measures. Interpret change measures and facilitate action planning with clients.  Thought Leader and Mentor  Stay abreast of best practices in change management and lead evolution and assist in the continuous improvement of change methodology and curriculum.  Serve as an organizational change consultant to clients and a mentor to internal change agents.  Bring the following skills to our team:  Thorough knowledge of organizational change, employee transition, organization design, and culture change theories, models, and techniques.  Demonstrated ability to build trust with executives, management and team; overcome resistance in different settings and work cultures, influence stakeholders, and lead without formal authority.  Solid project management skills; able to coordinate resources, establish schedules, track deliverables, and drive for results.  Excellent quantitative and qualitative problem-solving and analytical skills.  Thorough knowledge of training program design, adult learning theory, and state-of-the-art training techniques preferred.  Utility industry experience and leading change in a union environment with bargaining unit employees preferred.  The successful candidate will have a Bachelor's degree with Master's degree (preferred) in Organizational Development or Organizational Psychology or a related field. Certification in a change management approach such as PROSCI, and style assessment such as MBTI, Hogan, iOPT or similar. Typically 5-plus years of progressive experience in change management consulting. Experience requires performing in a lead change role on mid-size or moderately complex initiatives or projects such as a technology implementation, process redesign, or restructuring and previous people management experience leading a team of professionals.  Join us today and power your potential!  PGE is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. PGE will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.  To be considered for this position, please complete the following employment application by the deadline: https://PGN.igreentree.com/CSS_External/CSSPage_Referred.ASP?Req=R18-491. If you have any questions, please feel free to call us at 503-464-7250.  PGE believes in rewarding strong performance. We provide a total compensation package that is designed to reward your contributions to the company, and, at the same time, support your well-being and professional development, both now and into the future.  Assisting with storms or other Company emergencies is a part of all positions at Portland General Electric. Talent Acquisition Contact: Ee Xiong 503-464-7250 Staffing@pgn.com  Connect with us on Twitter (twitter.com/PortlandGeneral),  Facebook (facebook.com/portlandgeneralelectric) and  LinkedIn (linkedin.com/company/portland-general-electric) THIS IS AN INTERNAL / EXTERNAL JOB POSTING

Name: Change Management Consultant
Description: Title: Change Management Consultant Location: Portland, OR Area  Type: Contract  Job: LA432558119  At IGNW (formerly InfoGroup Northwest), we use our deep technical insights, local market knowledge and rock-solid relationships and reputation to create exceptional business outcomes for people and companies every day. We are based in Portland, OR with global partnerships to deliver the industry's top technical solutions and talent to every one of our clients. Our clients, consultants, contractors, partners and employees choose IGNW because we tackle the tough problems, and we care deeply about people while we do it.  We are proud to foster a great team working environment, to offer highly competitive compensation and to offer full benefits packages including medical, Flexible Spending Accounts, dental and vision. If you would like to learn more, join our team, or explore how IGNW can benefit your business, please reach out today!! Project Scope: Works closely with program manager, program sponsor, and IT change portfolio lead to ensure alignment and timely delivery of change management work in a multi-project portfolio with multiple change managers. Track change management timetables to prevent conflicts and leverage opportunities for synergy. Develop and execute program-level change roadmap and project-level change roadmaps as needed. Ensure consistency in approach and quality throughout program. Maintain strong, positive working relationships with change managers, project managers, and stakeholders throughout the company. Responsibilities:Serve as organizational change consultant on mid-size to moderately complex projects. Assist in coordinating efforts of internal change agents, communications and training professionals to ensure an integrated change management effort.Partner with project managers and business leaders as part of program team for initiatives and projects.Consult with officers, managers, supervisors and individual contributors to assess change impacts of process, technology, organization structure, and policy shifts. Create change management plans to address and mitigate assessed impacts of change.Design and implement appropriate interventions for improving employee adoption and morale, ensuring user readiness, preparing leaders for change, and supporting enhancing cultural shifts.Design and develop change related communications and deliverables such as presentations, FAQs, newsletters, key benefits, roadshows, surveys etc.Recommend and facilitate group and team dialogue such as planning sessions, employee focus groups, feedback sessions, process improvement and trainingDevelop or enhance change management tools and methodology to build capability across the organization to lead change and improve personal resilience to change.Design or enhance change/transition management training curriculums and deliver training in a variety of forums.Develop and utilize change measurements and metrics to measure and track the effectiveness of change interventions at individual and organization levels; using approaches including as examples; survey feedback, focus groups, 360-degree assessments, and custom designed measures. Interpret change measures and facilitate action planning with clients.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree required, with master’s degree preferred, in Organizational Development, Organizational Psychology or a related field.Certification in a change management approach such as PROSCI, and style assessment such as MBTI, Hogan, iOPT or similar.Typically, 5-plus years of progressive experience in change management consulting.Experience requires performing in a lead change role on mid-size or moderately complex initiatives or projects such as a technology implementation, process redesign, or restructuring and previous people management experience leading a team of professionals.Proven ability to prioritize complex and shifting task lists and timelinesProven ability to adjust to changing circumstances with a positive attitudeUtility industry experience and leading change in a union environment with bargaining unit employees preferred.Thorough knowledge of organizational change, employee transition, organization design, and culture change theories, models, and techniques.Intermediate level knowledge of consulting and coaching techniques and ability to implement change and provide coaching and feedback in a constructive manner.Ability to build trust with executives, management and team; overcome resistance in different settings and work cultures, influence stakeholders, and lead without formal authority.Excellent presentation, oral and written communication and group process/facilitation skills.Self-starter able to work independently, as well as collaborate on teams.Excellent quantitative and qualitative problem-solving and analytical skills.Strong proficiency with computers and technology, including Microsoft Office suite.Preferred - thorough knowledge of training program design, adult learning theory, and state-of-the-art training techniques. Please note: Our clients may require that candidates pass a drug and/or background check. To apply, please send your resume to: resumes@infogroupnw.com Oregon's Top 100 Best Companies to Work For - 3 years running  IGNW has earned the Best of Staffing Award for providing remarkable service to hiring managers and job seekers. Check it out!  https://www.bestofstaffing.com/agencies/ignw/  To view other IGNW opportunities please visit www.ignw.io  IN

Name: Location Planning Analyst
Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it?s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike Retail employees inspire athletes of all abilities to tap into their potential. Step into a Nike Store or visit nike.com, and feel the energy, enthusiasm and passion for sport. That same excitement and consumer-first mindset reverberates through the Nike Retail Corporate team. A global network of buyers, visual merchandisers, real estate specialists, store operations directors and others direct the daily operations of nike.com and the hundreds of Nike Stores and Nike Factory Stores worldwide. The team constantly defines the new frontier of retail and creates the most inspiring and engaging consumer experiences in the industry. *Description** As a Location Planning Analyst in Demand and Supply Management (DSM), you will develop in-depth, accurate and detailed strategic and tactical plans to maximize revenue and profitability by store while maintaining the brand image. You will participate in the development of annual financial forecasts at a store level. Responsibilities will also include managing and maintaining stores at operationally efficient capacities through review and adjustment to Sales, Inventory & Sell Through. This position will also require the analysis of historical data and current trends to identify both current and future opportunities to elevate the business at a store level. In addition, you'll collaborate with key business partners to develop a comprehensive strategy that aligns future financial and/or product opportunities by store. *Qualifications** ? Bachelor's degree preferred (in Business preferably)  ? 2 years planning experience for a multi-store retailer preferred  ? 2 years additional planning experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree  ? 3 Years in a Leadership Role in Retail Stores may be substituted in lieu of planning experience  ? Strong working knowledge of retail math, financial planning and store planning  ? Experience analyzing reports and data to make decisions that will positively impact the business  ? Strong proficiency in Excel, including creating conditional formulas, vertical lookups and pivot tables  ? Ability to work in a fast-paced environment balancing multiple priorities  ? Ability to travel up to 5% *Qualifications** ? Bachelor's degree preferred (in Business preferably) ? 2 years planning experience for a multi-store retailer preferred  ? 2 years additional planning experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree  ? 3 Years in a Leadership Role in Retail Stores may be substituted in lieu of planning experience  ? Strong working knowledge of retail math, financial planning and store planning  ? Experience analyzing reports and data to make decisions that will positively impact the business  ? Strong proficiency in Excel, including creating conditional formulas, vertical lookups and pivot tables  ? Ability to work in a fast-paced environment balancing multiple priorities  ? Ability to travel up to 5%  NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.  NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. *Job ID:** 00421038*Location:** United States-Oregon-Beaverton*Job Category:** Retail Corporate

Name: Outbound Logistics Product Analyst
Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike, Inc. Technology is responsible for making the world's largest sport brand run faster, smarter and more securely. From infrastructure to security and supply chain operations, Technology specialists drive growth through top-flight hardware, software and enterprise applications. Global Technology aggressively innovates solutions to drive growth while creating and implementing tools that help make everything else in the company possible.  Description  As a Product Analyst you will support initiatives that enable Niketo increase productivity, realize efficiencies and build profitable customerexperiences. If you're the one for this role, you'll be joining the NikeTechnology organization. Nike Tech brings together technology and processexpertise into one streamlined, consumer and customer-oriented team. You'll bejoining the team that delivers and supports the Logistics Agile Delivery modelwithin Nike's Supply Chain. This organization enables Nike, Inc.'s businessesand brands worldwide. Interest and experience in the latest methodologies goesa long way here and we're looking for people who are passionate about the worldof value-driven solution delivery and support. In addition, you'll get to work withinand alongside truly talented teams and help them enhance their performance bypromoting collaboration and innovation. In this role, you will:Be a member of an 8-10-person Agile Delivery Team that will utilize Agile principles.Participate in Program Increment (PI) planning sessions with the team's Product Owner, Scrum Master, and other Product Analysts to understand the business vision and create plans and objectives for the upcoming PI.Work with the team during the PI on the backlog of work for each iteration delivering value in 2-week Agile Sprints.Have the technical capability, or are willing to learn, within each Sprint to:Perform configuration within an SAP ERP software package.Work with application engineers to customize SAP to meet business needs.Work with integration engineers to develop links between SAP and other systems within the Nike Tech landscape as needed.Provide Quality Management (QM) testing support to all configuration changes and custom enhancements.Coordinate with other Agile Delivery teams to produce the successful implementation of end-to-end solutions via an Agile Release Train.Create technical documentation and system diagrams to document any enhancements to the product.Stay closely aligned with the Lead and Senior Product Analysts throughout the iteration.Demo to the business team all work delivered within each Sprint.Participate in a retrospective at the end of the PI to determine ways to continuously improve.Ensure standards, processes, and policies are followed. Apply global process standards to regional technology solutions.Qualifications To make it clear, we're not looking for just anyone. We'relooking for someone special, someone who has had these experiences and clearlydemonstrated these skills: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or other relevant subject area.Understanding of SAP AFS, FMS & S4 HANA or willing to learn about configuring those systems.Knowledge of other technologies used within a supply chain such as warehouse management systems (i.e., Manhattan) and system integration technologies (i.e., Fusion and/or Informatica, Amazon Web Services (AWS)) is a plus, but not a requirement.An understanding of Supply Chain processes is a plus.A general understanding of Agile project methodology and a willingness to learn the details.Excellent analytical skills and a desire to learn how to translate business functionality and opportunities into technical solutions.Can learn new business processes and can learn to understand the technology requirements needed to support those processes.Comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.Flexible, accountable, detail-oriented, ability to deal with ambiguity, and a demonstrated desire for continuous personal growth.Ability to work with onshore/offshore teams, and communicate using virtual communication tools (phone, conferencing, online meeting).Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical IT teams.Ability to pass a 7-year background investigation. NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.  NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.
