Name: Vulnerability Analyst
Description: Job ID: 37833***Not able to use 3rd Party Agencies***  Vulnerability Management Analyst Our client is seeking a Vulnerability Management Analyst to join their dynamic team in Hillsboro, OR. The Vulnerability Management Analyst is part of the CIS Security Operations Vulnerability Management Team, that participates in the attack surface reduction of global computing assets through the identification and assessment of vulnerabilities. The Vulnerability Management Analyst is responsible for analysis of the data generated by the vulnerability management solutions, coordination with external stakeholders regarding their patching program effectiveness and completion of day to day tasks associated with vulnerability management program. Vulnerability Management Analyst Responsibilities: Review security vulnerabilities across a variety of technologies and environments to determine high risk vulnerabilities to business assets.  Work with business stakeholders to ensure remediation efforts adhere to corporate standards and policies.  Provides analysis/validation of remediation actions taken, opportunities for improvements and out of the box thinking for optimizations and solving road blocks.  Schedule and perform reoccurring scanning activities of both corporate and cloud environments utilizing enterprise platform.  Interface with other CIS organizations such as Governance, Risk and Threat Intelligence to report on program status and coordinate risk tracking. Vulnerability Management Analyst Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cyber Security, or related discipline  2+ years of IT professional experience.  Understanding of a variety of technical concepts such as: Networking, systems administration, application development, cloud computing and information security best practices.  Experience with data analytics with the ability to provide qualitative analysis and recommendations.  Strong verbal and written communication skills.  Strong organizational and/or project management skills.  Ability to develop strong working relationships with a variety of other enabling teams.  Strong attention to detail, data accuracy, and data analysis.  Self-motivated and operates with a high sense of urgency and a high level of integrity. Strongly Preferred Qualifications: Professional experience in Information Security.  Vulnerability & Secure Code solutions such as Tenable Nessus, Rapid7 Nexpose, Qualys, WhiteHat, HP Fortify, Veracode, AppSpider.  Intermediate to Proficient in a scripting language such as Python, PowerShell.  Previous experience working in large scale environments with diverse technologies. Demonstrated technical experience with: Endpoint Operating systems such as Windows Servers, Desktops, Laptops, MacOS.  Server Operating systems such as Windows, Linux/UNIX Servers (Solaris, Red Hat Enterprise, Oracle Linux).  Cloud Computing (AWS & Azure).  Network Switching and Routing (Cisco, Juniper), Familiarity of TCP/IP and associated protocols. Benefits Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k. About VanderHouwen VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.

Name: Bilingual Hebrew-English Analyst-Healthcare web-site classification
Description: Bilingual Hebrew-English Analyst-Healthcare web-site classification  html, body {  font-family: 'Roboto', Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;  } Bilingual Hebrew-English Analyst-Healthcare web-site classificationReturn to Job OpportunitiesLevel EntryJob Location OR - Portland, ORLegitScript, one of the Top 100 Workplaces in Oregon, is seeking an exceptional Analyst to join our team at our Portland, Oregon-based headquarters.  Please apply via our corporate jobs page: https://www.legitscript.com/company/careers/ Role Title: General Analyst Program: Platform Sweeps Language Required: Fluency in Hebrew and English (reading, writing, and speaking) Role Purpose: The purpose of this role is to ensure that all websites, products, and merchants are classified and reported accurately, compliance issues are reported to clients, and client reports are submitted to meet the daily, weekly, and monthly deadline requirements. At this level, the employee is building foundational skills in order to become a full-fledged contributor to program work. There is an expected training period for all analysts. Over the course of the first year at LegitScript, an analyst should be fully contributing to a program or programs. Key Areas of Accountability: Key Area #1: Culture and Values Alignment  Key Area #2: Accurately classify websites  Key Area #3: Accurately classify products  Key Area #4: Client Reporting / Merchant Evaluation  Key Area #5: Continuous Training Key Area #1: Culture and Values AlignmentTasks and ActivitiesEngage in behaviors aligned with LegitScript’s core values: Be Awesome, Be Open, Be Thoughtful, Be InvestedExhibit a growth mindset by being open to feedback, embracing change as an opportunityAccountabilitiesColleagues view employee as being aligned with LegitScript core valuesWelcomes feedbackTreats change as an opportunity to learn and growKey Area #2:Accurately Classify WebsitesTasks and Activities An analyst will classify and reclassify websites accurately. Analysts find new applicable websites to classify and add domain names to the database as well as maintain the integrity of currently stored data. Analysts create new and edit outdated classifications on a daily basis. Accountabilities Analyst’s website classifications will be 95% accurate. The 5% of inaccuracy will be within a level 1 or 2 error. Analysts will follow the database best practice guidelines. For more information regarding accuracy, refer to the Training Overview and Expectations document. Key Area #3:Accurately Classify ProductsTasks and Activities Analysts classify and reclassify products accurately. Analysts research and find new products to classify and add to the database as well as maintain the integrity of currently stored data. They create new and edit outdated products classification on a daily basis. Accountabilities Analysts will have 95% product classification and the 5% inaccuracy will be a level 1 or 2 error. Analysts will upload product classifications and seek guidance when classifying difficult products. For more information regarding accuracy, refer to the Training Overview and Expectations document. Key Area #4:Client Reporting / Merchant EvaluationTasks and Activities Analysts monitor and report all compliance issues in comprehensive client reports, following the guidelines set forth per contract. Analysts maintain the integrity of the data associated with the assigned contract. Analysts attend meetings and additional trainings associated with the assigned contracts. Analysts complete and submit an accurate, comprehensive report by given deadlines. Analysts will be responsible for multiple client reports that are not necessarily associated with the same contract. Analysts continue to improve and enhance the client reports. Analysts demonstrate an intermediate proficiency in Excel and other applicable computer programs. Analysts will analyze large sets of data, generate conclusions and a report under strict tight deadlines. Analysts will use various tools and research skills to evaluate merchants based on program parameters and established certification standards. Analysts will drive communication with merchants and create evaluation summaries as a basis for decision-making. Accountabilities Within one month of working on a contract, analysts will have met client report deadlines 8 out of 10 times, and reports submitted past the reported deadline will be no later than 30 minutes. Within one month, following the feedback given, analysts will not have made the same error more than once for the same contract including feedback in regards to file formatting. The analyst’s reports will be 100% accurate following the review process. Key Area #5: Continuous TrainingTasks and Activities Analysts will engage in learning more about the contract and programs associated with this role by asking questions and seeking advice from applicable program leads or supervisors, by reading relevant documentation, and/or performing additional research. Analysts along with their supervisors, will identify strengths, weaknesses, and interests in order to determine where continuous training might be applicable and how individual interests can be further pursued. Accountabilities Analysts will be capable of transitioning on to and/or working on three or more projects simultaneously independently, with minimal supervision. Analysts will demonstrate well rounded general knowledge about the company’s various programs. The analyst will drive the one-on-one meetings in order to seek out growth opportunities and information. Analyst will represent applicable program in client/merchant email interactions using sound, independent judgement and a high level of professionalism, with minimal supervision. Expected CompetenciesAligned with valuesGrowth mindset (receptive to feedback, learner)Detail-orientedIndependent/ResourcefulCuriousAble to work under pressureTech savvyAdaptableGood judgment/common senseClear communicatorBachelors Degree or equivalentExperience with large data sets (Excel)Bonus Competencies1-2+ years work exp, esp in relevant fieldDecision-making skillsManagement experience (project or people)Relevant additional language proficiencyMasters degreeRelevant specialty skill(s) [e.g., writing/editing, for FIT]Fluency in multiple languagesAbout LegitScript:  We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. We share our expertise about high-risk online activity to empower businesses, governments, and consumers to make incremental changes that will result in a secure, more transparent internet. We catch bad guys.  Our spacious, modern Pearl District office is cubicle-free with plenty of natural light. We have sit-to-stand convertible desks. Many of us bike to work and we have indoor bike parking. There's an ofﬁce dog. Our friendly in-house barista serves complimentary beverages every morning, and we have lots of catered lunches and social events. It's a small, culturally diverse company (about 90 people at present) where people work hard and love what they do. Starting salary for this position is between 40k to 50k annually.  In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package: We contribute toward individuals and spouse/ dependents (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Flexible spending account - We contribute funds on your behalf and allow you to contribute pre-tax (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)401k with company matchLife insurance and short-term disability insurance policy that are both fully paid by employer (available on the first of the month following a month's employment)Transportation package to help alleviate commuting costs (available immediately!)Generous Paid Time Off policy Bonus: We offer full-time employees extra perks like company-paid massages, gift cards to local businesses, paid time off to volunteer, company sponsorship of your hobby, and group social outings!  If you meet all of the requirements and would like to be considered, please respond to this ad with your resume and cover letter. For more information on us, please check out our website: legitscript.com.Return to Job Opportunities First Time User?  Create Account  Returning user? Please sign in!  Sign In  Forgot password?

Name: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE CERNER CLAIRVIA SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Other Locations: US-IL-Chicago  Job Number: 18212361  CTG is seeking a resource to support the ClairVia workforce application utilized for clinical staff scheduling and determining patient acuity. There are three programs in the ClairVia software suite: CVM Client, CVM Web and CVM Administrator. This resource should be familiar with NPAS Assessments imported from Cerner to measure patient acuity.  Responsibilities include all support such as incidents, service/change request, routine maintenance. This position is remote. Must be on site for knowledge transfer (3-6 weeks) at the start of project. Will be part of on call rotation.  Census Mismatch  Due to workflow issues between Cerner and ClairVia, there will be instances where the census (i.e. patient list) in ClairVia will not be the same as the census in Cerner Millennium (i.e. PowerChart). This will present itself to users as ClairVia either having extra patients or missing patients. Resolution involves finding out the erroneous patient?s FIN (AKA encounter number) and checking Cerner records to manually transfer or discharge the patient accordingly.  Interface issues  There are interfaces between ClairVia and Clockwork, Banner / HR Front End, and the production ADT interface. The Clockwork and Banner interfaces deal with new users / employees being imported to ClairVia. The HR import file needs to be checked to ensure the new employees have their correct cost center coming across.  System Down  Multiple users cannot access ClairVia. Confirm if it is one or all ClairVia applications that cannot be accessed (Web or Client ). Ping the relevant servers and gather relevant information to engage the vendor and the sever team.  Patient Acuity? Manage patient acuity based on NPAS assessments? NPAS (Nurse Patient Assessment System) powerform data imported real-time from Cerner? Custom tool developed by UIMC in 2005? Not used by all units, some use Clairvia acuity (such as 8E Psych) while others use different acuity systems (such as Surgical Services and the Emergency Department) while others don?t use an acuity system? Acuity used for patient assignment of RNs and NTs  Common Requests  Access Request of various levels of access and New builds for nursing units/clinics based on user specifications Other applications supported include:Healthstream Morrisey MSOWAllscripts SCMSunquest LISGE MUSE/PowerScribe 360/Provation MDMcKesson EnterpriseRxCerner Millennium/TransChart/Teletracking XTMidas Plus/VizientOptum Computer Assisted CodingQualifications: CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).  CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.  CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.  Job: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Name: Digital Supply Chain Service & Performance Analyst
Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike, Inc. knows how to sell sneakers. And apparel. And just about everything an athlete could need. The Nike Sales teams are the front line for getting these products into customer hands. Through sustained relationships with wholesale partners around the world from a specialty store in Rome to a department store in midtown Manhattan Nike Sales delivers the products, experiences and brand stories that define the brand. Nike's success begins with the best sales team in the industry, one that deeply appreciates the consumer, the marketplace, and the products.  Description  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders, and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike Supply Chain experts ensure that every year 1.3 billion pieces of footwear, apparel, and equipment arrive at the right destination on time. That's no easy task. The complex process involves more than 60 distribution centers, a network of thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores around the world. Supply Chain professionals constantly push for ways to make Nike's supply chain faster, more efficient and more responsive to Nike's always-changing consumer needs.  As a member of Nike's Digital Supply Chain team, you will work alongside experienced advanced analytics and internal subject matter experts passionate about driving innovation in Nike's supply chain strategy and operations. We are inventing Nike's supply chain of the future and solving operations challenges to improve performance and create sustainable competitive advantage.  The Digital SC Service & Performance Analyst works in a fast-paced environment to help Nike solve challenging strategic supply chain questions. They think critically to tackle difficult challenges and are seeking a continuous learning, high-growth opportunity where they can have an immediate impact. They have strong quantitative background in operations research and statistics, data analysis and modeling as well as knowledge of supply chain optimization, operations, and inventory management. They are strong communicators who are endlessly curious, who take pride in hard work and are committed to rapidly advancing their knowledge and expertise. QualificationsBA or MSc in Statistics, Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or similar quantitative focus plus 1-3 years of professional experience. In lieu of a degree an additional 5 years of experience is acceptable.Strong quantitative (i.e. statistics, optimization, simulation, machine learning), data visualization and communication skillsExperience in visualization, coding, big data technologies, data science and/or modeling software preferred (e.g., Tableau, SQL, Alteryx, R, Python, AIMMS, AnyLogic, Llamasoft Supply Chain Guru, Rapid Miner, Spark)Demonstrated ability to learn new advanced analytics toolsets quickly and independentlyAbility to communicate complex concepts simply, verbally and in writing. Ability to create high quality project reports and simple, succinct, visually compelling PowerPoint presentationsAnalytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems independently in ambiguous situations with limited directionExceptional interpersonal skills to collaborate and team well with project manager(s) and a diverse geographically diffuse set of "virtual" team members and stakeholdersWorking knowledge of supply chain management concepts a plusAbility to effectively present information; respond to questions from leadership team, clients, and colleagues; influence decision making; and implement project deliverablesAbility to develop project plans including the creation of detailed work plans and timelines NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.  NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.  Job ID 00410754

Name: Program Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to support change management implementations for workplace programs that result in significant change to the organization. This role works closely with the Program Manager to implement change management programs on behalf of clients experiencing significant workplace change. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Support implementation of workplace change programs and tracks change management activities on the ground  Ensure training, activities, and change events are scheduled and tracks engagement  Manage all aspects of small to medium workplace change programs  Evaluate the progress of the program to ensure that the timeline is followed steadily and consistently  Solve discrete problems, delivers clear requests for information, and demonstrates flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks  Perform important administrative functions for the Program Manager, which might include updating the program schedule, taking minutes at meetings, and writing progress reports  Convey ideas clearly in an oral and written manner, one-on-one and in small groups  Lead change and program team meetings and captures risks and dependencies across work streams  Capture and documents change process and best practices to ensure consistent and repeatable change management approach is playbook ready  Create deliverables in support of change management implementation plan  Document, update, and manage client engagement and communication plans on workplace programs  Update and manage program intranet site as applicable  Create presentations, communications and other client-facing materials  Assist and facilitate customer-facing workshops as part of the change process  Develops internal relationships with sponsors, business leads, program managers, change champions and others impacted by the changeAdditional Responsibilities: Prepares and presents results of analysis for projects overseen by the PMO, along with their relative impact(s) to the business to all levels of management.  Uses status provided from activity owners to update and analyze project schedules to determine schedule slippage and other program related issues. Conveys impact of these issues to Program Managers and/or project teams.  Based on input from program managers and other team members, determines required revisions and adjusts project schedules accordingly. Maintains version control of project schedules, charters, and other project documentation.  Designs, generates, reviews and understands PMO processes. Uses aggregate data from multiple sources to create a complete analysis, improvement and/or recommendation(s).  Reviews the accuracy of information provided and responds to requests from management, client, and project teams.  Creates, maintains & distributes routine PMO reports, including status reports and Gantt charts.  Coordinates involvement of personnel from other departments and information technology groups to facilitate successful project implementations or process improvements.  Accountable for project close out process, including collecting/auditing project documentation.  Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for key PMO systems/processes including providing knowledge transfer to teams and day-to-day functions.  Other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  The ideal candidate is someone comfortable working in a client-facing capacity who enjoys solving complex problems in often ambiguous and demanding circumstances. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES Intermediate skills with Microsoft Office Suite including MS Project. Organizational skills and the ability to think critically. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Name: Senior IT Hardware Asset Analyst - Nike Technology
Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it?s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike Technology designs, creates and implements the methods and tools needed to make the world?s largest sports brand run faster, smarter and more securely. Global Technology teams aggressively innovate the solutions needed to help employees navigate Nike's rapidly evolving landscape. From infrastructure to security and supply chain operations, Technology specialists drive growth through top-flight hardware, software and enterprise applications. Simply put, without Nike Technology, there are no Nike products. *Description** As a Senior IT Hardware  Asset Analyst you will be asked to identify, record, maintain, monitor, audit  and document Information Technology assets. This analyst position will perform  regular audits of company owned infrastructure, hardware and software assets. You  will have the ability to work both independently and in conjunction with other  analysts to provide asset auditing and status reporting, ensures software licensing  compliance as it relates to the manufacturer contracts, and audits and  identifies issues related to the information technology asset management (ITAM)  processes and procedures. Also as an analyst you will participates in cross  platform projects relating to services associated to assets and configuration  management processes and maintain and support the cellular device management. Responsibilities: Conducting licensing  audits, identify and resolve potential compliance issues relating to vendor contract  requirements and to information technology asset management (ITAM) policies and  procedures. Coordinates with other departments to identify and correct assets anomalies  and ensure compliance in the various departments.  Performs data collection and analysis of all software and hardware throughout  the enterprise in order to identify, analyze and recommend changes to software  and hardware purchases, inventories, reporting including decommissioning and  asset recovery to mitigated associated risks.  Assist with policies and processes throughout the entire lifecycle including requisitions,  provisioning, logistics, deployment receipt, identification, categorizations,  recording, reporting, and documentation of information technology assets to  include hardware and software assets.  Participates in the development for configuring, designing, maintaining and  supporting the asset management system for service life-cycle management;  ensures appropriate updates are made to the asset management system. Provide  management with recommendations for updates to the development of asset  standards that include the identification, classification, and control of  assets including asset recovery and decommissioning. Name: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST
Description: Title: REMOTE EPIC CLIENT SUPPORT ANALYST  Location: United States  Job Number: 18212620  CTG is looking for a Clinical IT Associate Application Analyst (Tier 1) will support a large Health System client for CTG Health Solutions and is responsible for providing service desk functionality in support of health care delivery specifically in Epic Systems. Must have previous experience supporting Ambulatory or Inpatient systems ? either as an analyst or Help Desk resources with Application Specific first call resolution.  ? Prefers prior experience with EpicCare EMR in some capacity ? Trainer, Go Live Command Center, Help Desk Technician, Application Analyst non certified.  ? Provide prompt escalation of application/system problems including assisting in determining root cause of problems through to appropriate solutions.  ? Must have a broad understanding of information technology and the ability to adapt to new technologies is essential. Able to deal with ambiguity and change and handle multiple projects and tasks.  ? Must possess ability to function independently and collaborate effectively on a team.  ? Must be self-directed and able to work remotely  ? Name: Sr. Sales Analyst - Global Distributors
Description: As part of the International Distributor team, the Sales Analyst will be responsible for wide-ranging reporting and analytics inclusive of weekly, monthly and seasonal business review reporting. This position will ensure all information and analytics are communicated for the successful achievement of business and sales plans. This position will engage the sales team, the distributors directly and proactively provide information to sales, product, and sales operations teams to support and drive strategic account planning; and internal support to the organization by means of reporting and analysis.Responsibilities:Generate and provide Sell-Through summary reports to Internal Sales team within an agreed upon calendar cadence.Present sales analysis to leadership during bookings seasonally.Generate and provide Sell-In summary reporting, analytics and ad hoc requests to cross-functional management teams.Provide Regional Sales Managers constructive analysis with suggestions for improvements during seasonal pre-lines and booking timeframes to create sales driving assortments based on sell-through analytics and market trends.Work with Regional Sales Managers and planning team on current and future season forecasting. Identify opportunities and liabilities on product based on sales history, current stock position, and market trends to maximize production runs and internal gross margins.Monitor sales and stock trends; suggest reorders on fast sellers and suggest alternative measures on slow sellers. Communicate open bulk concerns based on sales trend, re-projections, and inventory position.Work closely with Regional Sales Managers and distributor’s buying/planning teams to identify top and bottom performing doors to ensure proper allocation of goods; collaborate to build regional/market store clusters to improve sales, margins and turnover.Develop relationships with distributors to understand their regions, business models, channels, and business structure.Perform other duties as assigned.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree specializing  in finance, business, economics or equivalent andthree to five years of  experience in retail buying or retail planning, preferably with International  experience and/or in a sporting goods or department store environment or  similar experience with retail forecasting and sales analysis at the wholesale  level.Strong computer proficiency in  MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, Access and Power Point) with preferred experience  in Power BI and MicroStrategy reporting applications.Possess advanced knowledge of  merchandising, buying, product allocation, and retail sales analysis.Ideally have International  experience and advanced knowledge of retail math and pricing strategies with an  in-depth knowledge of open to buy and the financial planning process at the  retail level.Possess knowledge of the  outdoor industry, sporting goods channel, department store channel, consumer’s  buying patterns and retail dynamics sufficient to be credible and influential  with customers.Ability to read, write, and  speak English.Proficient in manipulating data  including statistical analysis and advanced math calculations. Excellent  organizational and presentation skills and attention to detail required.Ability to conduct interpersonal  interactions with distributors and other company personnel. Ability to operate independently and follow  general guidelines.Physical ability to use  telephone, computer hardware/software including keyboard, type, sit and stand  for extended periods of time. This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company. A Lead Analyst must develop expert knowledge of, as well as ability to make decisions in, all content areas monitored by the program. At this level, the employee must have demonstrated the ability to lead the day-to-day execution of a program and to have strong leadership potential. The purpose of this role is to develop the program leadership skills of employees. There is a strong component of supervision for this role. Employees at this level are looked to as emerging leaders and it is important that they embody the LegitScript values. There is an expected training period for all analysts (currently 60-90 days).  Candidates must be authorized to work in the US. Name: Sr. Treasury Analyst
Description: Logistics done differently.At XPO Logistics, we look for employees who take pride in their work and show dedication to their job. As a member of the Corporate Treasury Team, the Senior Treasury Analyst will be responsible for daily cash management, funds transfers, and bank account management. In addition, you will be responsible for balance reporting and special projects related to global cash. On our team, you'll have the support to excel at work, and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.Pay, benefits and more.We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and the opportunity to participate in a company incentive plan.What you’ll do on a typical day:Support daily operations relating to bank account and fund transfersPrepare daily treasury cash activity report and short-term cash forecastComplete regular bank account management and control reviewsManage monthly bank fee analysis processes, including working with banking partners to process credits, correct billing errors, set up, update, or close bank accounts or services; monitor and analyze bank feesAssist regional treasury centers in performing their daily treasury operations such as cash management and fund transfersWork on special projects related to cash, repatriation, and liquidityDevelop and manage strong internal controlsEnsure system security for all banking systems and the treasury management systemWhat you need to succeed at XPO:At a minimum, you’ll need:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or BusinessIt’d be great if you also have:Advanced degree in Finance or Accounting4 or more years of relevant business experienceBe part of something big.XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. We’re the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and we’re just getting started.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran, or other protected status.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Name: Dir., Strategic Business Analytics Global Integrat
Description: Job Description Nike, Inc. Retail Corporate is the backbone to stores around the world. A global network of teams - Finance, Human Resources, Talent Development, Marketing, Merchandising, Real Estate and Strategic Planning - direct the daily operations of Nike.com and the hundreds of Nike Stores and Nike Factory Stores. Retail Corporate teams share the same passion and energy for the brand as their in-store teammates, and it shows: Retail continues to be one of Nike's top areas of growth. Description Innovation is in our DNA,and that groundbreaking spirt extends beyond cutting-edge products.Aforward-thinkingmindset,coupledwithan insatiable drive to serve the consumer, influences every aspect of our business. With a focus on consumer knowledge and marketplace analytics, Nike will usher in a new era of personalized performance that will revolutionize how we create products, services and experiences.We seek proactive leaders with deep expertise in commercial-facing analytics to help Nike make the most of every digit.Show us your vision.  We are a growing team responsible for building a holistic view of Nike's consumers through data and analytics, and applying those insights to inform the development & growth of Nike's digital commerce business through Nike.com and our Apps.  The right individual will understand the intricacies of the Digital business and understand the opportunities that digital can drive for the Nike brand.  Key responsibilities: Lead a team of analysts to drive business reporting, insights development and delivery and business diagnosis Leverage data and analytics to proactively identify risks and opportunities with Nike's digital business teams and influence decisions and strategies to drive revenue and consumer engagement Serve as an expert in using transactional and consumer data to drive business growth across a complex ecosystem of digital experiences, business models and multiple geographies Strategically manage a portfolio of projects and capabilities across the team to ensure appropriate prioritization, resourcing and maximum business impact Develop and drive global standards, reporting frameworks and best practices across all geographies, including annual budget process, reporting and web analytics Partner with Business Intelligence, Data Enablement, Digital Products and Data Engineering teams to deliver business requirements and develop new data capabilities Lead, coach, inspire and develop team and talentQualifications Qualifications Education: Degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics, applied math, operations research, behavioral sciences, Business, Finance, Economics, Marketing. Advanced Degree preferred but not required. Experience: 10+ years of professional level experience in a related role Relevant professional experience with an emphasis on Retail or Digital Commerce Business Experience leading a team and driving results Required Skills: Demonstrated track record leading high performing and engaged teams Passion for business analytics and working with large amounts of data with demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making Excellent communication and presentation skills to senior leadership Strong project management capabilities to manage multiple project streams with a focus on prioritization, resourcing and timely business impact Proven experience building positive working relationships and working successfully in cross-functional teams, including demonstrated success in managing and influencing without direct authority A strong understanding of advanced analytic techniques, particularly related to measuring consumer & business outcomes in a digital commerce setting Fluency in SQL Experience with clickstream tools including Adobe Analytics / Omniture, Google Analytics or Optimizely Experience with Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Visualization tools, e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, MicroStrategy, Tableau

Name: Business Consulting Senior Manager
Description: Percipio Consulting Group is a provider of operational improvement, risk management and business-technology integration consulting. Percipio helps clients to identify and assess business improvement opportunities, and manage change initiatives which effectively ‘operationalize’ business strategy through process and technology solutions. Founded in 2001, Percipio has delivered business-critical engagements for Fortune 500 and emerging companies alike, in industries ranging from Merchant Energy and Utilities to Financial Services and High-Tech Manufacturing. Percipio is headquartered in Portland, Oregon.Job DescriptionPercipio is seeking talented and entrepreneurial individuals to join in our success. Consultants will apply their skills in project management and delivery while exhibiting leadership in organizational change, process design, risk analysis and controls design, and technology solution selection and deployment. We adapt to client environments, are focused on excellence in project delivery, and do whatever it takes to exceed client expectations.  Percipio’s consulting team is comprised of three groups: Operational Improvement, Risk and Controls Management and Business-Technology Integration. Manage large scale projects and programs consisting of Percipio, client and 3rd party resourcesWork with technical and business staff to ensure all project deliverables, requirements and dependencies are metDesign, track and monitor scope, budget, schedule and quality for multiple concurrent projects or programsDevelop and present high quality deliverables to all levels of client managementParticipate in business development, negotiations and client relationship managementSupport multiple delivery offerings across our service lines such as software selections and business process design and mappingMentor, coach and retain Percipio staffPosition based in Portland, Oregon with potential travel required RequireMENTS Extensive project management experience involving the management of multiple resources and successful delivery of various types of projectsStrong business acumen – ability to understand business fundamentals and implications of changeProven experience managing project budgets, schedules, scope, issue escalation and other project management skillsWillingness to be involved with detailed project delivery work at all levelsAbility to clearly define and articulate delivery expectations to clients and project teams including roles and responsibilities definitionAbility to analyze project risks and proactively identify solutionsExperience with formal process engineering/design or process improvement methodologyAbility to gain consensus and manage delivery and expectations in more unstructured or dynamic environments such as clients experiencing high growth, resource or budget constraints or large business changesAbility to step into existing projects mid cycle and quickly implement project governance and structureStrong organizational skills and attention to detail Education & Experience Bachelor’s or Masters degree – Preferably in Business, Finance, Accounting or EngineeringSeven years of Business Consulting and Project Management experienceEnergy or Manufacturing/Supply Chain experienceEnterprise software project experienceERP project management experience preferredGlobal Firm consulting background preferred Please submit the form below with ‘Business Consulting Senior Manager’ in the subject line for consideration.

Name: Fusion Engineer - Technical Analyst
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) proven professional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle)*Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.*Are you interested in being part of a dynamic andfast paced team supporting Oracle s newest Supply Chain Management andManufacturing offering? At Oracle Fusion, we deliverSupply Chain Management / Manufacturing solutions in the Cloud (SaaS) and on-premiseto leading companies worldwide, across multiple industries.*_Department Description:_*The Fusion Supply Chain ManagementSupport Team, located in Colorado Springs, Colorado is expanding to support ourrapidly increasing customer base in the Cloud (SaaS). The team partnerswith Oracle Development in supporting early adopters and many other newcustomers.
