Name: Program Analyst - Technology
Description: Job DescriptionNike, Inc. Technology is responsible for making the world's largest sport brand run faster, smarter and more securely. From infrastructure to security and supply chain operations, Technology specialists drive growth through top-flight hardware, software and enterprise applications. Global Technology aggressively innovates solutions to drive growth while creating and implementing tools that help make everything else in the company possible.  Description  Nike Technology designs, creates and implements the methods and tools needed to make the world's largest sports brand run faster, smarter and more securely. Global Technology teams aggressively innovate the solutions needed to help employees navigate Nike's rapidly evolving landscape. From infrastructure to security and supply chain operations, Technology specialists drive growth through top-flight hardware, software and enterprise applications. Simply put, without Nike Technology, there are no Nike products.  Our team needs a strong Program Analyst. If you're the one, here's what you'd be responsible for: Purpose The Program Analyst coordinates the execution of all aspects of an ongoing program including planning, organizing, scrutinizing, and monitoring program activities.  Primary Duties and Responsibilities  The Program Analyst performs a wide range of duties, below is a sampling of some of the activities.  Plan the program Assist in planning the delivery of the overall program and its activities in accordance with the mission and the goals of the organizationSupport creation of frameworks, strategy and collateral for overall program successCoordinate new initiatives to support the strategic direction of the organizationAssist in developing and management of an annual budget and operating plan to support the program Organize the program Verify that program activities operate within the policies and procedures of the organizationCoordinate the collection and maintenance of meeting notes, action items and deliverablesPrepare and track action plans as defined by the ProgramManage the delivery of projects, programs and solutions Lead the progra m Mentor and support program staff by providing direction, input and feedbackCommunicate and liaise with clients, employees, management and other stakeholders to gain support for the program and to solicit input to improve the programCoordinate the delivery of products and services among different program activities to increase organization effectiveness Control the program Monitor and report on program activities including leadership elevation of status, issues and risksIdentify and evaluate the risks associated with program activities and take appropriate action to control the risksConduct regular program evaluations to identify areas for improvement and report findings and recommended changes to leadershipPlan, direct, and coordinate activities of a multi-team or cross-functional organization.QualificationsA passion for technology and solving interesting challenges.Proven problem solver and pragmatic thinker.Self-starter and takes ownership in the quality of work being delivered.Current knowledge of project/program management best practices. Understanding of agile delivery methods is a plus.At least 3 years of experience working in technology.Bachelor's d egree in business, computer science, journalism, or equivalent work experience.Skilled in one or more of the following: Project Leadership, Marketing, Business Analytics, Sales, Administration or Management.Possess the ability to translate business requirements into technical direction.Collaborative mind, able to work with a team to deliver world-class solutions.Strong written and verbal communication skillsDemonstrated track record of working within complex organizations requiring strong influencing skills - ability to work cooperatively at all levels in a matrixed environmentDemonstrated facilitation skills and experience in managing stakeholder relationship, partnership and interactionsExceptional collaboration, listening, written and verbal communication skills with ability to facilitate strategy, requirements and architecture conversations with all stakeholders (management, business users, and technology resources)Self-starter with high motivation and passion who thrives in fast-paced environment with the ability to adapt to change

Name: MANAGEMENT ANALYST (TITLE 32)
Description: As a MANAGEMENT ANALYST (TITLE 32), GS-0343-9, this position is located in the Maintenance Group of an Air National Guard (ANG) flying Wing. The primary purpose of this position is to evaluate and manage the Wing's Aviation Petroleum, Oil & Lubrication (AVPOL) program; serves as the Wing Refueling Document Control Officer (WRDCO); manages all aspects of the Unit's Flying Hour Program funds; and provides support to the supply functions within the Group. Formulates and consolidates budget inputs, trend analysis, and execution evaluations of all Maintenance Group funding requirements. 1. Serves as the primary point of contact for unit Aviation Petroleum, Oil, and Lubricants (AVPOL) program. Monitors AVPOL consumption to determine the rate of usage against command standards. Ensures the accuracy of billing conducted within the scope of the AVPOL program IAW AFI 11-253, Managing Off-Station Purchases of Aviation Fuel and Ground Services. Reconciles Defense Energy Support Center (DESC) interfund-billing/AIR Card® transactions with the AVPOL Data Management System. 2. Identifies and validates requisitions from base organizations for the non-stock listed, sole source or technical order (T.O.) directed flying hour goods or services. Routinely coordinates with the Base Contracting Office, National Guard Bureau (NGB), DOD Logistics Centers and commercial sources to identify the source of supply being most advantageous to the Government. Coordinates the movement of assets to and from Wing maintenance organizations.  3. Consolidates annual maintenance operating budgets for incorporation into the overall Wing's annual financial plan. Performs in-depth analysis of financial plan for all Maintenance Group production squadrons, flights, and sections. Evaluates trends and operating costs which are used in projecting future obligations. Performs analysis of completeness, accuracy, and reasonableness of all Maintenance Group operating budgetary information. Develops/issues guidance and coordinates with Maintenance Production Squadron Chiefs in the development of quarterly and annual maintenance operating budget and budget estimates.  4. Perform other duties as assigned.*The above description only mentions a limited amount of the position's official duties. For a full comprehensive document that covers all the duties of the position, please contact one of the Recruitment Specialist at the bottom of the announcement.*AREAS OF CONSIDERATION: Area 1 - Current permanent or conditional Title 32 Technicians of the Oregon ANG. Area 2 - Current permanent or conditional Title 5 Employees of the Oregon ANG. Area 3 - Current service members in the Oregon ANG.  Area 4 - Individuals in the Active Duty US Air Force, Air Force Reserve, or Air National Guard who hold or have held the AFSC. Area 5 - US Citizens eligible to meet the military requirements for membership in the Oregon ANG. GENERAL and SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Your submitted documents will be reviewed for the competencies, knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to perform the job duty listed above. Within your resume you will need to detail your capabilities. You will need to demonstrate 24 months of experience which has shown work involved in developing, analyzing, evaluating, advising, or improving the effectiveness of work methods and procedures, organizations, manpower utilization, distribution of work assignments, management controls, and similar functions of management. Experience, education, or training in administrative, professional, investigative, technical or other responsible work which demonstrates analytical ability and a practical and theoretical knowledge of the functions, processes and principles of management. Experience using computer and automation systems along with the detailed specialized experience related to this position. A review of your qualifications will be conducted to determine if you are qualified for this job. Qualified candidates will be assigned to a quality category. The quality categories are: 1. Highly Qualified: Candidates in this category possess exceptional skills and experience to exceed well above the minimum requirements for this position. 2. Well Qualified: Candidates in this category possess good skills and experience above the minimum requirements for this position. 3. Qualified: Candidates in this category meet the minimum education and/or experience requirements for this position. Your rating will be based on both your entire application package as well as the responses to the assessment questionnaire. Please note that if, after reviewing your resume and or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and or experience, your category rating can and will be adjusted to more accurately reflect your abilities, or you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. In order to qualify for this position you must: Submit complete resume and other required supporting documentation as necessary. This job does not have an education qualification requirement.

Name: System Analyst
Description: Installs new software releases and system upgrades, evaluates and installs patches, and resolves software related problems. Performs system backups and recovery. Maintains data files and monitors system configuration to ensure data integrity. May require a bachelor's degree in a related area with at least at least 6 years or equivalent experience in the field or in a related area. Has advanced knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job. Primary job functions do not typically require exercising independent judgment.  The purpose of this request is to procure System Administrator Services centered primarily around the Bentley Projectwise technology. This position is located within the ODOT Technical Services/Strategic Services Branch. The following are typical responsibilities for this position.  Position is responsible for the day-to-day troubleshooting and production issues associated with the data being stored in the ProjectWise database, and access to that data. Specific areas of support include:Datasource creation and setupUser account maintenanceUser rights and file access setup and maintenanceCoordination of training of new usersPlanning and implementation of new software and updatesBulk file import, export, and reference file scanningOversight and testing of backup and disaster recovery proceduresHelpdesk support for internal usersHelpdesk support for external usersTroubleshooting of production file issues (missing, corrupt files, etc.)Troubleshooting of access issues (login, restrictions, etc.)Primary contact as Columbia River Crossing Projectwise AdministratorOther criteria for this position: The following criteria apply to well-qualified ProjectWise Administrator candidates: Understands CADDUnderstands StandardsUnderstands MicroStation WorkspacesHas a facilities design backgroundEagerness to learnQuickly learns softwareSees the big picture (company culture, climate, etc)Able to mix and match technology to best suit user’s needsPrevious ProjectWise experience (as a user and/or admin)

Name: Sales Financial Analyst
Description: Sales Financial Analyst - 9120 Work Location  US - OR, Wilsonville Req ID 9120 Job Category  FinanceApply NowCompany: Mentor Graphics  Job Title: Sales Financial Analyst - 9120  Job Location: USA – OR - Wilsonville  Job Category: Finance  Mentor Graphics, a Siemens Business is a leading global provider of software for the design of complex electronics, contributing to the creation of everything from cell phones to airplanes. Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design. Founded in 1981, the company is headquartered in Wilsonville, OR (Portland). Job Duties: The Sales Financial Analyst position will require the ability to thrive in three critical functions; financial, business, and data analysis. As a member of the Sales Finance & Operations Team reporting to the Sales Finance Controller, this position provides a unique opportunity to proactively engage in providing financial support for a complex sales organization, interface with senior leadership, and build relationships cross functionally. Through collaboration, communication, and leadership this position will contribute to meaningful decision support and analysis supporting Sales and Business Unit management, Corporate and local Finance teams, and others on relevant topics.  The successful candidate will be: (1) a curious individual who can interpret business problems and ambiguous requests for information, (2) someone who can develop an in-depth understanding of financial planning, forecasting, and reporting processes and methods, (3) a person that enjoys turning data into insight, often through complex financial models and analysis, (4) an individual that can adhere to a specific process and facilitate requests to meet specific deadlines through effective time management, and (5) able to clearly communicate results using a method which meets the need of the particular audience including executive levels. Responsibility Areas: Planning and Forecasting: Coordinate consistent planning and forecasting activities across the broader sales organization. Proactively monitor and strive to maintain high levels of data quality, accuracy, and process consistency throughout planning and forecasting efforts. Utilize deep and thorough understanding of the overall planning, forecasting, and financial environment to support maintaining and enhancing business processes, systems, and methodologies to best support managing the business.  Reporting, Analysis, and Insight: Measures, analyzes, and reports results to support informed, fact-based business decisions which drive improved performance and results across multiple sales channels. Support common understanding of financial and sales data from multiple sources; this may involve starting with a fairly ambiguously defined problem, identifying trends and issues, synthesizing, and reporting the results in a consistent way. Develop, socialize, and report consistent assessment of historical performance. Support the development and implementation of financial and sales analytics to enable the global sales organization to successfully execute on selling strategies, build greater customer intimacy, and achieve sales goals.  Communication: Synthesize complex data into easily understood and compelling analysis and management reports including supporting the development of financial dashboards, presentations, and other documentation to communicate in a succinct, easy-to-understand manner, to all levels of the organization. Act as a trusted advisor and leader when creating presentation material regarding the performance of the business and confidently present to executive level audience.  Ad-hoc: Engage on projects as needed relating to the advancement of finance and sales initiatives. Job Qualifications: • 5+ years of experience supporting a multi-national software company in a sales operations or finance capacity  • Experience working with complex, matrixed organizations and multi-system environments  • High level of analytical ability with experience coordinating complex decision-analysis  • Skilled at developing & presenting executive-level communications and data visualization  • Proven business partner capable of influencing others  • Strong proficiencies in financial data modeling and business intelligence: Excel, PowerPoint, CRM, Business Objects, Qlikview, and Tableau  • Bachelor’s degree required (Finance, Business, Mathematics, etc.); MBA preferred  Other Qualifications  • Passion for sales finance; understanding the sales process and related data  • Ability to bring creativity to the position while striving for continuous improvement  • A passion for independent learning and personal development  • Capable of exercising sound judgment and to instill confidence  • Meticulous attention-to-detail  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills  • Technical aptitude - Ability to quickly learn new systems  • Ability to adapt to internal policies/ processes / procedures and changing direction of a task/project  • Outgoing, professional and articulate; great customer & communications skills  • Ability to multitask, prioritize a variety of tasks and meet deadlines  • Must be reliable and heavily resourceful in solving issues  • Amiable, professional who enjoys daily interaction with peers and client groups; natural ability to form professional relationships with all levels and departments within the company Mentor Benefits Mentor Graphics believes in fostering a work environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance. Our world class benefits package includes 401k matching, annual performance reviews/bonuses, education reimbursement, partially paid Medical/Dental/Vision insurance, Life, Short/Long Term Disability, and a generous time off plan. Our Wilsonville site also has the following onsite: 24/7 workout facility, full service cafeteria, child development center, basketball courts, sand volleyball, and daily exercise classes. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, color, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Name: Vulnerability Management Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Vulnerability Management Analyst in Hillsboro, Oregon (OR).  Summary:  The Vulnerability Management Analyst is part of a management team, that participates in the attack surface reduction of global computing assets through the identification and assessment of vulnerabilities. The Vulnerability Management Analyst is responsible for analysis of the data generated by the vulnerability management solutions, coordination with external stakeholders regarding their patching program effectiveness and completion of day to day tasks associated with vulnerability management program.  Job Responsibilities:  Review security vulnerabilities across a variety of technologies and environments to determine high risk vulnerabilities to business assets Work with business stakeholders to ensure remediation efforts adhere to corporate standards and policies Provides analysis/validation of remediation actions taken, opportunities for improvements and out of the box thinking for optimizations and solving road blocks Schedule and perform reoccurring scanning activities of both corporate and cloud environments utilizing enterprise platform Interface with other CIS organizations such as governance, risk and threat intelligence to report on program status and coordinate risk trackingREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cyber Security, or related discipline 2+ years of IT professional experience Understanding of a variety of technical concepts such as: networking, systems administration, application development, cloud computing and information security best practices Experience with data analytics with the ability to provide qualitative analysis and recommendations Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong organizational and/or project management skills Ability to develop strong working relationships with a variety of other enabling teams Strong attention to detail, data accuracy, and data analysis Self-motivated and operates with a high sense of urgency and a high level of integrity Strongly Preferred:  Professional experience in information security Vulnerability and secure code solutions such as Tenable Nessus, Rapid7 Nexpose, Qualys, WhiteHat, HP Fortify, Veracode, AppSpider Intermediate to proficient in a scripting language such as Python, PowerShell Previous experience working in large scale environments with diverse technologies Demonstrated technical experience with:  Endpoint Operating systems such as Windows servers, desktops, laptops, MacOS Server operating systems such as Windows, Linux/Unix Servers (Solaris, Red Hat Enterprise, Oracle Linux) Cloud Computing (AWS and Azure) Network switching and routing (Cisco, Juniper), familiarity of TCP/IP and associated protocols Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Technical Analyst - SAS Data Associate
Description: The Technical Associate position is an intermediate consulting staff position. This job is qualitative and quantitative in nature. Projects can range from industry research and data collection to preparation of statistical, financial and other forms of data analysis. Must have experience with SAS and the ability to utilize various tools such as Excel and Python to analyze data. Experience working with Microsoft Excel needs to include complex formulas, pivot tables, and charting.  Key Accountabilities: Accountable for fully understanding how to construct the Company's standard analysis schedules; develops good understanding of the proprietary programs used to create them and the underlying purpose of each schedule Accountable for preparing more complicated schedules with the expectation that a minimum of your time will be spent on standard analysis Provides leadership and regular coaching to Analysts Consults with case managers and experts regarding case work product Accountable for preparing technical work product and presentation materials through the use of computer modeling, including the development of comprehensive and complex work product Accountable for progress towards discussing/explaining Bates Group products with case managers and providing input into how to address case issues Adheres to firm administrative policies, professional conduct and practices Assumes other duties as assigned by management BS or BA from an accredited college or equivalent experience working in professional services; accounting, legal or financial services2-3 years relevant experienceTechnical knowledge – Ability to utilize SAS and Python etc. to analyze data. High level experience with Microsoft Excel including experience in complex formulas, pivot tables and charting.Research skills - Ability to gather, analyze, and summarize data from client databases, public and commercial databases and specialized industry resourcesOrganizational skills - Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlinesInterpersonal skills – Applies flexibility when faced with multiple project deadlines; exceptional capability to work independently and as part of a team, and interact with all levels of staff and managementComprehension and Business Writing - Ability to read and interpret general and specialized business periodicals, professional journals and government regulations, and proofread reports and business correspondence written in English; able to follow written and oral instructionsClient facing ability and strong communication skills – both written and verbalStrategic thinking and excellent organization and time management skillsActs in line with the company’s core values: principled, accountable, connected to the client, independent, exhibits strong work ethic, provides quality services and products, values the company's employees, has fun, and values leadership

Name: Senior Process Analyst - Quality, North America Marketplace Operations
Description: At Nike, we serve athletes. Fueled by the insights of the world's best, we design and create products to elevate human potential on a global scale. And it's on us, the Global Operations Team (GOT), to help bring this mission to life.  We are a diverse lineup of thousands spread across the globe. Together, we are building a smarter, more connected and automated value chain. And we are looking for world-class talent like you to contribute to this journey.As part of North America Marketplace Operations (MPO), the Quality teams role is to improve operational performance throughout the supply chain for both wholesale and Nike Direct. As our Senior Quality Analyst, you will collaborate across NA MPO, Global MPO, Customer Finance, DCs, Logistics and the broader Supply Chain to holistically drive effective and efficient Quality processes. Our senior analyst leads projects and develops quality related MPO processes to improve operational quality end to end.The senior quality analyst should be an expert on quality processes and a coordinator of new efforts to reduce errors. The analyst challenges status quo, drives analysis to optimize business results & process KPIs, and enables seasonal execution.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESDrives medium to large projects in collaboration with subject matter experts across NA MPO and broader Supply Chain partnersDrives business process improvement efforts to ensure standardization, efficiencies and best practices are employed and check/adjust when neededActively engage in data and process analysis/identifying process opportunities. Participate in problem solving activities (data gathering, root cause analysis and potential solutions)Work with and maintain close relationships with MPO Account teams, Customer Finance, Sales, and NA DCs on vendor compliance and shipping integrity to reduce vendor deductionsPrioritize incoming emails, requests, and questions to ensure timely, effective, and efficient responses while still addressing top prioritiesEnsures collaboration to coordinate plans and drive business results, process excellence and capability developmentDrive buy-in and alignment across all levels of MPO and Operations FOR THIS ROLE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS ARE REQUIRED: Intermediate ExcelMS OfficeProject ManagementExcellent communication skillsSAP Order Management (nice to have)QualificationsBachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related fieldMinimum of 5 years relevant work experience in supply chain related work experienceAbility to professionally communicate (verbal/written) to a wide range of audiences across multiple levels of the organizationThe ability to multitask with an awareness of tight deadlinesLead/drive and influence problem solving activities (data gathering, root cause analysis and potential solutions) and demonstrate end-to-end process thinkingDemonstrate strong leadership skills by actively seeking information and listening to key constituents, understanding what needs to be achieved and influencing change when needed

Name: Change Management Consultant
Description: APPLICATION DEADLINE: Open until filled  PGE's success is inextricably linked with the success of its customers and community. To be the most trusted energy partner, we must deliver exceptional customer experiences. We are doing this by investing in a reliable and clean energy future and by building a smarter, more resilient grid.  Change Management Consultant (R18-491)  This is a limited duration position for up to 2 years depending upon performance and business needs. Full benefits are included.  Are you ready to bring your best to maximize adoption, improve business performance, and unleash our employees' potential?  As part of the IT Integrated Security Program team, you will drive adoption of new processes, tools, and cultural behaviors of employees throughout the company to improve our security posture and protect our customers and our community. At the same time you'll be supporting a larger cultural transformation taking place within IT. Projects within the program include Security Awareness, Identity Access Management, and Multi-Factor Authentication. Success for the projects depends on behavioral changes among our wide range of employees, so we need your expertise, passion, and creativity.  To deliver these results, you'll take the role of change lead on one or more projects and collaborate with the IT change team to plan, prioritize, and execute change strategy and tactics. In addition to supporting the projects within the Integrated Security Program, you will have the opportunity to contribute to other IT projects, including the large-scale culture and transformational change taking place.  Change Management Consultant  Serve as organizational change consultant on mid-size to moderately complex projects. Assist in coordinating efforts of internal change agents, communications and training professionals to ensure an integrated change management effort.  Partner with project managers and business leaders as part of program team for initiatives and projects.  Consult with officers, managers, supervisors and individual contributors to assess change impacts of process, technology, organization structure, and policy shifts. Create change management plans to address and mitigate assessed impacts of change.  Design and implement appropriate interventions for improving employee adoption and morale, ensuring user readiness, preparing leaders for change, and supporting enhancing cultural shifts.  Design and develop change related communications and deliverables such as presentations, FAQs, newsletters, key benefits, roadshows, surveys etc.  Recommend and facilitate group and team dialogue such as planning sessions, employee focus groups, feedback sessions, process improvement and training  Change Methodology and Curriculum  Develop or enhance change management tools and methodology to build capability across the organization to lead change and improve personal resilience to change.  Design or enhance change/transition management training curriculums, and deliver training in a variety of forums.  Develop and utilize change measurements and metrics to measure and track the effectiveness of change interventions at individual and organization levels; using approaches including as examples; survey feedback, focus groups, 360-degree assessments, and custom designed measures. Interpret change measures and facilitate action planning with clients.  Thought Leader and Mentor  Stay abreast of best practices in change management and lead evolution and assist in the continuous improvement of change methodology and curriculum.  Serve as an organizational change consultant to clients and a mentor to internal change agents.  Bring the following skills to our team:  Thorough knowledge of organizational change, employee transition, organization design, and culture change theories, models, and techniques.  Demonstrated ability to build trust with executives, management and team; overcome resistance in different settings and work cultures, influence stakeholders, and lead without formal authority.  Solid project management skills; able to coordinate resources, establish schedules, track deliverables, and drive for results.  Excellent quantitative and qualitative problem-solving and analytical skills.  Thorough knowledge of training program design, adult learning theory, and state-of-the-art training techniques preferred.  Utility industry experience and leading change in a union environment with bargaining unit employees preferred.  The successful candidate will have a Bachelor's degree with Master's degree (preferred) in Organizational Development or Organizational Psychology or a related field. Certification in a change management approach such as PROSCI, and style assessment such as MBTI, Hogan, iOPT or similar. Typically 5-plus years of progressive experience in change management consulting. Experience requires performing in a lead change role on mid-size or moderately complex initiatives or projects such as a technology implementation, process redesign, or restructuring and previous people management experience leading a team of professionals.  Join us today and power your potential!  PGE is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. PGE will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.  To be considered for this position, please complete the following employment application by the deadline: https://PGN.igreentree.com/CSS_External/CSSPage_Referred.ASP?Req=R18-491. If you have any questions, please feel free to call us at 503-464-7250.  PGE believes in rewarding strong performance. We provide a total compensation package that is designed to reward your contributions to the company, and, at the same time, support your well-being and professional development, both now and into the future.  Assisting with storms or other Company emergencies is a part of all positions at Portland General Electric. Talent Acquisition Contact: Ee Xiong 503-464-7250 Staffing@pgn.com  Connect with us on Twitter (twitter.com/PortlandGeneral),  Facebook (facebook.com/portlandgeneralelectric) and  LinkedIn (linkedin.com/company/portland-general-electric) THIS IS AN INTERNAL / EXTERNAL JOB POSTING

We are based in Portland, OR with global partnerships to deliver the industry's top technical solutions and talent to every one of our clients. Interpret change measures and facilitate action planning with clients.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree required, with master’s degree preferred, in Organizational Development, Organizational Psychology or a related field.Certification in a change management approach such as PROSCI, and style assessment such as MBTI, Hogan, iOPT or similar.Typically, 5-plus years of progressive experience in change management consulting.Experience requires performing in a lead change role on mid-size or moderately complex initiatives or projects such as a technology implementation, process redesign, or restructuring and previous people management experience leading a team of professionals.Proven ability to prioritize complex and shifting task lists and timelinesProven ability to adjust to changing circumstances with a positive attitudeUtility industry experience and leading change in a union environment with bargaining unit employees preferred.Thorough knowledge of organizational change, employee transition, organization design, and culture change theories, models, and techniques.Intermediate level knowledge of consulting and coaching techniques and ability to implement change and provide coaching and feedback in a constructive manner.Ability to build trust with executives, management and team; overcome resistance in different settings and work cultures, influence stakeholders, and lead without formal authority.Excellent presentation, oral and written communication and group process/facilitation skills.Self-starter able to work independently, as well as collaborate on teams.Excellent quantitative and qualitative problem-solving and analytical skills.Strong proficiency with computers and technology, including Microsoft Office suite.Preferred - thorough knowledge of training program design, adult learning theory, and state-of-the-art training techniques. Please note: Our clients may require that candidates pass a drug and/or background check. To apply, please send your resume to: resumes@infogroupnw.com Oregon's Top 100 Best Companies to Work For - 3 years running  IGNW has earned the Best of Staffing Award for providing remarkable service to hiring managers and job seekers. Name: Location Planning Analyst
Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it?s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike Retail employees inspire athletes of all abilities to tap into their potential. Step into a Nike Store or visit nike.com, and feel the energy, enthusiasm and passion for sport. That same excitement and consumer-first mindset reverberates through the Nike Retail Corporate team. A global network of buyers, visual merchandisers, real estate specialists, store operations directors and others direct the daily operations of nike.com and the hundreds of Nike Stores and Nike Factory Stores worldwide. The team constantly defines the new frontier of retail and creates the most inspiring and engaging consumer experiences in the industry. *Description** As a Location Planning Analyst in Demand and Supply Management (DSM), you will develop in-depth, accurate and detailed strategic and tactical plans to maximize revenue and profitability by store while maintaining the brand image. You will participate in the development of annual financial forecasts at a store level. Responsibilities will also include managing and maintaining stores at operationally efficient capacities through review and adjustment to Sales, Inventory & Sell Through. This position will also require the analysis of historical data and current trends to identify both current and future opportunities to elevate the business at a store level. In addition, you'll collaborate with key business partners to develop a comprehensive strategy that aligns future financial and/or product opportunities by store. *Qualifications** ? Bachelor's degree preferred (in Business preferably)  ? 2 years planning experience for a multi-store retailer preferred  ? 2 years additional planning experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree  ? 3 Years in a Leadership Role in Retail Stores may be substituted in lieu of planning experience  ? Strong working knowledge of retail math, financial planning and store planning  ? Experience analyzing reports and data to make decisions that will positively impact the business  ? Strong proficiency in Excel, including creating conditional formulas, vertical lookups and pivot tables  ? Ability to work in a fast-paced environment balancing multiple priorities  ? Ability to travel up to 5% *Qualifications** ? Bachelor's degree preferred (in Business preferably) ? 2 years planning experience for a multi-store retailer preferred  ? 2 years additional planning experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree  ? 3 Years in a Leadership Role in Retail Stores may be substituted in lieu of planning experience  ? Strong working knowledge of retail math, financial planning and store planning  ? Experience analyzing reports and data to make decisions that will positively impact the business  ? Strong proficiency in Excel, including creating conditional formulas, vertical lookups and pivot tables  ? Ability to work in a fast-paced environment balancing multiple priorities  ? Ability to travel up to 5%  NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.  NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. *Job ID:** 00421038*Location:** United States-Oregon-Beaverton*Job Category:** Retail Corporate

Name: Outbound Logistics Product Analyst
Description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  Nike, Inc. Technology is responsible for making the world's largest sport brand run faster, smarter and more securely. From infrastructure to security and supply chain operations, Technology specialists drive growth through top-flight hardware, software and enterprise applications. Global Technology aggressively innovates solutions to drive growth while creating and implementing tools that help make everything else in the company possible.  Description  As a Product Analyst you will support initiatives that enable Niketo increase productivity, realize efficiencies and build profitable customerexperiences. If you're the one for this role, you'll be joining the NikeTechnology organization. Nike Tech brings together technology and processexpertise into one streamlined, consumer and customer-oriented team. You'll bejoining the team that delivers and supports the Logistics Agile Delivery modelwithin Nike's Supply Chain. This organization enables Nike, Inc.'s businessesand brands worldwide. Interest and experience in the latest methodologies goesa long way here and we're looking for people who are passionate about the worldof value-driven solution delivery and support. In addition, you'll get to work withinand alongside truly talented teams and help them enhance their performance bypromoting collaboration and innovation. In this role, you will:Be a member of an 8-10-person Agile Delivery Team that will utilize Agile principles.Participate in Program Increment (PI) planning sessions with the team's Product Owner, Scrum Master, and other Product Analysts to understand the business vision and create plans and objectives for the upcoming PI.Work with the team during the PI on the backlog of work for each iteration delivering value in 2-week Agile Sprints.Have the technical capability, or are willing to learn, within each Sprint to:Perform configuration within an SAP ERP software package.Work with application engineers to customize SAP to meet business needs.Work with integration engineers to develop links between SAP and other systems within the Nike Tech landscape as needed.Provide Quality Management (QM) testing support to all configuration changes and custom enhancements.Coordinate with other Agile Delivery teams to produce the successful implementation of end-to-end solutions via an Agile Release Train.Create technical documentation and system diagrams to document any enhancements to the product.Stay closely aligned with the Lead and Senior Product Analysts throughout the iteration.Demo to the business team all work delivered within each Sprint.Participate in a retrospective at the end of the PI to determine ways to continuously improve.Ensure standards, processes, and policies are followed. Apply global process standards to regional technology solutions.Qualifications To make it clear, we're not looking for just anyone. We'relooking for someone special, someone who has had these experiences and clearlydemonstrated these skills: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or other relevant subject area.Understanding of SAP AFS, FMS & S4 HANA or willing to learn about configuring those systems.Knowledge of other technologies used within a supply chain such as warehouse management systems (i.e., Manhattan) and system integration technologies (i.e., Fusion and/or Informatica, Amazon Web Services (AWS)) is a plus, but not a requirement.An understanding of Supply Chain processes is a plus.A general understanding of Agile project methodology and a willingness to learn the details.Excellent analytical skills and a desire to learn how to translate business functionality and opportunities into technical solutions.Can learn new business processes and can learn to understand the technology requirements needed to support those processes.Comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.Flexible, accountable, detail-oriented, ability to deal with ambiguity, and a demonstrated desire for continuous personal growth.Ability to work with onshore/offshore teams, and communicate using virtual communication tools (phone, conferencing, online meeting).Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical IT teams.Ability to pass a 7-year background investigation. NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
